review: Where to begin with Rocket League...I noticed that at first sight my thoughts on Rocket League was "Looks silly and not interesting at all".Then I bought it to play with a friend of mine and man oh man did my opinion change.Currently one of my top favorite games and after 600 hours of play only I still love every single moment.The only downside personally is that there are no local servers here in South Africa so we're stuck playing on EU servers which hangs around a 200 ping but with it being stable it's very playable. Although this does seem to arouse suspision amongst a lot of people I've played against as they can't seem to grasp how I am capable of beating them with such ping. As I say If it's all you've had to learn to compensate and adjust for the extra ping.What seems to be a very monotonous game is actually a lot broader in the play once you get into it. From double jumping to jumping sideways to using your rocket boost to fly your car is just the tip of the iceberg of what can all be done in this fun filled game that can really touch on your emotions as well. (Nerd rage alert!!!)To just mess around in RL doesn't take a lot of skill or effort but to up your precision you really need to work on it.I normally describe RL to people as "Soccer (Football to our overseas friends) with RC cars" but when you're playing it feels like so much more. Having to pay attention to where your team mates are as well as the opposition and continuously having to read the game as there's so much control over how hard and where the ball can be hit at any given stage.With different maps that aren't all the same and with Psyonix building more maps to play on each with their own sound themes makes for hours of fun as well if you also add in the amount of different customisable vehicles that can have paint jobs decals wheels rocket trails etc that can all be customized to suit your own style.So much is unlockable without having to open up your wallet and if you're not a person who enjoys purchasing items in game this will definitely work for you.Even though I'm pretty sure every car is the same when it comes to speed and maneuverability personally each car feels like the do handle different.In my honest opinion all in all a great game and I recommend it.
title: Rocket League®

review: I absolutely love this game. It's been my favorite game since its release but there is a huge problem plaguing the game right now.The servers. They. Are. Awful.Don't get me wrong I understand it's not as simple as throwing money at the fire but it has been bad for well over a year.In the past year we've seen crates being introduced into the game. I've spent well over 100 dollars on crates because I trusted that Psyonix would put the money to use for improving the game. I know that there is more content but to be completely honest. If the servers were overhauled using this money rather than spent on new additions to the game(most of which are forgotten by 95% of the playerbase in the span of a few months) that would be stellar.New game modes skins boosts hats DLC is all well and good. However I'm at a loss. I'm at the point where playing the game just isn't fun anymore. Whether it's gliding straight through the ball or disconnecting from games completely it's just not the same as it used to be.Like I said before I love this game. Easily a 10/10 title. The servers just aren't up to speed.I as well as a large portion of the fanbase would like to hear at least SOME updates about what you guys(Psyonix) are doing to resolve this. We are truly your fans and we love you.. but you guys need to bring it back around. &lt 3Hopefully we'll see some changes. I'm not ready to give up on this yet.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is a very suprisingly appealing sports game to anyone who doesn't normally like the genre. Rocket league is jam packed full of adrenaline producing fast paced wild flying action that is very fun regardless of win or loss. However do not let the initial glow of this game fool you for its learning curve is hard to meet. Regardless of its difficulty with practice and patience you will begin to learn the tricky but rewarding skills that are necessary to aerial your way to victory! If you are a fan of CSGO then the learning shouldn't be a problem for you. So pick up a controller or just your mouse and keyboard and start dribbling flying and scoring in this amazing and well made game.Pros Well made Rank system puts you with people moderately close to your skill level Very fun even if you don't like sports games Community (for the most part) is full of wonderful people who are generally good sports and just love to play! Lots of customization including hats! Variety of new maps coming out DLC isn't necessary to play. Cons Learning curve Sometimes lag is an issue causing you to miss shots that look like you hit them. Wasteland sucks XD Can't really think of any more consFinal verdict is GET THIS GAME and enjoy having it suck away hours of your time as you delve deep into the competitive game of Rocket League 9/10

review: I would recommend this game mainly because of the just hype and replayability factor. Most of my friends werent good at the beginning but about 3 hours in they started getting the hang of movement and how to play the ball. The great art style I also love the collectable toppers and antennas which are always fun and never seem to run out with the new season 2 if there is anything i dislike about the game i woud have to say i dont have a large problem with the game but i do have a small problem with the ranked U.I and how it is configured I would like to see the game implement a leaderboards type page in the game where you can view all the different ranks and the players in said rank with their stats so you can see how you stack up against other players in your rank or maybe even players in higher ranks. but back to the review. the party up system is very easy and simple. overall great game gamplay is great Gameplay 10/10 Graphics 10/10Ranked/Competitive modes 8/10Playing with friends 10/10 New updates 10/10

review: Playing soccer with race cars! Sounds stupid right?! Well that is wrong. Rocket League is a very fun game that takes some time to get used to and like it. There is always a reward for effort in this game whether it is scoring a goal learning how to fly or getting your first freestyle goal. This game definitely keeps me busy when I am bored. Try playing with friends. Whether they are better than you or not as good as you are you can always play unranked regular matches or you can spice it up with Rumble or Dropshot. I definitely recommend this game.

review: Edit 15 11 2016 Server Issues have mostly been fixed. 100 ms ping is now the norm. Good Job Psyonix!Psyonix when will you be setting up some servers in India? You know the country with the largest youth population.Edit 04/05/2016 Still no Indian servers.To the people downvoting my reviewand this person who is misinformed about the market.Originally posted by ScottytooHotty Although I don't deny there should be servers in India so people in India can play the game but using an argument that they should have servers because India has the largest youth population is a bit ridiculous because it don't matter how many there are if they have no way of playing the game then there is no market there.As much as I understand the flaw in logic of my previous review to underestimate the market in a developing nation like India for a ridiculosly low requirement multiplatform and competitively priced game like Rocket League is denial on your part and on the part of the devs as well.It is because of this large population that India has a huge market of gamers especially consoles. Mind you that since gaming is one of the fastest emerging markets in India it would be stupid to leave that untapped.I never get a ping lower than 180 and for people with fibernet the lowest is 160. Frankly the 200ms average for most Indians is pretty embarrasing considering the large playerbase. Look at the sales of CS GO in India the reason of its success is attributed to the Indian servers. You can not emulate those sales with 200 ms ping.Even if there were no market which is far from the truth people from India have paid for this game and as such they should be treated at par with customers else where in the world. tl dr 200ms Indian vs 10ms first world player. Stop alienating your customers.Edit 10/05/2015Still no Indian servers but there are some servers under asia south east mainland where Indians get around 140 ms ping.Edit 9/6/2016Forget Indian servers Psyonix has introduced new poor quality european servers on which Indians get 300 ms ping instead of the usual 200.
title: Rocket League®

review: A truly fantastic game from a company that seems to care about its fan base and the gaming community as a whole. This game can be played in any combination between 1v1 to 4v4 online offline split screen or split screen vs online players and its a total blast every single time.Since it released it has had tons of updates with free content patched in including additional modes and maps as well as some cosmetic options. DLC only includes new car skins so you can stand out and are pretty cheap.Oh and did I mention this runs really smoothly the cars are a joy to drive the camera and controls are spot on really cannot fault this one.If you're looking for a game you can play with your friends girlfriend dad anyone really that can be enjoyed for 5 minutes to infinity thats intuitive to understand easy to pick up and play but hard to master and is heaps of fun look no further.

review: This game is one of the worst and best things i have ever spent money on. Whilie I do enjoy it and have fun with friends(most of the time) it is very buggy. I constantly go through the ball because of server issues and the game crashes every 10 minutes since the new patch. It used to be one of the most fun games I had ever played but now it has been ruined because Psyonix worries more about putting out new DLC and crates so people spend more money rather than worrying about the community and listening to their complaints to fix this game's many bugs(going through the ball game crashes server lag matchmaking issues etc.) Used to love this game and now I'm just honestly disappointed. But that doesn't mean i wouldn't recommend it to a friend just on the off hand you might have some fun every once in a while.

review: By far the most addictive game I've ever owned! Other games come and go but I think Rocket League will stay in my Library for a long time to come. With exhibition private casual and ranked style gameplay there is something for the leisure gamer as well as the hardcore competive gamer and everyone in between. The Rocket League developers Psyonix actively work to improve this game with additional content a steady stream of DLC and new styles of play such as Hoops and Rumble. If I could only choose one game to play Rocket League would be that game.

review: Quite simply a fantastic game. I played the prequel SARPBC and I had hoped that this would still capture the magic from that game that made it highly addictive and fun. It has certianly done that. I've now logged over 100 hours on this platform and more than that on my PS4 version of the game though I play it on the PC almost exclusively now as I have friends that play it through Steam too. I never seem to get bored of it. It's a simple idea and I look forward to each new DLC even if they offer little more than a new car/arena/paint job. It doesn't matter it's always just enough to keep you hooked. Fun to play difficult to master but it will keep you trying to master it. Definitely worth every penny.

review: it takes a lot of time to master the game. as in any other sports if you want to be the best (or at least 'decent') at it you're best off practicing and honing your skills through training sessions which are fortunately directly implemented into the game. matchmaking seems kind of broken sometimes as you end up playing against players who are way out of your league thus making it very hard for intermediate players to rise in rank. but as every game is just a 5 minute round you'll get to retry your luck in the next game in the next map very quickly. however it has a very rewarding stat system with which you can customize your car to your liking making it a lot of fun for casual gamers even if you don't play competitive.

review: Rocket League was shown to me by a friend on Xbox. He said the game was really fun and also addicting. This drove me to purchase and Xbox and a copy of Rocket League in August 2016. I have no regrets in doing this. I instantly became hooked on this game and started to grind out several hours a day. I was also ranking up ocasionally. I joined a Xbox team that consisted of me and some friends and we participated in a few tournimants (we didnt get very far). I eventually bought the game on PC because i was told it ran better and thats where all of the good people played. I instantly saw a differance. I have about 1 700 1 800 hours on this game total (about 400 PC when writting this) and will continue to play. In my opinion this is one of the best games out there.

review: An average day in rocket league rumble mode. Me and my friend started rocket league for the first time with me hosting. A few minutes of just hitting the ball and jumping and boosting my friend got a beast score with the boxing glove. knowing nothing both of us were shocked at the madness that could only begin.Hit after hit trying to get the ball away from our goal my item was charged. Used the spikes not knowing what they do i ran into the ball it made a wet farting sound and i ran it into the goal. score 1 1 Each round abilities where used that could only add to the carnage with the boot and grappling hook.each ability was good. round 3 it was teleport vs boot. my friend TP'd me i then booted him out of the way and ran into the goal. another score to me. would i recommend this. In short YES10/10 would rage again.This is the ultimate friendship killer

review: For a much more in depth review please follow this link http //ljbgames.tumblr.com/post/137804947744/rocket league review Final Score 770 / 1 000 In the end this game is worth every penny ($20 USD) but I m still upset about some of the frequent missteps taken by Psyonix. I do have to take into account that the dev team (last time that I checked) was 12 people so I have to admit that everything is impressive when that is understood but I still rate a game based on the game itself. There isn t much else to say about this game that I haven t said already which is sad because I wanted to praise this game for what it could be but I ll destroy this game for what it is and I can t quite do that either. It s a good time waster but I doubt that (unless changes or additions are made) this game will resonate within most people to really keep playing and playing and replaying and resetting and playing it again. It doesn t have that charm for me.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is an informative game that brings you along side the story of a young hispanic man deep in the heart of 1912 Mexico. As he loses his parents at a very young age he must grow up in a harsh and unforgiving land. At the begining of the game your character is weak and defenseless and you train him and sculpt him into the man you want him to be. Whether he be a good man and side with the Policia. Or go the opposite route and work your way up the chain of command in the biggest gang. This game is story rich and the art style is just breathtaking. If you're looking for another generic FPS go shove am iron rod seven feet up your prostate. But if you're looking for a game that will revolutionize the way you look at games this is the game for you.
title: Rocket League®

review: Possibly the only Multiplayer I've put time into to play (not including any Valve games). Psyonix took a simple idea Football with Rocket Cars and created a brilliant game out of it. Playing alone is great and all but I personally recommend playing with friends not just for the feeling of glory when (or if) you when but because you can pin the blame on them afterwards.The only issue with the game I have is how easy it is for people to abandon their team mates during the middle of the match. Have had to do 3 vs 2 or 3 vs 1 in Competitives due to how certain players react to going one goal down.Rating **** 1/2

review: Oh boy this game! I have never been a fan of sports games myself or racing games for that matter but if you are like me that won't matter as you get instantly hooked to the concept of this game. Who wouldn't want to drive rocket powered cars at full speed? At times this game will become super competitive game as you race for the ball trying to make the perfect shot into the other team's goal without them counterattacking at your shot. At other times though it is nice to play with a friend or sibling trying to work together to score. This adds a very fun element and I would know. I always play with my brother in this game and it makes the game even more enjoyable then it already is. And of course there are the funny moments in this game when you ram into people or do a stupid flip in the air or driving on the ceiling! It is always a good time. In conclusion I would highly recommend this game for people who do like racing games and those that don't. It is a unique game that anyone can enjoy and you can rest assured that the team for this game is very dedicated as they are releasing a free update and paid dlc as well. If you have another $20 laying around i recommend spending that money on this game. It is a load of fun and anyone can enjoy!P.S. I recommend using a wired Xbox 360 Controller to play this game.

review: I first installed this game as a way to test my PC! Since then I have spent many many hours playing this game. While it's not taxing on a PC I couldn't help trying to hit that oversized ball with my car! I highly recommend this game. It's simple to learn but difficult to master. That's what makes it so addictive. Each match is only 5 minutes (assuming no overtime) so it's good for quick gaming sessions. My only negative so far is not about the game but about some of the players who play it. You should expect a lot of ragequitters (especially in competitive mode). Unfortunately in competitive mode if your team mate decides to quit the game you don't get the help of an AI bot. You should expect many many hours of fun with this game. It's also easy enough for casual gamers to pick up and play. My only advice to you it takes only an hour or two to learn the basics but you will need many many hours before you can truly master what is possible in Rocket League. Most people ignore the trainings and go straight to competitive (bad idea!) or online match (not such a bad idea!). Use the tranings to get better (especially aerials) and also use the custom matches to play against AI bots. The biggest frustration will be trying to land aerials (hitting the ball in mid air). Practice makes perfect!
title: Rocket League®

review: Great game very addictive and hardly any technical issues. Sometimes matchmaking is a bit quirky where it cant find enough players even tho there are 20.000+ online but other than that it is pretty flawless.only real notable downside are the "rage kids" you can get teamed up with as they will likely abandon the match after you concede 1 goal and still have like 4 5 minutes to play. IMO penalties for mid match leaving should be stronger to discourage this kind of behaviour.But still id recommend this game to anyone

review: Product received for free. This is great game! The graphics are the best I've ever seen in my life! The gameplay is perfect and has an amazing community! I think that everyone should have this game in their library! The only thing that I think hurts this game is the A.I. on rookie and sometimes on pro difficulty. I say that because they help the other team score by doing nothing to stop the ball from going in goal and they also hit it in their own goal. Yes this does hurt the score. All in all I truly belive this game is a 9/10! It is a game you must buy and play with friends family by yourself and also strangers! This is a game everyone can get in to! Even if you HATE sports! Personally I dont like soccer but love socCAR lol see what I did there? Anyways if you dont have the game you should DEFINATELY buy this game!

review: A+ game. Surprisingly this game requires more well timed coordination than to be expected. It's amazing how awesome such a simple concept plays out in 5 minutes of frenzy. Speaking of no game holds your attention better than Rocket League for 5 minutes of fun. It's easy to pick up the game and take breaks in between. You are not forced to "grind" for stupid bonuses that give you in game perks because they simply do not exist.The game requires fairly precise skill at times and skill gaps between players are well balanced in ranked matchmaking. Terrible players do not always cause you to lose a game and great players always have new tricks and angles to play.Worth the buy and in the 130 hours I've got on record I can say I would definitely recommend this game to others.

review: Rocket League is a game for anyone to enjoy. You don't have to enjoy any specific genre of game to really get into this. Obviously saying that doesn't mean EVERYONE is going to like this game. It still has it's community it's just a wider variety compared to a game such as CS GO or League of Legends where they have people who enjoy that specific genre of game. Pros Seasons Mode for people who are either just starting don't have internet or even those who just don't enjoy the online gameplay.(Which I highly recommend playing Online) Ladder System Using MMR for Ranked Gameplay ESL Tournaments Local Splitscreen A big one for me the fact you can go into training mode WHILE looking for a game. Surprisingly not something you see all that often in games. An all around solid community.(Obviously it being an online game you will run into a few annoying players here and there.) Cars are all balanced each having their own hitbox (no extra speed using a different car. All personal preference.) Different types of training to help you get better!Cons MMR System is a little weird meaning once you get higher rankings you can get +2 +1 0 for a win and then drop 12 for a close game ending in a loss. (Hopefully being fixed come Season 2 with the new rankings. Will update Review for the future!) Community can be a little toxic at times in terms of people leaving the game. There's absolutely no repercussions for leaving a game early. You get the lost elo for losing but you don't have a queue to wait in unlike most games with ranked play.All in all. My rating will be a 9/10. I have yet to find a dull point in this game. All games are different in their own way. Not everyone has the same playstyle and it's fun to fix your own playstyle to combat theirs. An amazing game and I recommend it to almost all of my friends. Definitely give it a try if you haven't already! See you on a field. )
title: Rocket League®

review: When my friends suggested this as a game to play on winter break I thought to myself this looks dumb as I do with most things. But then I played it and realized that it was in fact I who is dumb. Yes you are a rocket powered car (often with a flamboyant hat) playing soccer against other rocket powered cars (also wearing flamboyant hats). You d think logically that this would be a children s game but oh no you would be so wrong. I fear each time I begin this addiction that my heart will explode my blood pressure reaches such a height that I literally think that I think to myself this is it this is how you ll die playing a game where you re a rocket powered car playing soccer. I actually think that that s how great this game is. There are no words to further explain why you should play this game. You just need to play it it s the only way. And if you don t like it you know you can just say hey that guy was wrong but you ll at least be able to say you ve driven a rocket car in a soccer match.
title: Rocket League®

review: The best thing about Rocket League is that it is fun even if you are not great at the game. With a variety of different gamemodes such as hoops there is more than just car soccer. There's no need to always have a group to queue up with. I spend most of my times in 1v1 because the game plays more to my liking at 1v1. Random players in 2v2 and 3v3 are generally fun to play with and I have queued up with many of them after the game and played more. Even if you do not like playing the game itself you can try to get all of the hats and trails and whatnots. I would definitely recommend this game to others.

review: Now that I've played this game for over 1 000 hours i think It's finally time to write a review.This game is insanely hard to pick up. It takes at least a week to get confortable airialing another month for dribbling passing takes hundreds if not thousands of hours and air dribbling is still hard for me after 1 000 hours. Despite this steep learning curve there is a qualittive aspect to getting better which is unlike any other game. You know when you have gotten better because you are able to do things you have never been able to do before.This is also the perfect game to play with friends. Out of the 1 000 hours Ive played at least 800 have been in a discord call. This game is tons of fun when in a call and the added challenge of trying to communicate is just abnother skill to master.Are there things to improve yes. Solo standard is a mess so game modes are pointless and some items are unobtainable without spending money. For aestetic items this would be completely fine but some cars can only be obtained thorugh cases which seems a bit unfair. of course you can profit from trading and afford almost anything but that takes time that some players just dont have.Other than that this game IS my favorite game of all time and it will take a lot for me to change my mind.P.S. EA should learn from Psyonix how to run a company
title: Rocket League®

review: Pros I'm not really sure why but this game puts me at the edge of my seat. It's a game that makes me turn my controller like a steering wheel even though I know that does nothing. The fact that it's based off of soccer literally anyone can play this game. It's so hard to be good at this game that it doesn't really matter if you do bad. You'll see people mess up way more than succeed. Which makes this game so easy to pick up. Matchmaking is easy and quick The amount of customization for your car is incredible The price of the game makes sense for what this game is. This isn't a game that should cost $60. Cons Because of how simple minded this game is it doesn't really keep me playing it. When you have someone on your team leave and is than replaced by a bot the match is pretty much over. I've seen bots knock our ball into our goal more than once. Overall Rocket League is a fun game to play if you just want to play something that's exactly what it says rocket cars playing soccer. There's nothing more to it. While this isn't nesscarily bad it doesn't exactly keep me playing for hours and hours. But if your looking for a game that has a couple hours of intense fun with friends it's a great game. And it's not $60! Rating 8/10
title: Rocket League®

review: The ultimate "Just one more match" game. You can have so much fun in just five minutes. While you only have exhibitions and season mode to tide you over offline this game was made for online and it has a pretty lively and active player base. Just beware of leavers and just like LoL or DOTA 2 people can get toxic when tilted.But seriously this a great game. It's balls to walls action with you and your team trying to outscore the other team in a game soccer with cars. It's easy to play has a nice tutorial and is great for quick gaming sessions if you have a tight schedule the matches are only five minutes if you don't mess with any settings. Good set of options for helping your experience on PC and is constantly updated so there's always something to look forward to.
title: Rocket League®

review: Good solid fun that nearly anyone can enjoy. Local split screen platform cross play and generally great performance all around seal the deal.It's an absurdly addicting soccerish car based game and I'm kind of blown away by how much fun I have with it at times. The core gameplay is a great mix of easy to learn and hard to master mechanics that keeps each match frantic and the quick matches make it somewhat difficult to really get frustrated at the game. This is a great game to pick up if you're looking for something casual and addicting to play in short bursts.

review: Brilliant execution of a fantastic concept. Gameplay is without many flaws and once you get the hang of it you'll more than likely get sucked in and love it. Anyone out there who plays FIFA will probably find this a nice fun game to take a break with as I have. No real need to love cars or football required to get into this one as many have said. Well worth the asking price and when it's on sale it's practically a must buy. As an added bonus it doesn't take a beast of a rig to run and it looks fantastic. I'll be putting many more hours into this game this year.

review: This game has ruined my life and I love it. This game is fast paced and skill based with the occasional rng t pinch straight to goal. The game has a steep learning curve however there is training for that as well as single player (I guess you could call it tours) going against ai that can vary from 1v1 all the way up to 4v4 (I do prefer 1v4 for added difficulty). The community is great all willing to talk to others laugh at their own mistakes and also occasionally rage quit. Be prepared to lose nights of sleep.

review: Football (soccer) with cars sounds so simple a premise it's surprising to have been able to watch Rocket League grow and dominate in recent times. In no small part this has been down to the regular sizeable and varied updates and additions to the game from developer Psyonix most of the time completely for FREE too. They've really helped to cultivate a very active and grateful community. It's an extremely satisfying game with a steep learning curve but once it has its hooks in you you're playing every night with friends to get better and better individually and as a team. All the game modes are terrific fun. The art style and aesthetic looks rich and slick. I've yet to encounter any significant bugs design issues or stability issues. And it's out on Mac and Linux! 10/10 sport game if only I could take some away for not letting me hit my aerials every time!

review: Very addicting game. My first day i played 12h without even a single WC brake. It might not be a very long lasting experience for everybody due to no story or any level of achievement beside Ranking but with friends maybe it might just be the game that will forever be in your "Favorite" list. Althouth i would suggest not buying it now due to the big amount lagging in servers. After the DLC ball is clunky teleporting or changing directions mid air servers get stuck in loading process (and you DC after 5min.) you get DC'ed mid match and get ban for "Leaving" the game.Overall GREAT game but just wait for the patch before buying or it might ruin the first impression.EDIT DON'T BUY THIS GAME. As of 2015 09 02 7/10servers are lagging or not even connecting.. Wait for patchesEDIT2 As of December 23rd the lags are preatty much gone but there are still couple of things that are not prioratized (instead they focus on DLCs. But since the lags are gone IT'S A MUST BUY GAME!!! Super addictiveEDIT3 i don't know why maybe because of creates or general popularity but 99% of community is just super toxic. I'm pretty sure that the reporting system is useless and that devs aren't doing anything to stop that

review: Rocket league is a very fantastic game on any platform it has a copy for. the PC edition of this game really is no exception at all. Almost every single thing about this game is done right. graphics are no dissapointment and look great. Gameplay is smooth regarding acceptable internet connections are being used. If not playing this game can be a struggle as ping over 100 practically becomes a challenge for the player. Ranking is fair and skill can be shown through advanced movements such as ariel shots. Ranked play is a similar experience to standard play however and i hope that it could be made different in a way that creates a method of clearly distinguishing the two different modes apart. customisation never falls short and is phenomenal. other items may use cases but they do not provide and advantage to the game and nor does the DLC that this game has to offer practically its all cosmeticI would recommend Rocket League to those who are soccer/football fans or those who like the idea of playing sport with vehiclesrating 8/10
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League... ohhhh Rocket League where do I start? This game and I have the biggest love/hate relationship that someone can have with a video game. The same thing that frustrates me the most about this game is the same thing that brings me back to it competition. No game is ever the same and you never know what kind of tricks your opponent has up their sleeves. But lets do a quick pro/con list and get on with our day shall we?Pros Fun and fast paced games keep you interestedCompetition is greatDev updates constantly and they listen to the communityNew content frequently(could be a con but it's inexpensive and you don't need to buy it to play the game)Cons THESE ARE FOR CURRENT VERSION WHEN POSTEDLong Server Queue TimesGame Balancing in Ranked
title: Rocket League®

review: What may i say about the game?It's simply amazing!For a start it has the foundations of a successful online focused game with a variety of cars (some places say there are even more coming) a trully nice customization system friendly controllers strong servers no lag at all frenetic and intuitive gameplay a robust statistic and score system and a real good AI to combine hell we even get cups to play offline! And after all is a very honest game without any flaws what you see in the trailers is what you get no micro transactions no booster packs.If you consider buying the game simply do it do it for your own good you will not regret.Thank you developers i never had this level of fun in a online focused game!Latelly the game has received some more modes and vehicles that are really enjoyable!
title: Rocket League®

review: This game will always keep you wanting more.200 hours in you will still feel like you have accomplished nothing.Another 200 hours in and you will feel like youre just slightly better than before.Another 300 hours in you've learned from your mistakes yet there is still so much to learn.You will constantly be learning no matter how many hours you have. When you start you spend most of the time chasing the ball then it evolves to just being able to finally hit the ball and then you learn to rotate setup teamates. After all this you'll learn that you can rotate your car this is when you finally learn how to aerial and once you can finally aerial you'll want more. There never is an end to this game as you will constantly be pushing yourself to learn and master something new.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket Leagues basic idea is so simple. Football with cars. At first I was like what is this manchild game but decided to try it. The game itself is well made from controls that are on point to the optimization and graphics that make the game good looking and playable even with potato computer. There are tons of different customization choises and many car bodies you can choose from. You can make hentai car with octopus topper rastafari car with Jamaican flag and Rastahat or trippy car with animated everything. Choise is yours. But 99% of players play with Octane Dominus or Batmobile because muh metacars. Gameplay is super fun but be prepared to suck in the first 100 hours you play this game. But the satisfaction you get when you hit your first aerial instead of spinning out of control in the air sick juke you did or that epic save that saved the game made me fell in love with Rocket League. You'll get most out of this game when you play with friends because communication teamplay and rotations are super important in higher level of ranked. And ranked brings us to the community of Rocket LeagueThe community in Rocket League is just like in any other competitive video game. . Solo ranked can be harsh because of ragequitters and whiners too. I'm that guy who spams "What a save!" for and giggles and oh boy the enemy reactions are sometimes hilarious. Few examples of comments that I got into my profile because of that " *ng salty kid.....it's sad that trash ppl like u can play any games. you should sit in a ing corner all day long.""This guy is the reason everybody hates the rocket league community""If somebody knows this guy irl please kill him. Reward All my skins"TL DR Play with friends or hide chat if you can't handle What a save! spam and play only with controller. This game is amazing for casual or hardcore gamers because games last usually from five to ten minutes. Rocket League is satisfying game to play since you feel that you learn something new every time you play it. Highly recommend it!
title: Rocket League®

review: Now I must start off by saying I love this game not only can you play with mates in the many different match up types but you can also test your skill in competitive mode. Plus you barely bump into the same people so you never know what sort of players you will come up against.Where I have a problem with this game is with the community now not all the community as majority is overwhemingly great and friendly but I have noticed the Cancerous community is hiding within Challenger II and Challenger IIIPersonally my highest rank has been Challenger Elite but have versed many in the Rising Star rank and have been majority nice.This part of the community in hiding is mainly in Doubles you know the guy. review: Unfair automated banning system that gives no warnings and will ban you for using a word on their "mysterious secret list of words."When they accept someone's money and give full text chat to their very competitive game...1. They should expect their will be some harsh language at times. (in my case it was retaliatory as I was faced with a very disrespectful teammate)2. They could do what countless other games have done and simply not allow words from their mystery list to be sent through their chat system. Heck that would be a perfect time to issue a warning to a user if they try to send such a word.3. Most games that offer in game chat give a disclaimer that they can't control what others say. If they can't handle the reality of online video game chat then take it off of your game. Leave it to the in game emotes.I find it absolutely condescending and disrespectful to their PAYING customers that they would treat them like children. As if not every single one of the people in their company who play their game haven't used a choice word or two to someone else in an online game. Pure hypocrisy from the developers/publishers.The money people spent on the game should at the very least have bought them a warning before the first strike ban.If they ever fix this system and issue an apology to their paying customers for how terribly they've handled this I will change the review back to a positive vote like it was previously.As it is if they want to keep their system of giving the middle finger to people who supported them with their money then screw them.They built a competitive game and provided a chat system. They then allowed the chat system to be filled with nasty comments over the course of two years. Then in their arrogance they assume their player base is visiting their site and reading every single update to the game. So they issue an update banning people for doing what they have been doing since the game came out which they have allowed to carry on for the two years the game has been out.Most people reading this will ignore this final point. but here it is anyways...I'm not even necessarily that bothered by the system... I'll say it again... I am not even necessarily that bothered by the system. HOWEVER it's the implementation that is particularly offensive to me and I'm certain countless others who feel they have been effectively given a bait and switch. Or in another analogy this is sort of like entrapment.They set the scene by fostering a vicious community that is Rocket League players. Then after two years change the rules to initiate bans on people who have been operating in the community and who came to accept it for the cesspool that it is. If you want to change it up fine... change it up. But you owe (yes OWE) it to your CUSTOMER base to make a much better effort to gradually implement the change. You Psyonix are responsible for the toxic community that has been Rocket League online. Don't suddenly try to pretend like you didn't foster that aspect of the community since your game was released.Psyonix should OWN what role they played in this situation and they should have done a better job about respecting the players who have grown accustomed to it over the years. That means a better slower transition in implementing their system.

review: Really fun game and easy to learn however I persoanlly do not have the best internet (1mb/s speeds) but I can get an average of 30 40 ping on games like CS GO and Rocket League but in this game whenever 1 person has a rediculously high ping then everyone in the game lags. This has happened to me multiple times where everyone will have 30 60 ping and then 1 guy will have 150 ping and it will make the game close to unplayable because your car will stutter drive sideways and you will be stuttering 1 second and then the next second you will have been blown up and scored on without even seeing another car or the ball. But when the game isn't lagging like hell it is fun.

review: Can't say much more than what's already been said about how fun this game is. Despite being the same 5 minute game every time it always feels unique and enjoyable. What appears to be a simple fun arcade game is also a complex tactical thriller with a high skill threshold that produces endless enjoyment. And it's cheapFor new players I strongly recommend playing the vs ai season on the highest difficulty until it feels easy before switching to online. It will help you enjoy the experience a lot more if you pick up some skill before entering the salt mines of casual and competitive playlists. Also learn not to ball chase early as you'll become better at anticipating where the ball is going and positioning yourself for saves clears shots etc. You will also be a much better teammate if you don't spend the whole 5 minutes trying to hit the ball. Also I find the best way to combat the toxicity of the chat is to not chat back and just throw if someone is being a *** in casual play
title: Rocket League®

review: This game! Wow! The most fun game I've ever played. It's either the dumbest awesome game ever made or the awesome dumb game ever made. Most fun when you play with friends.It's like FIFA but with rocket powered flying cars. Game is simple. Play as a team score goals by hitting the ball into the goal with your car. You can jump flip use hte boost fly explode opponents etc. There are a lot of modes which include time warp basketball rumble (you get random superpowers).The game has a great community workshop where you can download tutorials for specific skill etc. There are a lot of customisation options provided.The learning curve is high and I highly recommend that you finish all the tutorials first. Your playstyle hitbox acceleration etc all depend on the car you have chosen (some are free. rest are DLC). There are lootboxes (can't be bought.) which can be used to unlock items (requires a key which needs to be bought). The ping is usually really high (teleporting balls cars etc)
title: Rocket League®

review: I reccomended this game because it's a good game but it's ranking system is bulls***. I'm saying this because when you play competitive there are no fair match ups. There are two different ranks on here which is the level and the rank for game modes. When you search for a game it goes by your rank but it does not match you up with the correct rank. When I play doubles my friend and I are the same exact rank. When we search for a game the players that it finds are either higher ranked or lower ranked this us. There not even on the same prospect rank. To explain how bad it is even more and all of this was before the wipe and it still happens after the wipe is that when I first played solo duel and got to prospect one it put me up against a guy on the gold rank which I don't even know what rank that even is. I am level 29 and only have around 100 hrs of gameplay on here but they need to fix the ranking system matchup because of how stupid it has to act plus at times when I play my car gets hit by nothing and moves somewhere for no reason or the ball goes in some other direction where it shouldn't have because of the way it was hit.

review: Honestly at it's core it's a sports game. Maybe one of the most fun and involved sports games ever made. The devs are constantly trying to improve and add more to the game and they haven't really screwed anything up yet. Sure sometimes (a lot of times) I get in a match where my team has no chance of winning...but on the occasions when it's the other way around it totally makes up for it. I would highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a fresh new game with competitive and sports elements. And please try your best not to be toxic. There's already too many of those people. lol

review: It's awsome.. I'm hooked onto this game.When you begin to play this game you don't take it too serioulsy your goal will be just to touch the ball and you will laugh with your firends. Once you learned to control your car this games start being something else. You will see your skills getting better and better learning new Tactics and tricks.Being proud of yourself when you do your first aerial. The mechanics are well balanced you are in total contral this games doesn't punish you unjustly. If you fail it's on your own fault. There is only a handful of games that give you this feeling of control and learning curve.

review: Reluctant to play to now a favouriteThe best way I can describe how I was reluctant to play Rocket League at first is you know when a show just gets a massive following out of nowhere like Breaking Bad Game of Thrones Rick and Morty The Walking Dead etc etc and the fans are just annoying so you avoid it like the plague? that was basically it for Rocket League. EVERYONE plays it. EVERYONE doesn't shut the ***k up about it. Instead of canerous MLG COD videos creeping their way into my reccomended videos it was then replaced by cancerous Rocket League videos.Being more fair when you take the fandom out of the equasion I'm not a football fan Actual football my American friends not the rugby with The Road Warriors' shoulder pads that you call football and i'm not a racing fan let alone a huge car person in general i'm more into my bikes so naturally the game didn't really appeal to me but I eventually looked into it more and took notice and I am so glad I didI quickly turned from "this is stupid" to "Ohhhhhhh... Okay. I get why people play this now" and I still enjoy it.It's a fast paced drving game where you ram a ball about into a net or hoop and score amazing goals from fluke skill or little skill but having the guts to get in there during a scramble for the ball. I've had a lot of planned goals accidental goals and semi planned goals that didn't go as I inteded but still went in and it is an amazing feeling.
title: Rocket League®

review: Incredible game the replayability is off the charts. Who knew that soccer and cars would make a winnning combo? The devs did!A great selection of vehicles to choose from and the customization is really a very nice touch. The DLC's don't cost a terrible amount and they are always worth it.The gameplay is great and can get addicting especially when you create a party and play with friends. The chaos that ensues is hilarious. There will be laughter. There will be tears. There will be shouts. There will be cops called to your house by neighbors who think you've lost your mind. But that's ok Rocket League is totally worth it.My only complaint would be server distribution. More servers please!
title: Rocket League®

But again I can't recommend this game to people anymore.Oh yeah and there's purchase keys to open crates which don't show you the odds of getting certain items in it which I'm not a fan of.This was my old review Simple concept but perfectly executed. review: A truly fun game for all to play especially with a group of friends. The gameplay is somewhat unique and is like something you've never played before with a mixture of two genres. Mass customization is available for each car however it is still limited in certain areas as it is not entirely a racing game where an entire vehicle could be modified in various ways. One thing that i personally dislike about this game is the matchmakings whereby you will not be put into a match against other players with your similar level or skills. I really hope this part would be fixed or the game would just seem unfair. Overall it's a wonderful game.
title: Rocket League®

review: NOTE I am on windows 10 and the PC version of this game This game is my favorite game to date. It's tuns of fun competitivley when you have to train. But you will want friends to play with If you are just interested in playing it casualy but thats not a bad thing. It's a blast to mess around with friend flail about while missing the ball completely and its super fun to play it seriously too! I myself play this game as much as possible and do it competitivley but its not required. I remember the good ol' days of sucking and just laughing with my friends while we lose to actual competitive teams. For 19.99 USD this game is so worth it! I personally have over 800 hours on it and there are lots of people with lots more. The game is demanding a good computer if you want to play it on high quality settings but with some help from youtube and low settings you can play with 50 frames on a laptop! I myself play on a laptop but am going to get a better computer soon. One thing to say to new comers the way to lower your settings is Options &gt Video Render quality is the most important along with resolution. But too low of a res will make it unplayable I suggest on a low end computer lowest settings possible and then go up slowly to see what it can handle. NOTE it will have worse preformance online so if it runs fine in free play mode that does not automatically mean you are good. The best way to test your setting for camera is in free play mode however. (high preformance lowest high quality highest) I run with render quality on Preformance render details custom (uncheck all boxes to the right) and the rest lowest. (one of them has not "high preformance" option so set that to preformance) from the internet i have found a way to disable some effect in the game files and I also set rocket league to high priority in task manager (which on some computers makes fps lag spikes but not mine) Anyways my conclusion BUY THIS GAME YOU WONT BE SORRY

review: Although I have been a member of Steam for over 10 years I think this is my first review. While I have logged over 200 hours playing Rocket League I am a very mediocre player. But I love this game anyway. It is a ton of fun has spectacular graphics and the developers are always adding new content (free and paid). It is truly a game that is simple to learn yet takes forever to perfect. Success is dependent on both individual skill and teamwork and the cars allow for a lot of customization. If you enjoy racing games with a lot of collisions different takes on football/soccer basketball hockey or other ways to compete with RC scale cars then get this ASAP.

review: Deceptively fun. I bought this game in the spring of 2016 and I cannot imagine a day I would ever stop playing it. From the outside the game looks silly (and it can be) but while playing it is surprisingly exhilerating pakced with fast paced technically challenging action. If you're a casual player don't worry the skill floor is very low. If you're more competitive also don't worry the skill ceiling is very high I'd say 2.5 years after it's release we're still trying to find that ceiling. For such a simple premise there is an incredible amount of mechanical complexity. Pros Extremely fun. Easy to get into (low skill floor). Incredible opportunity for growth (high skill ceiling). A blast with friends. Lots of in game options (rebind keys camera settings etc). Has a basic tutorial. User customizable training packs (and a way to share/browse other training packs). Lots of customization options. Cosmetic unlockables awarded for playing. Large player base. Multiple game modes (soccar rumble dropshot). Play with teammates (2v2 3v3 4v4) or solo! (1v1) Save replays of matches to capture the coolest moments! (Especially useful if you like to share game clips as you can rewatch the action from any angle or even in slow motion!) The game keeps track of stats! Wins/losses shots on goal goals saves clears demolitions distance traveled etc! It's got a ton of stats it keeps track of and those can be fun to look back on. It feels like a team sport. You don't (usually) go and completely dominate a match on your own. You set up passes you bump opponents out of the way to clear a path for your teammate whose dribbling the ball things like that. When you start to have some synergy as a team it is really cool and that's where some of the magic is that makes this game so good.Cons Some people aren't nice (but you can turn off chat also in my experience this is rarely an issue). There are loot boxes (they're really only for cosmetic items there are a couple vehicles in there that might have slightly different stats I don't recall but nothing to put you at a disadvantage.) Even without the loot box items there are tons of other cosmetic items that aren't in the loot boxes.I can't recommend this game enough. At it's core Rocket League is six cars and one ball in an arena. For a moment forget the added flair all the cosmetics the crates the alternative game modes perfection is achieved not when there is nothing to add but when there is nothing to take away and 3v3 soccar is absolutely perfect.
title: Rocket League®

review: At first I was rather sceptical about Rocket League. When it was released I didn't jump on the hype train and instead just waited until it was on sale... a year or so later. Now that I have actually played it for quite some hours I have to say "Wow".The game is great fun and less repetitive than I thought it would be. The highly customizable vehicles are great and the gameplay always puts me to the edge of my seat. I can't believe I waited so long to purchase this game! Playing my way up through the rankings is a great way to keep me motivated to play another match and the casual vibe the game gives off doesn't leave me quilty after shutting down the game.I do recommend this game its casual yet fun style means its easy to pick up in between others stuff and when playing with friends it's just a blast!However do note that this game is best played with controller keyboard and mouse just don't cut it.

review: I vastly underestimated and nearly wrote this game off as being just another streaming trend but a couple of things piqued my interest and ultimately convinced me of its substance and fun factor.1. I played many many hours of botmatches in a little mod for Unreal Tournament (2003 &amp /or 2004) called Carball when i was in school.2. The interesting DLC and some really great ideas for car customization.3. It was on sale.I don't think i would have bought it and all of its DLC had it been full price but i gave it a shot when i was on sale. I played it with my wife and one of our friends using Xbox One controllers and the Wireless adapter that recently came out. The controls worked perfectly and we all had a really good time.It may seem at first like it was mostly luck but i found myself (as i usually tend to do with competitive multiplayer games) discovering some nuance in the strategy and placement of the ball and vehicles and began to really take a liking to it and score a lot of goals. The meta game is not as complex or interesting as others like BF or CoD but its casual to get you in then really exciting when you are able to out menuver or trick someone into giving you the goal somehow.I really like the customizability of your cars and hope they expand this a bit. The feeling you get when boosting to the Rock boosting sound customization is really great as your going for a goal and the hilarious effects of the Junk blowing out of your with the nuts and bolts boost are exactly whet they need to expound on to keep me interested for the long haul.My only gripe is that the car physics feel a bit flat and boring. Stale even. I would like them to be a bit more bouncy and dynamic like real or RC car suspension.I think its worth a shot expecially if you have fond memories of Carball for UT.
title: Rocket League®

title: Rocket League®

review: Honestly after playing this game for as long as i have and getting into it at what seems like late in the game. I have just some basic remarks on the quality and gems of the gamePros Getting started into matches isnt that bad yes you will lose alot at the beginning but matches are quick and you're sure to learn fast Controls on pc i feel are easier than controller (i've tried both) and essentially straightforard Community is good most people are supportive in team play and console and pc players alike get along Cars do little more than show experience not outweigh opponents. my favorite part of this game is that the cars simply show how much you've played and dont force players to commit long hours to unlock cars with perks. everyone comes into each game level (in referrence to to the cars) even Doesnt take long to become pro my hours played should show you that 26 hours in and i have a pro ranking games are short (5 mins) so youll end up playing more games than you even realize and level up quick Cons Sometimes when starting a new game the server will pop you into a lopsided affair (not always) but on occasion ive spawned into a game that was 0 6 with few minutes to go. the game rectifies this however rewarding players who make it to the end with points regardless Fading community this may not always be that case but at peak hours the game maybe has 55 000 60 000 people online and about 8 000 to a match type. Overall This is a game worth buying to anyone casual or MLG. you can have fun and the competition is as hard as you make it. more people buy it so we can keep this matches going.

review: This is a good solid and sometimes fun game. But there are requirements to that fun.Requirements for the game to be funFriends to play withOpposing team in your skill rangeAs the pool of players flux the skill level will have to be higher to have any fun with the remaining community. I've had a good run with friends for a while every now and then but upon reflection I won't recommend this game at full price ($30 AUD Australian conversion is a killer) with the quickly dwindling player base but on sale might be worth a purchase.I do commend them on their constant updates/maps and fair DLC which is restricted just to costmetics.*Fair comment made by Jon I might have to play more ranked matchs to get better matched games. On further reflection on price developers can charge what they want. Who am I to judge.

But having to pay money to unlock achievements is annoying)Community Non Toxic (never had any bad experiences myself)

review: Rocket League is basically football where the players are cars with a rocket boost. The main mode is 3v3 but there are others as well including 1v1 2v2 4v4 basketball and ice hockey. That's all there really is to it. It works it's fun. It's easy to learn but difficult to master.The community can be a bit toxic at times but it's fine for the most part and you can disable chat as well as mute and report players. There's also loot crates but they contain only cosmetic items and there's a decent amount of free stuff as well so loot crates don't really matter.All in all it's a pretty good game that's easy to pick up.

review: I didn't know if this game would be worth the money at first. I thought it would be fun for a couple of hours and then I would just get bored of it. But it is probably the game that I go to most of the time now when I just want to jump right into a fun game session. I definitely have put more hours in to this game than I thought I would and I don't really see myself getting bored with it any time soon. It is very nice to just be able to jump in to a game quickly and the matches do not last forever so I don't feel like I have to put in a long time commitment when playing. It's a great game for casual play.
title: Rocket League®

review: I have played an abundance of this game and even though the rank system has had their ups and downs throughout the seasons I gotta say that this is a superb game. One for the books. We go to the bar and my boss has a gambling problem and then there's me hitting crates for the chance for a sweet new item to show to you guys. I may not be the best but I give my best. Awesome game overall. Would recommend it again and again for anyone. Although fair warning there be trolls out there that make this game very underwhelming for brand new players whom try to find a reason to like the game. Other than that it's competitive for those who are competitive fun pretty chill for those looking to put in a quick game or two before work. Many different mods to choose from and game types to play.

review: Way too much fun. Lots of options for competing from single player season to multiplayer 2v2/3v3/4v4 ranked etc. In addition to the standard soccer field layout there are other specialty maps including one where the ball becomes a hockey puck a basketball court with hoops to score in and others. Matches are 5 min each and so it's great for hopping in for a quick game. One thing I don't care for is that teammates/AI can leave/join in the middle of gameplay would be nice if they did substitutions when the ball isn't in play. All in all definitely a fun time.

I definitely reccommend this to really anyone.NOTE Please be sure to read over System Requirements carefully so that you don't come whinning in the reviews that "it runs horribly". review: The best 5 minutes of gaming I've ever had. Of course no one can play just one. Another five minutes. Just another 5 minutes mom!! I can't seem to get enough. Every opportunity you have for a shot on the goal or to save a goal is a burst of addrenaline. I don't know why people would do drugs when they can just play Rocket League. You make the shot Yes!!!!!! So awesome!!! You miss the shot No!!!!!! So awesome!!!!!! You can't go wrong. It's simple to pick up and play but difficult to master. There is a broad range of skill set here. It's enjoyable for players of all skill.
title: Rocket League®

review: Where do I start with Rocket League I Guess I'll start with when you first start. At first you play against bots just learning the controls. After like 3 games with bots you'll feel confident into playing in normals solo or with a few friends. Prepare to have your kicked. I ran into a few Season 3 Grand Champions and I was destroyed. But ether way win or lose You'll have fun learning more and improving to strive to as best as you can. You'll run into a few Shi people here and there but it's best to just mute them so you wont get tilted or angry with yourself if you make a screw up while hearing or reading what they say. I could honestly continue but there's so much I could say. TL DR Fun with friends Bull pinchs and hitboxes time to time Mute flamers and toxic people.

review: From PS4 experience and the current experience from PC i can give some sort of review for this game and hopefully you all will read onSimply put it's just football with a car instead and obviously the aim would be to score goals to win when the game first came out it was great for noobie people to play since everyone was round your play style and level so it got easier to get better at the game. fast foward a bit and now you have more smurfs than players (smurfs are people who make new accounts and loook like noobs but are really good at the game) if you want to be able to go on competitive and have no problem then you need some good amount of experience on the game before even trying to go compet.the amount of things you need to learn if you want to become a very good player is vast and can take hours to master depedning on what you want to learnwhen it comes to compet the community you will come across will talk and a lot of it one small mistake and you will get everyone on your team hating you the amount of talking on this simply game is amazing haha.up until recently you are now able to open crates by buying keys which gives you customizerable things for your cars or a new car if you get addicited to the game then you probably spend loads of cash on crates and all depending on luck you might get nothing or something really goodmy conclusion is that it is a very good game but if you want to become really good and get high up in the ranks in competitve then you need to put time and effort into the game or you will get no where in the game overall very addicting
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a fine example of a AAA like title at an awesome price!As others have said easy to pickup and play with alot to master. Great graphics and excellent playability. Even if your not a soccer fan I recommend checking this game out!Arena car game with great game mechanics and high quality cinematics that will keep you coming back for more. Grab a controller and stick the end of your seat while learning to do jump flips boosting and directing the ball to the goal. Low Hardware requirements Great visuals Low priced game and reasonably priced DLCRec'd this and a copy of Portal 2 with pre order on Steam Controller!Essentially because of this my steam controller costed peanuts while getting to great games in the deal.I recoccommend getting a Steam Controller you won't be disapointed.I am looking forward to when the Devs can get this ported to Linux! In the meantime keep up the great work bringing high quality games at reasonable prices. You folks Rock!
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket league is a unique concept that pits the base of sports rules with the awesomeness of cars. The controls are easy to pick up on but take a while to master in the right combination for ultimate control over your vehicle. This game is great for 5 10 hours of binging. But after that you may want to check in once every few days and only play a match or two. With new game modes coming out periodically it gives a little replayability as you try to master each sport. However it can get a little dull in between. Fantastic if you can pick it up in the sales. Eitherwise it's just about worth its price tag.
title: Rocket League®

review: I would have never bought this if I wouldn't have gotten it at first from PSN plus on Playstation 4. I mean soccer with jumping cars? I'm glad I did though. Easy purchase on the PC side soon afterwards.It's flying RC cars trying to score goals sometimes ramming each other. 2v2 or 3v3 are the most common match setups. 5 minute matches. It's easy to reommend Rocket League if you're the type to go for a little bit of player versus player excitement now and then. Twitch skills not required. While the skill ceiling ball control wise is really high especially when it comes to reaching very high flying balls reaction time needed is pretty fair. Situational awareness is at least as important as reflexes.Main draws of the game + 5 8 min matches for the most part+ Very competitive+ Great responsive gameplay+ Physics based+ Easy to start with but has an incredibly high skill ceiling+ All DLC is cosmeticSome things that might push you away from the game It's still basically soccer even if with flying exploding cars. Very scarce single player content. If you don't want to play with and against others online the game is NOT for you. Controller pretty much required. If you get frustrated with lacking team coordination you will get frustrated with Rocket League in general. 2v2 or 3v3 are the most popular options so being able to at least read the intentions of your teammates evaluate and possibly even trust their team performance is important.
title: Rocket League®

review: I'm not generally into sports games or car games but I love this game! It's simply a blast to play.This game has tight controls that allow players more skilled than me (which is most of them) to do amazing things. It's still fun even if you're not that good. Graphics sound and music quality show an attention to production values and there are tons of unlockables and achievements. It supports split screen multiplayer quite well including local multiplayer vs online players. I was very happy with how it played on my Steamlink and Steam Controllers.It doesn't really fit into the genres of games I normally prefer but this one was a pleasant surprise. I recommend this game without hesitation.
title: Rocket League®

review: A must try for everyone. This is is how one can define addictiveness. The game is polished to its core and a blast to play. It's easy to learn and tough to master. I have spent over 200 hours on this game on PS4...I look forward to doing the same on my laptop.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is great. The physics are realistic and challenging the controls are joyfully complicated yet simple. Everything about this game is high octane fun. The hype in this game is damn near incredible. I would go as far to say that the concept is so out of this world that it's nearly perfect for those who want a mix of sport and racing and ing rockets.The community can be dreadful though. Players think they're good but they end up being terrible. Everyone is a ing ball hog I was just in a game where I was able to come around and I was lined up just right for a save and a teammate rammed me to get to the ball which he promptly lost and we got scored on. Needless to say I was fuming.Let me explain my position I do not consider myself a ballhog. Hell I don't even consider myself to be good. I trust in my teammates. If they're closing in on the ball I'll go back and defend just in case they lose it. If I can't get the ball to the goal on my own I pop it into the air and center it (to the best of my ability) so a teammate can bop it in. I play this way with my friends as well as strangers. Because that's how this game works. You work as a team and you win as a team. Sometimes that means you don't get a single goal. If you want to buy this game I suggest that you get the "Call of Duty" lone wolf mentality out of your skull. Otherwise you'll have a lot of off people typing in the chatbar.
title: Rocket League®

review: I've been playing Rocket League for nearly 2 years now ever since it was free on PS4. I love this game. I decided to pick it up on Steam so I could play with some of my PC friends. Still a great game but Psyonix really needs to put in some work on controller support. The game automatically detects a PS4 controller and it works great except for the fact that there is no vibration. 360 controller also works well but the vibration intensity is very low and inconsistent. Vibration is an important source of information when playing this game I would really like to see this issue addressed.

review: Why Rocket League is a great game with friends! I wrote a previous review Rocket League when I had 20hrs and my point of view on this game has only improved!I'm just gonna state some things in this review I decided to buy this game for pc because I wasn't able to play with my friend on Xbox (the platform I originally bought it for) I'm only lv 30 in this game to run this game at 60fps you will need at least a CPU around the i5 series and 2GB VRAM I play with a controller and there's nothing wrong with keyboard and mouse but I would say a controller would be better. this game is fun and is awesome with friends Rocket League is a game that you will clock a lot of hours on Rocket League's community can be toxic RL's trading is a crucial part of the game (cosmetics etc.) you have to buy keys to open crates (you can't earn keys) this game gets incredibly fun when you get good at it to play with a Xbox controller you will need a USB adapter for Xbox controllers they are on Amazon if you can't find it locally. To play with a PS4 controller just grab an android phone charger (chargers are around $10). you can use PS3 and Xbox 360 controller but I'm just saying how to do it for next gen and if you don't have a controller pick up a good controller for around $70aud. (around 80usd and 47euro)

review: So in my first review I didn't even attempt to actually put effort in it and I didn't even spell my crap right but I decided to eventually atually give this game a real review.Spent a lot of time on this game in my earlier days of steam despite my laptop being horrible at least for this game. I got something going after a while as I only did 1v1 then I realized that 1v1 is boring compared to the other ones tbh also if I lose when not doing a 1v1 then I can blame my teammates cause that's what everyone does in this game that has a big ego.This was when I actually started getting good at the game and also around the time where people slowly started to see trading as 95&amp of the game and really only played just so they could get more items to possibly trade even more. Then I eventually started to get bored of it unlike most people who play this game as most people didn't even care about playing just trading which made multiplayer worse tbh because people would rather spend most of their time on fancy little add ons to your car that you will barely even notice or care about during gameplay and was really only used to make yourself look good in front of other people. Positivies Good for casuals and more serious players attracts to a large variety of people Unlike other items Cars actually effect gameplay aren't just for looks Great with friends and online friends and it's really easy to meet people and add them to your friends list Once you start playing it's hard to get off it get's you addicted for hours Great online gameplay there has been so many games that I played that has horrible online gameplay and it takes forever while this game it's simple and fast to get on and start up a game and it works well as long as you don't have absoutle garbage internet. Training mode I ain't a huge fan of it but I made it a positive as you can design your own training thing that other people can play which is a nice touch that improves the game No dumb gimmicks just a simple good game you can play for hours Varitey of modes in case if you get bored of the traditional 2v2 or 3v3 Makes you actually use your brain and stragety despite it being such a simple fast paced racing/sports game makes you remember that you are actually playing a sports game as it is Soccer but with cars. The definition of a good sports game that doesn't try to replicate of what it actually feels like to play the sport.Negatives Way too many copies of decals that already exist but that are for different cars seems like a cheap way to fill up the item slots that are for crates Season Mode even though this is on the negative side I kind of enjoy the season mode but just because it's entertaining to play does not simply mean it is good they could improve the season mode in so many ways and make it better than what it is now they even could make it work for online but maybe I am just expecting too much out of a side mode 1v1's can be annoying to play at times as you could be the better player overall but if your internet goes bad you make a mistake or your finger slips it could mess up the whole game for you. The mode just feels like a repeated procress waiting for someone to make a mistake that's all it is from my expierences from the game mode which gets stale fast. Obession with trading this isn't really a problem by the creators themselves however they do promote it by making most updates revolved around items making people spend more money and making them more addicted to training even longer and makes the game feel like it's just all about trading and you end up having people who spend 90$ of their time just trading and not actually playing the game which can be annoying if you are just that person who just wants to do a few games but the person in your party just wants to trade then when you do trade with them they take 30 minutes to decide if they actually want to accecpt the trade or not since it's that important to them and wastes everyones time especially if you are in a huge party. Not being able to choose what you get in crates I know some people will try to counter this argument by saying people would always just choose the good items but here's the thing that's true and all but they could easily do systems where if you do certain tasks for example get a 3 game win streak in 1v1's or a different mode then you get a crate full of rare items and you get to choose out of those then you could make bigger tasks to get the better crates with better items and you could always do a thing where every 20 something games you get a higher leveled crate. I can kind of understand why they have it the way it is but it just bothers me that you are paying money to open a crate that might contain an absoutle garbage item in it and it just feels like crap tier gambling for items that aren't even worth like $1.99 and if you have high standards like me I wouldn't even consider some of the better items worth $1.99 while you got other people who will pay $25 for a heatwave which is to me tbh. Like many other games they are just trying to get your money with a cheap tatic. I know so many people will disagree with me on this but that's just my view point on it anyways gonna get to the next point now instead of continuing to complain.Honestly most of my complaints are on the community and there isn't many flaws on the game I can think of at least right now in the review but honestly it's uncessary to complain more about the community as the review is intended to be about the game.Overall the game is obviously good and I can see why this is seen as one of the best games in a while. As it's probably one of the best if not the best sports game I have played but there is a few problems with the game but mostly the community as like most fanbases it get's worse as it grows.9/10 idk why but I slowly lose intrest in it but I ain't gonna use that against the game much as in a quality view this is one of the most well established games I have played.
title: Rocket League®
