review: This game is exactly as fun as i thought it'd be. Id highly recommend it if you want to play a really great demolition soccer game as you really feel rewarded with everything you do and after each match. It has a high level cap and i really like that feature however once i reached level 20ish and got all of the cosmetics i started to feel less and less rewarded so there is that i suppose. Another thing i noticed is that the ranked systems a little messed up as to where if you win you get points but if you lose you lose double the amount of points you can win so i didnt like ranked too much. Those are pretty much the only negatives i can think of but other than that this is a really fun game that fits the term easy to learn hard to master perfectly as there are so much mechanics ways to win positions etc. Overall a reall great casual game that can also be extremely competitive.

review: I would put this at a 9/10 Well worth your money. I have put well over 66 hours into this game and have felt satisfied every second of it. Just to give you a comparison COD BO3 is $60 and has offered me less than half of the entertainment that I got from this game. Not only that but the constant updates show that the creators really care about how their games turn out. On a scale of 1 10 I would put this at an 9/10 because the only flaw would be it's standard controls. This game is still amazing.

review: I have never played a game with this level of replayability. It's incredibly easy to pick up but has an almost nonexistent skill ceiling. After playing for hundreds of hours you are always learning new things and improving. The gameplay is incredibly fun and intense and includes many game modes to vary up the game a bit. I have run into a few issues with connectivity but it's nothing major.If you don't like crates or microtransactions then don't buy them and stop whining.

If your reading this without a copy of it in your library I recommend that you stop reading and get a copy now. 20 bucks may seem like a lot but you won't be dissapointed. Thumbs Up.

review: Ever since the game's release even after all the rave and hype in the internet (especially 9gag) back then it didn't help me buy the game. I thought to myself "well all you're going to do here is just play football the difference being cars instead of some football player like FIFA". But then came a sale one year later. I was bored. It was nearing 1 am and I was window shopping in Steam this is a bad combo. Then came out my wallet to get my bank card to buy the one game I'm trying to avoid purchasing. Still bearing doubts I bought it and played it right away after downloading in a few minutes BECAUSE I WAS ING BORED.I go through the usual steps tutorials then exploring the menus bought some DLC cars from the garage and then I went to find an online match. I play for what I thought were a few minutes...aaand it was 6 am.If you're competitive and love to destroy your opponent's vehicle this game is perfect for you.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is phenomenal and I couldn't recommend it enough. It's just clean classic fun and a great destresser after a difficult day at work or class. The developers continue to put out new content through cars and maps. The pro competitions are amazing to watch and Psyonix continuously puts back into the community from the in game purchases. All of the dlc's outside of the actual cars have been free to the players (maps hoops rumble etc.). It's one of those games where you say "I can play a match or two and then go back to being productive"..... and then its 5AM. It's at a great price for the content and when its on sale there should be no questioning the purchase because it is worth every single penny. Great game Great community Stupendous developers (especially in today's age of early access and dlc's being more content and more money than the base game).
title: Rocket League®

review: Personally I'm not very much into football or racing games. That's my bias going into Rocket League. I started playing Rocket League alone and the concept was basically a child's idea of cars and football. I've also seen this game before even in Quake 2 mods back in the day. I don't know at all if it was the same team on its origins or if it's just common inspiration but in any case the idea for the game is easy to come up with. Which isn't a detractor. It's a fun idea.The car controls are very responsive. If it's not doing what you want it to do it's because you're not doing it right. It has a very long learning curve but it feels pretty rewarding all the way. There's a long way to mastering it though which is not a bad thing and you can appreciate the skill other players have in their maneuvres on your way there.The graphics are nice nothing suuuper amazing but it looks cool again like a kid's imagination so there's no downside there. When I started playing it only had football 2v2 3v3 and 4v4. Not being a big football fan that was kind of boring for me especially with the framework laid out. Recently they added extra game modes which are also fun (basketball hockey football with powerups and dropshot). Dropshot especially is a great addition especially for the football impaired such as myself. There's a lot of players online still so you won't have problems finding matches. The game makes some extra money on DLC and Crate keys which give you cosmetic stuff. I mean they need to pay for the continuous support and the servers right? But after buying the game you don't have to spend a penny more unless you want to.Overall it's a good simple game with great controls and gameplay cool graphics. The only detractor is a bit of a skill gap for the first time you play it online. You have to work a bit to get the minimum skills to be effective in game. I hope they keep adding more game modes I mean I'd even enjoy an actual racing game from these little cars. Oh. Gamepad extremely recommended. I think it would be nigh impossible to do those moves with keyboard sensitivity (the game sometimes involves flying through the air)And now a personal rant about online play Also guys please stop ending your games with "ez". Especially when you won 3 2 on overtime. But in general. Just respect your oponents and give a GG. Even if your team sucks. The oponents aren't to blame. This game's community isn't very toxic but you might find a here and there. But there are a lot of "ez" peeps around.
title: Rocket League®

review: First you get this game and you feel like "Oh funny... It's football and it's cars and it has rocket power! At first it really is just that a bunch of cars boosting over the field shooting the ball to whatever direction they are driving at the moment.But then quickly you realize that there is more to Rocket League that you can actually pass to your teammates or fly to get these damn balls that are up in the air.As you become better Rocket League shows that it really is a game in which team play tactic and skill is needed. All of which will improve while you re playing.There are however some drawbacks.Of course there are always toxic people and Rocket League is no exception in this regard. Nevertheless most people are really nice and polite.In unranked games the matchmaking can be really unfair sometimes so that you get matched with people 20 lvl higher f.e. It is not that often though normally your opponents are at a skill level similar to yoursIn ranked games it sadly is(/was?) possible to boost and play as a highly skilled player with a low lvl/ranked one and meet weaker opponents this way. This however is going to be fixed anytime soon (or it already is... idk I don't play ranked that often that i would have noticed)The game was developed for controller. It doesn't mean it is impossible or really bad for mouse and keyboard and it isn't that much of a disadvantage for normal players. You won't be able to dominate the tournaments without a controller though.Nevertheless I can just recommend this game as it is easy to learn hard to master but always a lot of funIt is football... with cars... that can fly What else do you want from a game? 69/69
title: Rocket League®

review: One of the best games I've ever played. The game is easy to pick up but hard to master which suits the type of games I like to play. Matches are relatively short (5 minutes on the clock) which is great for people that don't want to have to spend long periods of time on the game. Even then however it's easy to get sucked into the game and play for hours without noticing. The matchmaking system is pretty fair and whether you play ranked or non ranked matches you'll find plenty f people worthy of playing against. Definitely a game worth buying full price or on sale.

review: Is Rocket League worth getting? Ofc why not?Well to be more serious I rather reccommend you understand that this games requires a lot of practise and need lot of patience.How long does it take to get used to the game? It takes around a month to be able to hit balls as you want it to go.So you are telling me this game is hard? I wouldnt say hard well rather this game is real enjoyable when you start scoring goals. But please keep in mind with out putting hours into this game this can be real hard and also know you need to practice this game at least an hour a day to really be good at this game.Is it a pay to win game? No its not! Thats the best part about this game. This game is purely based on player skills and the ability of not getting tilted so easy.Why do I see lot of Chinese "Not Recommended"? All those "Not Recommended" are because of the servers in China. They are not allowed to play with regular servers. So they need a VPN to play this game. People complain on their own country it has nothing to do with the game. So keep calm and get the game.Your rating? 10/10
title: Rocket League®

review: In the Age of Ancients the world was unformed shrouded by fog. A land of gray crags Archtrees and Everlasting Dragons. But then there was Fire and with fire came disparity. Heat and cold life and death and of course light and dark. Then from the dark They came and found the Souls of Lords within the flame. Nito the First of the Dead The Witch of Izalith and her Daughters of Chaos Gwyn the Lord of Sunlight and his faithful knights. And the Furtive Pygmy so easily forgotten.With the strength of Lords they challenged the Dragons. Gwyn's mighty bolts peeled apart their stone scales. The Witches weaved great firestorms. Nito unleashed a miasma of death and disease. And Seath the Scaleless betrayed his own and the Dragons were no more.Thus began the Age of Fire. But soon the flames will fade and only Dark will remain. Even now there are only embers and man sees not light but only endless nights. And amongst the living are seen carriers of the accursed Darksign.Yes indeed. The Darksign brands the Undead. And in this land the Undead are corralled and led to the north where they are locked away to await the end of the world... This is your fate.Only in the ancient legends it is stated that one day an undead shall be chosen to leave the undead asylum in pilgrimage to the land of ancient lords Lordran.So overall it's a good game there's a lot hard bosses but eventually you'll get to the end of it if you work hard enough.

review: I love this game I honestly do. But I really can't stand the players you get teamed up with in random matches.Some of them are fine they're trying their hardest and doing a good job I don't mind those people at all. They're fine and if I lose while playing with them it doesn't bother me.But holy some players are a bunch of idiots so I thought I'd write some advice here instead of a full blown review.Tip #1 Just because you CAN hit the ball doesn't mean you SHOULD hit the ball. If the ball is right in the center of the enemy goal you see me racing towards the ball to score and get us the winning point. DON'T HIT THE SIDE OF THE BALL AND SHOOT IT INTO THE CORNER. WE DO NOT GET POINTS FOR THAT. YOU'RE SCREWING OVER YOUR OWN TEAM.Tip #2 Same goes for flying.Flying is cool and fun I get it. But winning is even more cool and fun. So if someone is about to score don't fly towards the ball and mess up the goal. Tip #3 Don't.ram.your.teammates.Much like team fortress 2 the people who are the same colour as you are your TEAMMATES NOT ENEMIES. YOU CANNOT PASS THEM. IF YOU HIT THEM WITH YOUR CAR THEY'RE GONNA FLY INTO THE ING SKY AND THEN CRASH LIKE AN ANVIL. I know you're in a hurry to hit the ball but watch where you're driving. Tip #4 Sitting under the ball while it's in the sky is not a good plan.Everyone is doing it it's like a party down there while the ball is just floating in the air. Atleast try to hit it while you're driving towards it instead of standing still and looking at it like it's an animal at a petting zoo.So yeah that's pretty much all I had to get off of my chest. Hopefully atleast one of you read this and gained some wisdom on how not to play. And hopefully somebody can relate and have a laugh at this. Peace out.
title: Rocket League®

A dev team that is always trying to fix bugs Constant updates and new contents for cars skins and modes. Both Competitive and Non competitive environments.While the game can be a bit slow to pick up since the Tutorial and first non bot game can be very different it pays off to not be discouraged about being bad at first. You might not like the game at first but keep at it and play with friends and you will come to love it.

review: One of the best games of recent times.Pros + Provides houndreds of hours of fun with friends or random teammates.+ Easy to learn Hard to master+ Really well optimised runs well on most hardware and still looks great.+ Great Community at reddit.com/r/RocketLeague active and supportive Developpers which bring out update after update and fix bugs asap.+ All the cars are pretty much the same altough there are paid cosmetics (and way way more free cosmetics btw) you do not need them to get good In other words if you only buy the main game theres nothing keeping you from becoming the very best player in the world.+ Can be played multiple ways strictly competitive to try and rank up or just for fun with friends no matter how you play it is still enjoyable+ Really cheap game for what you get out of it.Cons Not much you can do offline it is a multiplayer game so there are no offline missions or levels the only thing you can do is play with bots.Conclusion Definitely Worth it I'd recommend this game to everyone!

review: INTRODUCTION I really like this game specially when playing it with otherfriend in a lan party or online or even on split screen. You can play up to 4 players with Steam or XBOX controllers plugged into the computer. The idea of this game its pretty basic soccer with cars but in game its so much fun. ASPECTS I LIKE ABOUT THE GAME The game is really simple to understand for new players and the interfaces are pretty user freindly for the ones who just bought the game to understand and locate certain tabs quite easely. Customization in this game is on point. There are a huge amount of cars to choose from ranging from the Batmobile going all the way to the Delorean Time Machine from the Back to the Future movie! And aside all this car models you can also change the color scheme to fit your own style with the option of changing the wheels model add a custom hat and even changing your antena for some cool flags. Te game does not require a very high end PC fortunatelyI do have a good PC to run this and other games at the best graphics and the best settings but even if you don't have one you can still play with some solid 30 to 35 fps which is not the best but it gets the job done. ASPECTS I DON'T LIKE ABOUT THE GAME I'd like to see an update that include more gamemodes or if the developers think that they can't add more for the price even a dlc will be welcome. Controls may be a little difficult to learn at the beggining. I'm not talking about the basic controls i'm talking about more complex moves to score a goal or to play as a goalkeeper.

The beauty of Rocket League is that it successfully attracts casual gamers as well as hardcore players because the "easy to learn but hard to master" technique is the perfect definition of this game and it has become one of my favourite games to spend my time with friends.9/10

review: 70% thumbs up 30% thumbs down!I ll keep this short for you by sticking to the facts based on my own experiences. At the time of this review I ve got 38 hours in. I ve played online &amp offline in all game modes possible.To be fair the offline mode against All Star Bots is just as much fun as playing online against the masses.The game is fun fast and furious. Even down right frustrating at times no matter what mode you re playing.The game is very well done and has that just one more turn infectious quality to it.The arenas you play in are gorgeous.They have stadiums from Fallout s wasteland to Tron s digital grid.(However they need to design more stadiums. I like a lot more variety in competitive maps.Some new cars wouldn t hurt either.)THE COMMUNITY I have a lot of respect for most of the people playing. But I have an utter distain for the bags you will come across eventually if you play long enough. Those are the people who want to win at any cost. If they can find a way to cheat to achieve this objective they would. And I ll be honest. First they aren t as good as they think they are. If they lose it s not their fault but the fault of others. Then there are some monkeys on the opposite side that get mad if you demolish them. Like I m not supposed to hit you off your mark so you can continually score easy goals? Get real. Then you see a stream of crying comments that do nothing but make you laugh out loud. It s a game man! They treat it like it s the end of the world. So to be frank I blow em up again. Refuel. And blow their a$$es up again! Think I m mendacious?Look at some of the discussion threads in Rocket League. You actually have a guy posting an ad for people who know what they re doing . How the hell do we know this jerkwad knows what HE s doing? LOL! It s comical man. But that too is what makes the game so much fun. And once you get the hang of it you re ranking top dog at the end of just about every match.In closing if you re on the fence about RL I d get it if you like cars sports speed and competition! As a whole you ll LOVE the community of gamers. And if you find players that really torque your shaft do what I do. Blow their a$$es up! This is the only game I ve played that made me realize It s not whether you win or lose but how you play the game isn t a senseless aphorism after all.*And a tip for new players. Don t chase the refuel deposits. FOLLOW THE BALL!Happy Gaming.
title: Rocket League®

review: If you haven't bought into the hype yet you need to do it right now. Rocket League will be remembered as one of the best games of this decade because it does everything right. Here's a bunch of things that make Rocket League an excellent game Easy to play hard to master. It doesn't matter if you just want to play a game evry once in a while or go all out and become an e sports player Rocket League has you covered equally well in both departments Lots of updates! Rocket League is still being updated with bug fixes new arenas and new game modes all of this for free. The devs are also super nice.DLC done right. DLC in this game is purely cosmetic and is very reasonably priced. The DLC doesn't lock anyone out of anything so you can still play with friends that don't have DLC. Good performance. Rocket League is an Unreal Engine 3 game which means that most computers will handle it and on top of that it's also very well optimized so you can be sure to hit those sweet 60 FPS. Nice community. What? An online game with a community that isn't 100% cancer? Yes my friends the Rocket league communit in and out of the game is super friendly and laid back just very very sarcastic (What a save!).Cross platform play! Yes this is one of the few games that offer cross platform play so you can play with your friends on PS4 or Xbox One! This also means that there's always someone to play against. Local coop. Remember playing couch multiplayer? So do I and I miss it but Rocket League does local multiplayer and does it well even supporting multiple screens if you have them!Play with anything. Mouse &amp Keyboard? 360 controller? Xbox One Controller? PS4 controller? That controller you ordered from china? Yes rocket league supports them all!So there you go I just gave you a whole bunch of reasons to buy this game and if you need another one is its price. 20 is a bargain for this game and it also goes regularly on sale you won0t regret buying this.
title: Rocket League®

review: As a non European non South American soccer is the most painful sport for me to watch. I don't understand it at all. I don't understand why billions love it. I don't understand why FIFA sells so well every year. I don't understand the World Cup or the soccer hooligans or why the timer counts up to 90 and doesn't pause when the ref blows his whistle.But I can understand why people love Rocket League. The devs took a deceptively simple idea and turned it into one of the best multiplayer games of all time. The short 5 minute matches are always action packed and it never feels like it drags on too long unless both teams are awful and go 8 minutes into overtime failing to score on each other.Not only is the physics based car rocket soccer Kerbal Space Program flying demolition derby Dukes of Hazard Spiderman Messi simulator gameplay deep and compelling but the devs have put more love and support into this game than most devs do with their families. The level of free support is almost unheard of I say almost because I can't think of any other examples off the top of my head but I don't want to have someone say "Well actually..."I've never had more fun playing a video game with my friends than I have had when playing Rocket League. It's a masterpiece of modern gaming and the gold standard which other game devs should look to when designing their own games.
title: Rocket League®

review: You launch the game expecting some sort of tutoral right off the bat. Nope! Start screen leads you to antother screen where you have multiple options to choose from. luckily if you hover over the icons it tells what it is. If you can figure out where the tutorial is your ready to play. or if you like figureing things out start a new season. ether way its the thrill of an actual ball game.your body is pumped and when you trick shot into that goal OOOOOOHHHHHH THAT SCREEM AND AMAZMENT YOU GET!its also quite cool that you can cotomize your car. But you have to earn your customizeations first. all in all heres the overveiew Pros 1.Adrenalene all the way2.Get to play with firends and share the exitement3.online or AI you choose4.Controls are easy weather you play controler or not. That is very rare in a game!!Cons 1.Camra is a little hard to get used to. (lukily they have settings for that)2.It has TONS of dlc (1.00+ real money) for costomizetion and you already bought the game for alot of money.3.people are jerks online. (although thats kindive in all onlne games /)All in all i would recommend this game if you like sports looking for some adrenaline and there is something missing in your life. Probibly its rocket leauge! This game you can play for YEARS

review: Product received for free. Very addicting game that I've played for about a year now. The awesome physics and intense gameplay make this a very fun game to play for hours at a time. The ability to customize your car with hundreds of different color combinations and accessories like flags hats and wheels for each of the two teams (orange and blue) adds a lot to the game. It allows you to spend time and have fun on something other than just straight gameplay. Sometimes I spend almost as much time customizing my car as I do playing the actual game! Rocket League is a great game to play with friends and provides hours of enjoyment. This game is still one of my favorite games to play to this day! I would very highly recommend it!

review: Rocket League is an Arena based football simulation with a twist Instead of your beloved players running up and down the pitch show us those crazy skills you get cars that can boost spin fly jump and skid....Firstly I'd like to say this game has a crazy high skill ceiling for those who do not know what that means.. basically you can learn the mechanics and play in such a way that you'll be able to Lob that unsuspecting keeper from your own goal. The game itself is pretty much straight forward and your objective is pretty simple. Although as it says above I've only played the game for a limited time I did also own the game previously.Rocket League is a really fun game to play as a solo or even with a group of friends it has many modes to offer as well as "Ranked" modes for those who enjoy a somewhat competative scene.Pros Free to play and by this i mean free to play and not pay to win. Semi Casual fun Many localised Servers ( Pretty much every continent is covered) Some Customisation ( Colours Aerials Tires Booster Trails. It also offers premium item shop cars etc)Cons Player Matchmaking is sucky You will face many opponents of a much higher Class/Division than yourself The day I got the game my first match was against a Veteran A Semi Pro and a Pro. Customisation is limited although I put this as a Pro it is also a Con. Limited Replayablitiy Although the game is really fun you will find yourself replaying the same arena's and getting sick at some pointOverall I love the game And will continue playing it however it is not a game I could play everyday just simply because after a couple of hours a day it gets boring. For the price I'd say its worth it and the game is still been developed by this i mean they are adding arena's making adjustments etc.
title: Rocket League®

review: ROCKET LEAGUE a game with endless fun and the football game only for carsHave you ever imagined a match on football that you watch on TV thats plain boring and waste of 90 minutes of your life?Well this game can help and increase your interest on playing football with.. CARS(probably only if you are a car lover too)The Game Total match length(MULTIPLAYER ONLINE) only 5 minutes! or more if the match is tie causing to Overtime( no limit until a team scores Over infinite possibilities on customising your car from grotesque to glamorous You can do a lot of football tricks like bicycle kick You can exchange items like trading on popular games like TF2 and Dota 2 Matches that drop items at the end of the game( this game is rumoured that it has Item cap and that sucks)The Community On average that I came across I frankly say that they are polite( I know you may disagree) Able to work together and assist one another despite on how bad the match is( i meant that my team is losing) They have TEAMWORK and RESILIENCE both of which that work together with DETERMINATIONMy rating Amount of Positive continually increases over time/10 )Thanks Psyonix! what a worthy game and pleasurable experience

review: I had seen videos of other people play and read about it so i knew what it was. Its not rocket science. Its soccer (or football depending on which side of the pond you are on) with cars. Just like top gear but you have rockets and can jump like speed racer. So i download this for the free weekend and skip all the tutorials and dont even bother looking up the controls. I go straight to the online action. One match and i was hooked! I bought and paid for the game on the spot and it is my new favorite time waister. If you like soccer or hockey or basketball (they are about to add that with a dlc) and you also like cars then this is the game for you! The cars in the game all look at home as a hotwheel car. you wont find any liscensed vehicles. But no matter they all look cool and really only for looks. the car you choose does not matter. Yow wont find any pay to win here either. Just pick a cool car and have fun!I give Rocket League 5 out of 5!
title: Rocket League®

review: TL DR buy it but dont play with ps4 kidsRocket League is an amazing sports game. It's a game that you can either pick up every once in a while or play it religiously. Sure at the beginning of the game there is a bit of a grind to get all of the default cars/decals/etc and there are many other items available through crates events and DLC. The community is okay (there are some toxic players but many players in this game are pretty nice) but make sure to always have a teammate to queue up with. The rank system is kinda messed up as it could take multiple games to division up but then you could lose that division with just 1 loss. Also there is a new ban system for blacklisted words! Most other PC players don't care but PS4 and Xbox kids probably will report you for anything that their mommies don't wanna see on their screen. OVERALL a very good game I would recommend it to casual gamers competitive gamers people who like sports/cars/action people who are ready to have their life sucked into the black hole that is Rocket LeagueEasy to learn Hard to master will keep you coming back for hundreds of hours most addictive muliplayer game ever.

review: I've been playing for a while now and honestly I thought I would be bored at this point. I'm not ) Most of the community is friendly and thankfully we cannot communicate with the PSN players so the 12 year old's trash talk is rare. This is a very enjoyable game ESPECIALLY when you have that awkward 45 minutes when you need to be somewhere and you don't have the time to jump into an RPG or something. Games are on average about 7 or 8 minutes including replays. I HATE sports games and thought this was one of them but its not. This game is for anyone who likes to play games regardless of your preferable genre. I also bought it at full price BUT its almost half off this weekend...GET IT OR REGRET IT lol...

review: Part of me doesn't even want to write this because this game is already so huge and so well reviewed. But lets be real The game is difficult. There is a learning curve. You almost need friends to play ranked. Most teammates are horrible and do not want to play like a team. They wont defend if you ask they will try and hit every ball you do. Get a mic. It's going to take maybe 10 games to understand the physics of the ball and even then you'll still play games where you get your handed to you. Losing 6 0. It happens.I Love this game honestly. Matches are quick so I can jump on play 3 games and be done and have only used 20 min or so. They are constantly adding game modes and fun updates and are usually free. Good Game..Good Company. Buy it.
title: Rocket League®

review: A very fun game of rocket powered car soccer! I have played just over 200 rounds and am not bored yet! Some goals that you make just leave you in awe of your own abilities! I'll tell the story of my favorite goal that I made.&gt Ball is rolling slowly about to go into my team's goal.&gt I am boosting over to try to block it from going in but an enemy player is boosting to blow me up.&gt I hit the ball into the guy boosting to blow me up.&gt The ball bounces off him flies through the air and I score on the enemy team.10/10 would ricochet score again!

review: How about this Every time a game is about to start and I see that we're playing on a standard vanilla map it lights up my day. Because the core game the physics the mechanics etc. are so well balanced that no gimmicks at all are required. Rocket League is just a really compelling competitive experience with a perfect learning curve and an impossibly high skill ceiling.
title: Rocket League®

review: I've put so many hours into this game. It's a really addicting and fun game and great to play with friends. But I'm giving it a thumbs down because recently every match I play has been glitching right when I'm about to hit the ball. I say glitch because it seems like lag but my ping it in the 20s everytime and it only happens when I get close to the ball. It makes the game unplayable since I can no longer make good saves or shots on goal. So I do not reccomend this game as you might experience the same issues I have.Edit Like I said above I dont think my internet is the cause of this problem. My PING is consistently in the 20s when I play and I make sure that I am recieving quality internet speeds from my ISP.

review: Looks like a stupid concept but it's really fun. I don't like traditional sports games but this is totally different.EDIT 6 months after buying this it's safe to say it's the best game I've played in a LONG time (maybe best ever?) I don't remember having this kind of fun with videogames since I was a kid. The controls are really tight. You can get really comptetitive even if you're usually not in other games. I haven't played a single game this much since WoW and that was only because Blizz laced it with crack. This is actually a good game with challenging and rewarding gameplay with a strong "just one more game" factor.EDIT 2 I've had this game for two years now? It's still the only game I play. You only get better and more confident with aerials and such as you play. It definitely lands in my top five games of all time.

The maps are unique and not just rehashes of each other and the DLC is very worth it if you like the cars and such(+).Overall I definitely recommend this game. You'll get way more than a $20 value out of it. Hours and hours of fun for everyone!!

review: Imagine your copy of Burnout 3 did a dragonball z style fusion with FIFA or PES. You load up your new game and you are boosting around the walls of an arena flipping around and hoofing a giant ball at your opponents goal. All of this is happening whilst your car has a ribbon on top and poops rainbows out the back these features only anger your enemies further as the goals keep piling in. Pros Lots of customization A suitable soundtrack Responsive and well thought out controls Easy to get into difficult to master Decent updates at decent intervals Developers seem to actually care Practically glitch free Rewards players that work together Several practice modes to improve specific skills In game quick chat menu for that extra layer of tactical playCons Style of cars and whatnot may not be to your taste Music can be a bit samey but when you're in a game you tend not to notice The program for putting players against those of a similar level is quite inconsistent (teams of rookies versus veterans and masters for example) The amount of ragequits I've seen in this game is just baffling. If your opponents score 2 or 3 in the first minute and a half you can expect your team mates to bugger off and leave you with AI companions. How do you expect to improve if you leave every match where your opponents are more skillful?
title: Rocket League®

review: I love this game and I hate it at the same time i love it because of the capacity it has to keep challenging you and to keep you engaged in trying new moves and new ways to score the coolest goal you ever scored but i hate it because when people say it's hard to master it's really freaking hard... I mastered Dark Souls way faster than this game (which i still suck) just be prepared to try each new move like 200 or 300 tries until you can finally pull it off 20% of the times you try it. Its really stressful if you're trying to be good at it but if you're in it for the lolz you'll just knock the ball around and have a few laughs along the way.Kinda overrated even though i like it just know what you're getting into don't expect to be good with only 50 or 60 hours of gameplay unless you're like a talent at it right away
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a game that always introduces new aspects to you and never lets you get bored. It is definitely a 'just 5 more minutes' game but amazingly entertaining at the same time. The trading community is excellent and finally getting an item you always wanted can leave you feeling so accomplished. The car customization itself is an awesome feature that offers so many different customizations. As you progress through the different skill levels there are new techniques to learn and playstyles which are awesome to know. The competitive scene behind this game is getting larger and it is so fun to watch such high level players play!All in all i'd completely recommend this game to anyone whether you're a casual player or very competitive!

review: The good Rocket League is a LOT of fun for casual and competitive playing. Four modes to choose from plenty of arenas (both official and experimental) and tons of customization to be had with unlocks! The game is well balanced and everyone is on equal footing at all times. I highly recommend this game in lieu of regular sports games that come out every year because it is quite the breath of fresh air and it keeps on getting better with every update!The bad The first 10 hours of online gameplay (actual time played in matches) during any given week is when you'll get your drops. After those 10 hours are up you'll probably only see a Championship Crate or two every couple of hours after that and MAYBE you'll get lucky and get a rare drop maybe. I really dislike this system and think this is the worst feature in the game. It doesn't make the game any less fun to play but it's just frustrating because it would still be a lot of fun to receive duplicate items to at least trade them in for a single item of one rairity higher.The ugly Microtransactions have been added since the last "Rumble" update and a lot of people are pretty upset about it. Personally I am not too upset because I do not to buy keys for TF2/CS GO etc.. but I don't support this decision and their excuse of funding the prize pools for competitive tournmanets I couldn't care less about the people who play competitively for money. And like many other reviews have already said had the customization items found in creates been added as a small paid DLC like previous ones I would've had no problem buying it.Misc Psynonix needs to tweak their Save and Epic Save detection because I believe ANY ball clear from the goal line should be considered a save. There are plenty of times where the ball is rolling on the goal line or an opponent is sitting on the goal line and the ball is flashing as if it is about the cross and I come and knock out and I get no Save or Epic Save and no Clear Ball either. I believe that these two "moves" should be tweaked so they are awarded properly.Demolitions are another thing that should be tweaked. You get zero points for crushing an opponent and I believe it should be worth 10 points per demolition just like a First Touch. This would especially make using the Fist power up in Rumble a lot more fun to use and encourage players not to use it just to get rid of it.
title: Rocket League®

review: I love this game and how weird it is with the mix of cars and soccer. Plus there are so many things you can learn and do here! p
title: Rocket League®

review: I fell in love with this game the moment I started playing with it. I'm a big football/soccer fan (or whatever you call it) but I haven't played many racing games unless you count Mario Kart Double Dash and that weird Crash Bandicoot racing game I used to love in elementary school. It takes lots of practice to get better at it but it's not like the boring hours of grinding in RPGs or anything. This game makes hours of practice only feel like a few minutes. I'd definitely recommend getting this game. It's well worth the money. I bought it on sale for 50% off and I think it would have been worth the full price if I didn't buy it on sale. My computer isn't one that'd be praised by PC master race elitists but it can run this game with all settings on high without a problem. Sometimes the game crashes in the main menu but never in game. The only other complaints I have is about the match making services. You're often paired up with people that are not at your skill level. The servers are also pretty laggy at times. Other than that this is a great game with amazing graphics and gameplay. I'd also like to add that I'm playing it with a mouse and keyboard and I have no issues doing so. I'm really bad at flying but that's my own fault XDAre you still reading this? Go buy yourself a copy of Rocket League!10/10 would spin around and pretend like they know how to play this game (myself included)
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is a fantastic multiplayer romp that is pretty basic at it's core but is unmistakably well executed. In an average game you play in teams of around 3 4 players and yeah it's pretty much football with a strong resemblance to the car football played in some Top Gear episodes with other gameplay quirks such as boost and air manoeuvres.The game offers a variety of customisability for your car with different paint jobs accessories and bodies. Most of these you collect as a form of random drop the more matches you play although many of the rarer and exclusive items can be bought as DLC these are purely cosmetic and do not affect gameplay in the slightestst. If you get bored of the standard game modes there are also a variety of others as well as being able to set up your own customisable modes when setting up a private game. The Servers are very good and I have not had any major lapses in connection of late.So all in all this is a very good game although you may want to wait for a sale in order to get it for a bit less money as while you will definitely get a good few hours in it you still likely won't get quite as much as other titles in the same price range.

review: I've been playing this for over a year now. How wonderful.Positives Players control cars tha fly via rocket engine. Fun and ridiculous. The visual style is pretty and still runs at 60 FPS. Thanks Unreal Engine. The controls are very tight and responsive even if you're using a keyboard. The mechanics of the game are easy to learn hard to master. It's great for parties as it supports local split screen play. Sadly with PC you can't use keyboard and controller at the same time. There are a ton of customization options for your car. All of them are just cosmetic and don't affect gameplay at all making it more skill and team based.Negatives The AI is not very bright and tend to swarm the ball like a pack of bees. This super linear behavior makes the singleplayer Season mode frustrating at times. The competitive ranking system is picky and truly frustrating to work with due to the fact it tracks only wins and losses. There will be many times you'll jump up a ranking tier only to lose a game and go straight back down usually to get out of a tier you'll need a big winning streak. Fancier cosmetic items come in crates similar to CS GO and keys that cost real money are required to open them up. I personally find it ok since profits from key purchases help fund eSports prize pools.8.5/10 A solid game with a solid community and a supportive team of devs behind it. I recommend it to everyone who enjoys those 5 minute adrenaline rushes.Updated 11/24/16
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket league is one of the most refreshing games I ever played due its simplicity in gameplay but rather high learning curve. Let's take a basic look at the game Gameplay This game is essentailly Soccer/Football with race cars.You can play solo or with teams and the objective of the game of course is to score against the opposing team with the ball. Now Psyonix (Developer) has implemented various game modes and maps to make the game more interesting such as hockey mode but for me I stick to the basic game as it is also the most competitive. Controls Game can be played using a controller or keyboard + mouse. Personally i recommend you use a controller if you have one. Music/Sounds There isn't really much to say here the majority of the music you will hear is through the main menu with the genre mainly being electronic. Either you like it or you don't but you can always disable the music through the menu. The sounds are rather excellent most cars and boosts have thier own unique sound. It is quite immersive to hear the crowd chanting when you play the game especially when you score. Story The story is non existent don't buy this game if you're expecting a great story. Monetization So the main way this game makes its money aside from the initial purchase is through DLC in the form of cosmetics. You can buy different cars boosts paints etc. The DLC is rather cheap but the good thing is that this game is NOT pay to win and your DLC has no real effect on the gameplay of others.Overall this game is excellent and quite cheap. Buy this game if you like cars and/or soccer. I do want to warn others about something though this game is really reliant on good ping to fully enjoy the gameplay. This game also does have some server issues but it is slowly getting better. Highly recommended.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket league is probobly one of the best car footballs infact probobly the ONLY one.And has inpressed me with all of it's great features.Buying the game for about 14 only to get The DLC for 1 or less(Steam sales) and has inpressed me and fails to dissapoint many i STRONGLY advice this game with a big 10/10 score the features of this amazing game include Great/decent community*Amazing features*HATS(i play TF2 of course i like hats!)*Trails*Customizable cars!*AND IT'S FREE(besides the DLC's)(NOT FREE JUST MY TYPO CAN'T BE BOTHERED TO CHANGE IT SINCERILY A LAZY PERSON)*Also good seasons/singleplayer!Only a few cons probobly one or two*Some hard features to get ahold of but satisfying to pull off*Even some people rage idk why in his game of greatness*Sometimes they are a few lagspikes for a few people leads to disconnects But still after those 3 cons this game is still a good 10/10 as i strongly reccomend you get this game if you like footballing cars hats and overall a good game!(Side affects include Addiction thinking your car can jump and dive off a cliff thinking that your car can go turbo speeds)

review: Get this game if you need more frustration in your life. I am constantly miscalculating shots and blocks I'll have a 10 second or so build up of "oh man the ball is coming straight for me get ready for a simple tap into the goal...here it comes..." and then at the last split second I'll completely miss the ball and jump into the air. Luckily you can turn off chat because there's always comments like "OMG HUMAN HORSE SUCKS SO BAD" "WHERE THE IS MY TEAM" "HOW DID YOU MISS THAT" "YOU ING SUCK HUMAN HORSE" etc. I'm not sure if continuously getting angry with myself is healthy but I can't stop playing. I have hundreds of hours I think it's extremely addicting!

review: Rocket League is a fun game to play alone with friends online or locally. It has many different game modes for when you get bored or frustrated playing a certain game. You can play competitively to rank up and earn season prizes or casually to just mess around. It has a steep learning curve but with time and practice youll see improvement. It's not always easy to get the right hit on the ball or land that freestyle goal but the it's the difficulty that makes it so satisfying when you finally do. All in all this game is a really well made game with loads of options as to how you want to play. Definitely give it a try.

review: Rocket League is an excellent multiplayer game that envokes competitive gameplay and a fun environment with friends. The game mechanics are good and once mastered makes for a great gaming experience. If you play in the online matchmaking the community can be quite salty. Thankfully the developers have implemented a new system to deal with this. So far it looks to be rooting out the riff raff. I highly recommend this game to anyone of any age. Its a great time.

review: At first a few friends came up and said "Hey try this game footbal with cars". I was like oh hell no I don't even like football. Over 50 hours later... well damn if I don't like football this game is balls literally. It definitely takes a few kicks and explosions to adapt. Until about 15 hours in I was able to call myself a capable player but only after a struggling period of ups.Great graphics colorful dynamic vivid.Great music not as a standalone soundtrack but a rather excellent ambient element.Toxic community no good game comes without it's toxicity don't get caught messing up in a ranked match you'll be in for some destructive criticism.Nice DLC unlike many other games that poorly rely on micro transactions this game has a fine implementation of the loot chest mechanic. It's all visual so you won't depend on loot drops and microtransactions to kick This is the first game of it's genre and will remain a staple for years.

review: Once a buddy of mine came to me and told me that a game about cars playing soccer with rockets was tons of fun and super skill based without the complexity of street fighter. I laughed at him because it sounds absolutely silly and I hate soccer why would I want to play a soccer game?Well here I am 300+ hours later telling you that friend was very much right. This game is easy to learn difficult to master. Before you go away thinking you don't want to be competitive you'll be right at home too. What's interesting is that beginners play their game which is actually really different than higher level games and somehow everyone has a lot of fun.This game has all of the features local online local + online multiplayer customizable cars customizable game modes oddly shaped maps. This game has everything EXCEPT IT DOESN'T HAVE A MASTER VOLUME SLIDER I MEAN REALLY.... anyway that's minor.Furthermore this game has excellent support from the devs which keep adding stuff in. I would have 100% recommended this game a year ago before it had half as many cosmetics as it did now and no weird maps or game modifiers. Now I can only recommend it more.

review: I totally love this game. It's easy to learn hard to master fun and highly competetive.However I hate this game's community. I've never been told to die or kill myself as often as in this game which means a lot considering that I also play League of Legends quite a bit. If I want to tryhard and climb or even just focus on improving mechanics/positioning i'll need to mute other players most likely because for me it is highly distracting and demotivating to hear someone about every small mistake I make. Blocking the communication entirely through muting them is not always a great solution though for it can be helpful to know certain things your that your mate wants to tell you.("I got it""I got it""I got it")Don't get me wrong. Not every match is unreasonable toxic and it extremely depends on the time you play (during schooltime and in the late evening/night the majority of those young raging fellows won't be around). It can be mildly entertaining aswell since those sorts of exaggerated flaming occur mostly in the losing team (and you'll win tons of games where the opposing team is too busy blaming each other).I'd recommend just avoiding random teammates if you are like me a bit sensitive regarding insults. Grab your friends instead when you can you won't miss a thing.(Come to think of it this statement is applicable to almost any multiplayer game)
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is one of those rare gems from every era that consists of such smooth and intuitive gameplay that speaks to everyone and yet has plenty of depth for those who seek it. No matter your skill level there is something innate about rocket powered cars smashing into a ball rugby style that appeals to the very core of every one of us. It's ridiculous it's tense it's exciting...it's fun. If all that wasn't enough the developers continue to pump out amazing content in the form of cosmetics arenas and modes of play to keep the game crisp and interesting. For all of that Rocket League warrants my time to praise it because it's a triumph. It's an instant classic. It's a treasure for the ages.

review: I've been playing Rocket League since the beta. It is likely my most played game right after World of Warcraft and StarCraft. Started out on PS4 after couple of months moved onto PC. Easily one of my top multiplayer games ever. If you have a friend or two to play with the fun factor multiplies by 10.PROS+ Highly polished+ Devs communicate with playerbase (reddit is very active)+ Easy to learn but skill ceiling is high+ Local multiplayer!!CONS Lootboxes (cosmetic items only no effect on gameplay) Playerbase can be quite toxic especially on competitive playlists (disable chat and you are good) Some people are having trouble with serversNOTE Controller is highly recommended.

review: I would reccomend getting a controller for this game. Heavily. The keyboard controls inhibit gameplay (with the exception of more accurate movement on the ground) and limit the camera (there are 2 views on keyboard straight ahead or ball cam. On a controller you are allowed to tilt the camera in any direction from either of these viewpoints). The keyboard also causes far more problems for areial movement as opposed to the controller. This game also has excelent controller support and if you plug in a ps4 controller (the only one I've tried as of yet) it immediately maps the controller to the game.0/10 on keyboard8/10 on controller

review: Rocket League is one of my most played games of all time and it is simply because it is just a fun game. It's fun playing with friends it's fun playing by yourself it's fun customizing your car it's fun collecting new items it's fun trying to get a higher rank in the online competitive mode it's just plain fun. It can defnitely be frustrating at times but that is true for all sports games. Psyonix keeps delivering new content and the game continues to stay fresh. I'm not very good at video games in general but somehow Rocket League is able to make me feel so proud of myself when I'm able to make a backwards goal or "epic save." This is a game with $60 worth of content for $20 and should be bought by anyone who has the computer to run it.

review: The game is really good. Be prepared it has a steep learning curve. At the start you struggle to hit the ball but once you get the hang of it you get improved every day and end up doing incredible air goals. It's a very fun game especially playing with your friends. Totally a must buy!
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is what happens when you give a LOL player a ball and put him in a room with a DOTA2 player that swings a sack of salt....yeah just try to imagine that. Hilarious. Okay however the gameplay is highly addicting. You start out not knowing what the hell you are doing chasing a giant ball around a court...with your car. Your rocket propelled car. And then you try to get that ball into the enemys goal. Like with your car. But since you're a rookie you probably won't hit that ball...like ever. Good thing is the others won't hit it either so it's driving around 5 minutes per round trying to hit that ball or other players no matter if they're tammates or not as long as you hit SOMETHING!Later as you advance through the ranks and learn the ropes you'll start to actually hit stuff with your car! Sometimes even things that move! Like your own goalie for example. After a couple of hours then you finally learn how to fly and hit more things. Maybe the ball even! And score! And afterwards you start to learn how to actually be usefull for your teammates! And then when you advance even further you'll realize that your teammates s**k. All of them. And that YOU are the only person on the field to win that match for your team since everybody else is just plain incompetent. Thats why you'll leave every match early. Even when your team wins. Since a victory is only a victory if you crush your enemies 10 0 or something. Well this describes the usual progression in Rocket League. And even if the community might be as salty as that room you put that LOL and that DOTA2 player in after they realized the doors are locked and they will probably starve to death and have to kill each other to survi...you know what I mean. So even if the community might be salty at times and progression really depends on skill and more than often of the teammates you get overall it is freaking awesome to play just another match and maybe hit the ball.Give it a try. You don't like sports? Try it anyways. You might realize that THIS is a kind of sport you could actually enjoy. I mean you don't have to REALLY move or DO anything...you can sit and press buttons...and hit stuff with a car.
title: Rocket League®

review: I've played the game long enough for you to trust me on this (over 1500 hours). It is a very addicting multiplayer physics based sports game at its core but that does not tell the whole tale. Besides the varitations of the core game mode Standard 3v3 you'll also find fun and Casual modes like Rumble Dropshot Hoops and the hockey like Snow Day. Customizable Battle Cars and hours of intense multiplayer gameplay await. However you will suck at the beginning like most and find it difficult to get off the ground but if you find any enjoyment and stick with the quirky car soccer long enough you will see your progress start to soar and get hooked as I did. The deveolper (Psyonix) has done a great job of supporting the game since it's release by adding free arenas free modes free customizations/items paid DLC and a crate system as well as fixing issues/bugs in a decent time frame. Overall the Pros outweigh any negatives. So if you're ready to get out on the pitch and blast some balls into the net I can't wait to meet you in matchmaking and crush your dreams.
title: Rocket League®

review: I've spent over 600 hours on this game and I'm still enjoying it. The new crates cars and updates keep this game interesting. I find the occasional toxic player every few games (just mute them) but that comes with all competitive games. The learning curve for this game might make this game frustrating but if you put time and effort. You'll for sure have endless hours of playing this addictive fun game. Defiantly try it out!

review: Wonderfully designed game granted to give you hours of fun! On top of being crazy fun its not too bad on your wallet and so well optimised that on my 10 YEAR OLD desktop hunk o junk computer can run the game in its lowest settings at a steady 70 FPS!!!!!!! The only downside to this wonderful game being that it can get old if you play it too much as there isnt much to the game other than its base gameplay. Though the quick matches are perfect for killing a little time and playing every once in a while! The game is fairly simple and easy to pick up. The controls aren't frusterating in the slightest an in no time you'll be scoring with the best of them!I rate a solid 9/10 for this amazing game! (would have had a 10/10 if it had more game modes)
title: Rocket League®

review: I think i have played enough of this game (70+ hours) to give a well informed review.I love this game so much. It is just fun. It never gets boring. And I mean never. Every match is something exciting. Theres nothing better than scoring the game winning goal or blocking shots on your goal. Its highly addicting. My friends and I all love this game so much and I would reccomend this to anyone. One of my close friends hates sports games (Madden FIFA Etc.) but LOVES Rocket League. It is very different from any other sports/car games Ive ever played. Also I think the price is extremely fair. Serious 10/10. (I think that Rocket League should be added to the 2020 Olympics)

title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is simple well balanced fun accessible and cheap ( $10 when I bought it). This is a game that can be played competitively or just casually with friends. A round just lasts a few minutes so you can squeeze in a lot of games in a short period of time. All the unlocks are purely cosmetic and all new game modes are unlocked for free.Rocket League also makes me fully aware that I am an uncoordinated piece of trash that will never be good at this game. To be clear that is not the games fault the physics and controls are very intuitive and smooth but I still manage to screw up constantly. You get occasional lag issues but its not very frequent. I'm pretty sure I'm going to waste a large portion of my life trying to get better at this game.Its hard to find a game this cheap that can appeal to such a wide audience. Definitely worth it.
title: Rocket League®

review: Product received for free. So let me start off my saying I'm not into sports games or driving games. I get that that makes it a little odd to try rocket league but I've seen loads of people say that despite loathing both of those they absolutely love it.My main issue is matchmaking. So as a "novice" I was regularly up against "pros" "masters" and "veterans". Now whilst I get that that's not an indication of skill but rather time played it made the matches feel lope sided and not fun at all. Rather than being thrown into a match in a few seconds I'd rather wait a few minutes and have a much more even match. Also I was often put into games already in progress on some team 0 4 that I guess someone QQed out of. I'd rather it work like most mobas in which every game you play you start at the start and if you leave you get a deserter penalty and keep doing it and it'll eventually result in suspensions. Though I do have a little sympathy for them considering how terribly matched most of the games I was in were.I wasn't that keen on the camera either I was forced into using the ball tracking one too often to be able to tell what was going on when I'd much rather have used the regular one and just been able to zoom out a lot further. Though perhaps this would just take some more getting used to and the game is definitely very skill based.There's loads to like in the game though. The mechanics are just right and they've clearly spent along time refining it and getting everything to work really well together. The driving feels good even to someone who doesn't like racing games. Unlocking something after every match felt really rewarding. The customisation was great and as odd as this might sound some of the hats and things made the cars quite cute. There were numerous maps with nice themes. It in general ran pretty well (despite my bad computer) though some maps were worse than others.So given only the couple gripes and the lots to like the thumbs down might seem odd. Truthfully I would have much rather given it some sort of middling rating. But the fact of the matter is that while I'm glad to have tried it I have no intention of buying the game once the weekend is up even on sale and so can't really give it a thumbs up.However if they ever made it into a real life sport (should the world become some sort of post apocalyptic disaster land) I'd probably rather enjoy watching it.

review: I have to say I'm on the fence with this game. It is a great game and I have gotten multiple hours of entertainment out of it for a mere $20 game. Very much worth every cent. The gameplay is fun the visiuals are creative the maps were great untill everyone ed and we got stuck with just the same field reskined in 20 different ways..... The mixture of game modes are also very well done.ServersThe issues are the servers mostly. It has been months now since I have had a game where I didn't get a random ping spike or packet loss during a 5min match. I'm not the only one that has issues with their servers as you can see complaints about them mentioned over and over in the negative reviews of this game. Match MakingThe match making is a joke at times and being just a casual player like myself you will end up hitting a wall. As you will end up becoming "Master" rank and get stuck with season champions constantly.CommunityWith the mixture of poor match making and unstable servers the majority of the casual players have just stopped playing leaving the usual problem with most competive games these days toxic players. I love going into a unranked match and being called a "useless quot for not saving 1 goal as my ping jumps betweeb 400 700ms. Good times great memories. Either that or you get that one guy constantly trying to sell or buy something off you during a match and spaming friend invites even when you declined them.With how the game is currently going I would have to say that I can no longer recomend it to people sadly. Hopefully they will at least look into better servers espically if they're so keen on holding tournaments. I would hate to see such a great game die out due to neglect (I think that is the correct word).
title: Rocket League®

review: Product received for free. Instantly Addictive!!! This is a fun game... High Impact Excitement and will have you laughing and screaming and cheering almost immediately. It has a semi easy learning curve (I say semi because while you'll get the hang of the game in mintues it may take a bit longer to get your timing down). (Note The game recommends a controller (which I do not have on my PC... but don't let that bother you the only time I could see the need for a controller was trying to keep an eye on the ball before turning around. However... at one point I seemed to always have my eye on the ball no matter which direction I was facing. I'm guessing I 'accidentally' hit a key or something just didn't take the time to find out which otherwise... Mouse and KeyBoard work great).In truth this game genre isn't really my cup of tea but Steam was offering it for free for a few days I'm looking for something new to get in to and after watching a YouTube video for gameplay I figured... 'Why Not'. Now it's on my WishList. I may not be ready to purchase the game right now but that has nothing to do with how much fun the game is and with several ways of playing (Local LAN Random opponents (Real or A.I.) and my person favorite Tournament Play) I'd guess it will provide hours of fun and even when you get a bit bored you'll come back every few months just for the quick thrill.All in All... Great Game Highly Recommend!!!

review: Well where to start with this game.Pros Alive multiplayer Fairly fun gameplay. Incredibly beautiful maps New gamemodes to get released to change up the style. Fairly skilled to get the ball in mid air and be accurate with it (nothing crazy though) Fairly cheap but rarely goes on saleCons The crossmix with Playstation net has pretty much crippled you as psy players 95% of the time are utterly worthless. Literally unplayable if you go over 100 ping. The ball physics are absolutely broken. Matchmaking is as balanced as a 3 legged dog. The single player is a joke (Bots are incredibly easy even on hardest settings) The servers are a pile of trash with numerous cut outs.Honestly the game is pretty fun nothing amazing nothing special.

review: Worth every penny would buy again.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is the best sports game I've ever played. Unlike most other sports games you have control over all of your actions. There's no auto dribble or assists. Everything that your car does in game is directly controlled by you. Because of this the game is extremely easy to pick up and play but extremely hard to master. Add to that a variety of fun gamemodes some great cosmetic customization and a (mostly) great community and you have one of my favorite games.But with all that being said I do have one major gripe with the game. It does contain lootboxes (though the contents are only cosmetic). These lootboxes can contain things varying from rocket trails to extremely cool looking car bodies. While there are randomized cosmetic drops available through standard play the contents of the lootboxes can only be obtained through opening lootboxes or trading with someone who has. Personally I don't want to pay to have an unknown chance at getting something I want and I can't support this form of gambling. However all items are cosmetic so it shouldn't affect gameplay.

review: Excellent game. Very fun to play. Each match is 5 minutes long so you can jump in and play for as long or as short as you want. There are a few different modes other than just the normal soccer game there is a hockey one (there is a big puck rather than a big ball) and there is also a hoop one where you have to get the ball into a hoop (like basketball) rather than the goal post. There is also a Rumble mode where you get a power up every 10 seconds and can use that to score a goal or mess with other players. Overall it's a very nice and exciting game.

review: Rocket League has this type of perfection for it you dont need to be good in the game to have fun but you need it to see a "progress". Stuff like flying in this game takes patience and most people dont realy have that much.This game is better be played with a good friend or good friends because it can get very frustrating in ranked games. If there is no one or you dont like to play with random people you can play in a 50 Match or somewhat tournament against the KI of the game.Playerbase is also very hmmm how do i say it "spicy" often you get BM'd (Bad Mannered). If you miss a shot or something they will press their salt in your wound be ready for that.Besides all the bad stuff i said about it it feels awesome to make a goal or do a perfect pass.If we take a look at the graphics we see good lighting and nice effects i endure the nice rainy stormy animation. (rain and thunder is just in one arena/map right now!). There are also maps that play in the night (the desert map has big flud lights wich looks stunning to me).Now we take a look at the sounds and music. As we start the game "feeling good" music is hitting us sad thing is the same song will greet you every time you start the game /. But dont worry there is a whole playlist in this game with great music so it wont loop over and over (oh god that would be horrible).Scoring a goal makes a cool "explosive" sound and starts a cool background song to make you feel all good about yourself or the enemy cause they probably scored bAnd every save will do the same i think on both will say the narrator/commentator his thing like "SAVE!" or something i cant remember right now....sorry.And you got stuff you can collect for your car! (There is also a plunger!!!)Overall this game needs concentration and patience if you want to be good and stuff (but in wich game you doesnt need that? you just feel it more in this one). It makes fun and doesnt consume that much time since games normaly take about 5 9 minutes. mistakes or spelling fails in this text can be kept. i hope my review was helpful for you )

review: Got like 5 people to buy this it is amazing and you won't regret your purchase. The hours of competitive matches and replay time possible is a stunning feat in itself for such a basic idea of cars with rockets soccer futbol hockey or basketball type gamemodes.Cons Some people might be better than you are Matchmaking could be a little better. Customization paywalls. (there is a ton of customization without pay so don't get me wrong. For some items there are keys and it costs 1.99$ US per key to open a crate to get an item you already have or don't care for. The Other option is to buy DLC and sometimes it's cool other times it's meh.) MAPS ARE RESKINNED ( This is just a personal thing to me. I don't mind new maps but when they reuse a base map that is obviously a circle with a bland background and the new ARC Base map is also that same map just reskinned and with a new background I think the game mapwise is stale. I think there could be a lot of crazy things that the devs could integrate to make things interesting like ramps and moving parts in the map to change the game drastically.Pros You can train a lot (and with the recent update training is a lot easier to find with different game integrated community maps and zero update times for these maps.) Replay Value Competitivity Since there are mainly humans to compete against online the game varies with a plethora of outcomes.Anyway I did get this game on sale and saw it as a good deal for the price. I wouldn't reccommend purchasing this game outside of it's sale period because you'd be wasting your money that you could have saved for extra DLC causing you to spend even more money to get nice things in the game or it could have gotten rid of your chances for saving up for another game that you were also looking forward to purchasing. Hope my review somewhat helped you make your choice. Cya!

review: The game runs smoothly on my PC (i7 6700 GTX 1060 (6GB) RAM 32GB Windows 10 64 bit).I've played single player mostly. For someone like me who isn't very good at sport games or actual sports playing against AI is fun and challenging enough. I tried multiplayer jumped in mid game and got my a handed to me by opponents who actually know what they were doing. Still fun though ) The game may seem simple but there are some strategic aspects to it and you don't get very far by just chasing the ball blindly. I bought most of the DLC cars. While they are cool the cars given in the main game are nice enough already. So if you don't want to pay for the DLCs you don't have to. The difference is purely aesthetic.One small downside though. Team colors are locked to red and blue as the dominant hues so color customization for your cars is restricted within these ranges.If you like soccer and racing you'll enjoy this game.

review: Incredible game with incredible developers. The hours spent speak for themself but Rocket League really reminds me of how games used to be before this wave of EA and Ubifails.Psyonix are possibly/probably the best developers in the industry right now. Not only have they created an amazing game they listen to the community around it and release regular free updates with new maps and content. The DLC's are nicely priced too and fun to liven up the game if you hit a dull patch (for some reason). There are only three downsides to RL. The first is the players. You can end up playing with some really toxic people and even team mates who won't forgive a mistake. And while I'd love to say that it's the minority of players it really isn't. Toxic players would be understandable at a low/mid level but playing at anything Expert and above it's baffling to still see them. Second is the matchmaking while its not particularly common you can end up against or with people playing at a very distant level whether that be lower or higher and this gets frustrating after a while. The third is in relation to players again people just leave games constantly normally as soon as they're losing (made worse by the AI being dreadful). And quite often will leave just before the end of the game so they avoid another loss on their record. So to sum these up the game is solid but the people playing ruin it. Rocket League is a shining example of easy to learn but hard to master. It's enjoyable right from the get go even when you struggle to hit the ball at all. But it seems to me that the better you get the more fun it is. To sum up I can't believe anyone has given this game a negative review it's absolutely worth buying and is more than worth the money.

review: Rocket League is probably my favorite game in my Library right now. Long story short if you have any passion for Sports or Racing you have to try this game!Now to my pros and cons!PROS Soccer with cars nuff said. A great game for parties friendly play etc. due to its ability for up to 8 people to play together. So much customization! Tons of items to discover along with rare painted ones or ones that track your stats! Not to mention how many DLC there are. There is a very high skillcap but the game is still accessible to new/inexperienced players. Ranked play! Its a beautiful game overall!Cons DLC are pretty expensive but I personally don't mind because I was able to get them all lol. If you don't take the time to learn mechanics the skillcap hits you like a truck. It took me 100 hours to really get into the special mechanics and learn the physics. Can get boring if not with friends. Randoms are often times trash (at least in my case)FINAL THOUGHTS Overall this game has brought me more good memories than bad and it allows for people to build their mechanical skills in great ways. Thanks for your time!
