review: Common thought Coming from mainly fps and mmo type genres I can't recall a time where I was ever interested in a sport based game in fact I dispised them. I had to be persuaded just like those I have had to persuade before they realise this is a great game that deserves a chance to prove itself. If you are like I was you have probably thrown this game out the window because you think it "looks boring" or "its just soccer with cars" and thats a shame and my goal is to help you reconsider.Match Length Each match of Rocket League lasts 5 minutes (Custom games excluded). The match ends when the timer hits 0 and the ball hits the ground or a goal is scored. Game Modes I will start by explaining the non competitive (Unranked) game modes. I won't go in depth but hope to provide enough information so you get a rough idea of each one. At the time of writing this review there are 8 modes which include Duel (1v1) Doubles (2v2) Standard (3v3) Chaos (4v4) Snow day (Ice field with a puck instead of a ball) Rocket Labs (Experimental wierd shaped maps) Hoops (Basketball court with the hoops elevated) and Rumble (A new game mode which gives players power ups every 10 seconds which can effect both the ball and other players).I personally prefer Duels and Doubles as they require more effort on my part. Standard is fine and is the most common in the pro scene however I am not a fan of that many cars on the field at one time and usually stay in goals to avoid the mayhem. 4v4 is just a cluster and I never play it. Snow day was fun for about 5 minutes but not something I will be going back to. Rocket Labs can be fun for some random games and provides variation from the standard maps. Hoops was also fun for about 5 minutes and I feel the court is to small and should be made larger or even the same size as the soccer field but that might come across as wierd since a basketball court is smaller then a soccer field... anyway I don't play it and won't play it again. Rumble suprised me actually. It's quite fun and its hard to predict what can happen. You opponant may shoot for goal but then the ball is frozen in mid air for a few seconds which is then saved followed by a punch which sends the ball to the other end. I will be going to Rumble when I want some variation to my game from time to time.Competitive This is where the game gets fun however does have both pros and cons. The competitive (Ranked) game modes include Duel Doubles Standard and Solo Standard (3's but you queue by yourself). Ranks A total of 10 matches are required before you will be placed into a rank. There are 4 tiers which include Prospect (Prospect 1 2 3 &amp Elite) Challenger (Challenger 1 2 3 &amp Elite) Star (Rising Star Shooting Star All Star &amp Super Star) Champion (Champion Super Champion &amp Grand Champion) Each rank within a tier has 5 divisions. Once you have reached division 5 in that rank you then have a chance to move up 1 rank. PROS 1. Its hard! Games that are easy are boring Rocket League is a game that you progressively improve over time and there are always players at your level which means you don't always get owned. When you score a goal or win its satisfying. After 600 hours when I get a goal it still feels awesome. 2. Teamwork and Communication Strategy is definitely something that will improve you game. Pulling off mad plays or passing at the right time then stepping our opponant to score a goal is cool as !CONS 1. sometimes versing unfair opponants where you verse someone greatly better then yourself or a smurf which is incredibly irritating.2. The addition of the Wasteland and Tokyo maps in competitive play. I feel they shouldn't be included as the field is different then the rest of the standard maps. This means some people may get these maps more then others which I feel is unfair. Tokyo being in competitive takes it to another level. The map has elevated sides and is just rediculous. Wasteland and Tokyo should be in non competive only.Final Thought Look the game isn't easy it takes time to get good and a very long time to get great but don't automatically disregard the game as before you play it thats just being naive. I've read some of the negative comments on steam for Rocket League and they are a perfect example. I understand the game isn't for everyone but what I am saying is it is worth trying if you don't like it refund it. I could have continued this review and I am sure I could have written it better I haven't written many reviews. if I can update it I will later but I hope that this helps.

review: I'm a competitive person when it comes to video games. So a competitive game like Rocket League definitely appealed to me. Rocket League is a great game for someone who can play basically the same game over again and constantly want to get better at playing the same game over and over again. But that doesn't mean you have to be a competitive person to play Rocket League Rocket League has a semi large assortment of game modes to play casually as well. Overall Rocket League is a great game for the competitive minded player &amp an alright game for casual play. I would try to buy it at a sale.

review: I don't like racing games or games without some kind of violence so I was extremely skeptical of Rocket League. It was on sale one time for half price and my firend wanted it so I decided to buy it for both of us. Again I was not really interested in it I just wanted to play a bit of multiplayer with my friend but holy crow I have not regretted my decision in the slightest. I have sunk more hours into this game than any other it is just so fast and easy to get into a match. I have Skyrim (+DLC) Metal Gear Solid V The Phantom Pain Fallout New Vegas and like 155 more games that would not total my Rocket League total if combined. Only problems are the fact that some people are quite mean when your skill does not match their standards but it almost encourages you to get better as you go to the store to buy a new controller. I have had a few issues with games freezing or the screen going black in the middle of a round which generally leads to a goal for my opponent(s). I also get kicked from games sometimes which could be my rural internet connection but I would still really like a rejoin button for casual play. (Thay have one for competetive) Oh and if you think these problems are my PC they are not. I have a trusty GTX 980 16 GB of RAM and a i7 5820k.Anyways. I completely and whole heartedly recommend this game to anyone. It geats really fun when you can pull of some more complicated maneuvers. It is absolutely a blast. Psyonix is doing an amazing job with the community and I don't forsee them leaving this game out to dry any time soon.

review: Rocket League...Where to begin? This is my first review so go easy on me! I also want to clarify that I have many many more hours on the PS4 version! It's the same game though no weird port issues or anything. The fact that it is cross platform is a solid indicator of that. So play whichever version you prefer! Car soccer. I'm not sure I've come across a game other than Rocket League that can be explained well with two words. You would assume that a game with such a simple premise would lack depth but if you've read about it or heard the hype or even played a friend's copy you know that this game is anything but shallow. Underneath the surface lies a monster!You will suck in the beginning. How the hell am I supposed to get the ball into the goal? Am I supposed to drift? Why is it that when I jump the first time and I hold the left stick in a direction my car pivots around the Z axis but when I use my second jump it then boosts and pivots around the Y axis? How does this make any sense? It hurts your brain! My friends were having so much trouble with this game when we sat down and played it for the first time.I noticed the click came after around 10 rounds. My friends started to hit the ball semi accurately and the control scheme started to make sense to them. After the initial rough patch people hit the game opens up and players cannot put this game down. For the first time in a while I was staying up until the sun rose just having fun with a video game. Pure and absolute fun genuine joy. I kept telling myself that I would only play one more game but I ended up falling asleep with the controller still in my hands. What a video game!On to the rules and mechanics of the game.Two teams of cars try to hit a ball into each other's goal. Each car has a nitro like boost that drains the boost meter which can be refilled by driving over respawning orange dots scattered around the map. The cars can jump and double jump which can be used as a minor boost itself. When a car reaches a certain speed it can destroy other cars if it runs into them. That's about it for the basic mechanics.Rocket League is a multiplayer game. In my opinion it shines (like a lot of games) when played with friends on the couch but online is a ton of fun as well. There are a lot of options and configurations for matches. 1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4 even 2v4 are all possible. 3v3 is the "standard" game mode and in my opinion is the most balanced. There are a lot of maps to choose from but not a ton of variation in design between them which isn't really an issue to me. Matchmaking is alright but sometimes you will be placed on a losing team in the middle or near the end of the match which is pretty annoying. Other than that it seems to be solid.Single player is bizarre mainly because the AI makes such odd decisions. I've noticed that they sometimes blatantly shoot the ball into their own goal and I can't understand why. There isn't anything in their way and I don't think they are trying to pass it to anyone. It definitely happens less with higher level bots. I try to stay away from single player but if my internet was down and I needed my fix I would play a couple matches with AI. Overall wouldn't recommend it.The cars in Rocket League are just fantastic. There are a ton of models paintjobs materials hats rims boost trails and antenna toppers to chose from. The team at Psyonix have been constantly updating and adding content since release and I am always so excited when new DLC is announced. I never get bored changing my paint colors or slapping a new set of rims on my car there is so much to chose from!The music is annoying and weird. There is a singer on a lot of the tracks and her voice gets annoying and grating after a couple minutes. I usually turn off the music and just play my own. The main menu is simple and effective I couldn't really ask for anything more.Overall this game is absolutely fantastic. It is an excercise in restraint a near perfect design that was executed simply and effectively. I think game studios should look at Rocket League and learn from it. Sometimes one perfect idea is better than 50 mediocre ones. Bravo Psyonix.9.5/10

review: Rocket League in my opinion is a must have if your computer can run it of course. That being said the minimum requirements are pretty low if you had a computer that came out in the past decade. Now here is my overall rating on the game.Graphics 8/10The game looks really good on medium settings for me cause my graphics card sounds like it's killing itself on high. But compared to ultra on other games its up there but not quite. I have seen it on its highest settings it looks amazing none the less.Gameplay 10/10You have probably seen this score everywhere but after 20 hours I'm still not bored. First the modes. The first gamemode is fast paced soccer gameplay with intense matches at times. While advertised the game is not primarly soccer or football for the rest of the world. The game offers basketball hockey competitve (soccer) and a recent additon called dropshot. While they may feel and look the same hockey and soccer especially they're all different enough to feel fun. And the last part is a gamemode called rumble which adds powerups to the gamemodes except competitive. They're like Mario Kart powerups in a way that can help you or get in the way of the other team. The second major feature is car customization. After matches or through crates you will receive a random part like a new car body or decal that can change how your car looks. There are so many different parts that you may never own them all. By doing this you can truly make your car feel how you want. Since the two major teams are orange and blue the car paint will change that's it. But the game allows you to make he cars different for each team. Additional notes The game does have a crate system in which the player after a game will have a chance of receiving a random crate from the many series of crates. You open said crates with keys. How do you get them by buying them. Knowing me I don't like systems like this but I loved the game enough to go into this system. And they give you some cool stuff to. Overall I can't give this a score cause I don't know how to properly but I thought it was worth mentioning none the less.Overall score 10/10To me graphics don't matter as much as gameplay. The graphics look amazing either way and the gameplay is so fun and refreshing you may never stop. I love it so much and for $20 it's worth every penny. If you don't have it go buy it right now I promise you you won't regret it.
title: Rocket League®

review: No need for explanation on how good the game is so here's a pancake recipe.100g plain flour2 eggs300ml milk1 tbsp sunflower oil (or vegetable) plus extra for fryingpinch of salt1. Blending in the flour Put the flour and a pinch of salt into a large mixing bowl and make a well in the centre. Crack the eggs into the middle then pour in about 50ml milk and 1 tbsp oil. Start whisking from the centre gradually drawing the flour into the eggs milk and oil. Once all the flour is incorporated beat until you have a smooth thick paste. Add a little more milk if it is too stiff to beat.2. Finishing the batter Add a good splash of milk and whisk to loosen the thick batter. While still whisking pour in a steady stream of the remaining milk. Continue pouring and whisking until you have a batter that is the consistency of slightly thick single cream. Traditionally people would say to now leave the batter for 30 mins to allow the starch in the flour to swell but there s no need.3. Getting the right thickness Heat the pan over a moderate heat then wipe it with oiled kitchen paper. Ladle some batter into the pan tilting the pan to move the mixture around for a thin and even layer. Quickly pour any excess batter into a jug return the pan to the heat then leave to cook undisturbed for about 30 secs. Pour the excess batter from the jug back into the mixing bowl. If the pan is the right temperature the pancake should turn golden underneath after about 30 secs and will be ready to turn.4. Flipping pancakes Hold the pan handle ease a fish slice under the pancake then quickly lift and flip it over. Make sure the pancake is lying flat against base of the pan with no folds then cook for another 30 secs before turning out onto a warm plate. Continue with the rest of the batter serving them as you cook or stack onto a plate. You can freeze the pancakes for 1 month wrapped in cling film or make them up to a day ahead.

review: Rocket league is the best game I've ever played. Simple as that yet it isn't. I wrote a review when I had less than 200 hours in rocket league so I've come back to write another after500 hours because the first didn't do it justice. As you probably know the concept is so simple soccer with cars. But those cars fly now that changes everything. The skill that you can acquire for this game is amazing and it doesn't even take someone who knows much about rocket league to look at an amazing play and know that it took incredible skill which is such a beautiful thing about this game. 9/10 negative reviews for this game start with 'Rocket league is the best game I've ever played'(or something along those lines) why do they have a negative review then? Good question it is usually because of things like bad matchmaking or community experiences or criticism for the crate system. So let's address these one at a time 1. MatchmakingI play on the US east server and I have always had a wonderful experience with matchmaking. People are likely complaining about it for one of two reasons they occasionally have bad games and get blown out and blame matchmaking or they are correct and constantly get matched against unfair opponents(rank wise). Matchmaking can easily vary from region to region on a server region that does not have as many players you will likely not be properly matched due to lack of available players at your skill level. Which is unfortunate. As for the other reason you play good games and bad games like every sport. Because you are not consistent consistency comes with much practice. 2. CommunityAgain your experience can vary from region to region but it is far more unlikely. The community for the most part is very good I have no trouble finding team mates or friendly opponents. But like every online game there are trolls and people out to ruin your experience to gain some kind of pleasure. But this doesn't happen often once you get past the bottom ranks especially. Most of the time (99/100 times) if you ignore them then they won't affect the game's outcome. If you provoke them or encourage them by responding then it may lead to childish bickering and finger pointing and fighting. But can be avoided easily. 3.Crate systemThis is a tough one all I can say is that if you don't like it then turn it off in the settings. That simple.That's itReallyNothing else to itBye........But seriously this game gets more and more fun the better you get and if that sounds like you then buy it! Give it a try if it looks fun to you! If it's not your cup of tea then that's ok! I recommend Fallout 4 or other great games out there. Thanks.

review: After hours upon hours spent on this game I believe I can finally give a clear and honest review of this brilliant game.From a first glance I know the game can look fairly basic and looks like the fun could die out fast but may I reassure you and say that is not the case at all.I owned the game fairly early on in its existance and watching it grow into the game it has become has been amazing. At the start the game came with standard rocket league and a basic version of ranked rocket league along with collectable toppers decals and such.After that DLC's started rolling out every couple of months or so. They were cheap and added new car models and the occasional rocket league pitch. The game continued to progress adding new modes (including one of my personal favourites Hoops). Not only this but the game devlopers imporved the ranked matches massively. They also included crates to get rare car models and other collectables.In conclusion this game is definately one of a kind. Its face paced exciting and while you can have off days your skill definetely improves the longer you play. I am sure I will continue to play this game for many years to come!Overall Game Rating 9/10

review: Rocket League! Where do I begin... Rocket League is one of the most inivative games to push the bounderies of sports. Picture yourself SOARING through the air with your only goal too get that good fast hit past the opponent. Rocket league takes soccer and gives it such a unique gameplay... VEHICLES! Be prepared to collide slide tumble and roll around in one of Rocket League's beautiful arenas! Ranging from sunny skies to skill deciding obsticles such as pillars hexagons and plateaus. Graphics 9/10I'd like to keep this short by saying Rocket League runs beautifully on most computers! You can have it optimized for an older 21st century laptop or desktop. Amazing rain effects and tons of customization to take your style to the next level! Gameplay 9/10You start off in rocket league really doing whatever you want from bot matches to hopping right into ranked (not recommended....) Rocket league teaches you patience and causes you to become an overall better gamer! Gameplay modes include 1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4 3v3 Rumble 3v3 Hoops Ranked ques of 1's 2's 3's 3v3 Rocket Labs You also have the full ability to host private lobbies with all sorts of mutator settings! From double speed to half... Quad collision effects to none at all! Change the shape and size of your ball to increase the chaotic aspect! Music 8/10Here's the thing... I don't think I've ever played a game and actually desired to find that perfect balance of volume for the games soundtrack... because well... It's AWESOME! Such a big plus when you load up a game to a beautiful symphony of electronic waves pulling you closer to that QUE button...TL DR Rocket League is an awesome new genre of competitive gameplay that you MUST try at least once.. But don't be alarmed when you fail and fail. This is one of those games in which you could spend 1.000 hours and still be working towards getting that GREAT wall shot.
title: Rocket League®

Ranked is something that i'll shall never say. It's a bloody circus! It's okay but not perfect. BUY THIS GAME ALREADY.

review: Rocket League is the second brilliant game to come from Psyonix the first of which was called Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars. Described as "soccer but with rocket powered cars" Rocket League has one to four players assigned to each of the two teams using rocket powered vehicles to push a ball into their opponent's goal and score points over the course of a match. The game includes single player and multiplayer modes which can be played both locally and online including cross platform play between the PlayStation 4 and Microsoft Windows versions as well as cross play between Xbox One and Windows versions. Later updates for the game enabled the ability to modify core rules and adding new game modes including ones based on ice hockey and basketball.Pros Tons of cars and personalizationCasual game to relax to but has competitive modes to test your skills as wellGreat audio/soundtrackMultiple game modesFair bit of arena variationCan play cross platform which helps the player base stay high and the queue times stay lowMultiplayerTradingCons Updates are too far and too fewThe matchmaking allows people way above the average skill group in a game play together (think rising star and a prospect playing together against two challenger elites)Voice chat in game is cancerI never played the first installation of the predecessor to this game but I have a ton of fun playing this game with friends and climbing in rank. The game is basically soccer but with cars and boost. The twist on such a simple game is amazing and when I first started if someone would have said that I would have liked the game I would have told them that they were wrong. But in the end I was wrong about judging this game.9.5/10 The game is a ton of fun and well worth buying with or without friends to play it with but it helps so much to have a team that talks together and plays together regularly to learn each other s playstyles and learn about the game together. Overall a ton of fun and well worth the money especially if you can get the game on a sale.SPOILER BELOW An old man once said that really fast cars and big balls don't mix he was wrong.
title: Rocket League®

review: Fun game but randomly the servers stopped working completely for me and even though I have tried plenty of things people have suggested on the internet I cant get connected to the server. To make matters worse you cant even host or join a private gamewithout access to the official Rocket League Servers so I am completely unable to play with my friends. If they allowed people to host games on their own servers this problem would be fixed.Also matchmaking is bad and you get paired with people way above your skill level unless playing competitively. The game also has a suprisingly toxic community for such a casual game. On top of everything mentioned the game has microtransactions for a game you already paid for and from what I understand some of the cars are actually better***EDIT***Since writing this review my rocket league has suddenly been fixed. Im going to leave that part in though as a warning. Also it wasnt working for almost 3 weeks.
title: Rocket League®

review: Good game if you have friends to play with if not you're screwed. Match making is possibly the worst i have ever experienced in any game. The ranked play was reasonably good to begin with now there are so many leagues the quality of players is just trash in a lot more leagues so it just takes longer to rank up. Bronze players are just as bad as gold and plat players making solo queue a nightmare. One game you get a reasonable team and then next you end up with players who literally cannot hit the ball. It just leaves you scratching your head wondering how they are in the same ranking. Just the usual case of your rank is determined on how lucky you are to get the team who can hit the ball or not and how badly your team mates screw you over. Overall decent game some bugs that are annoying (server issues downtime that they say nothing about) but can be fun with friends. Ranking system poor.

review: Best game ever. There is virtually no limit to how good you can get at the game so in terms of fun playable hours where you continue to advance this game may be #1. I've also never seen a developer support a game the way Psyonix does. They release massive amounts of free new content almost every month including entirely new game types The servers are never down or unavailable and the only time I had an issue with my account which was my fault anyway they went right ahead and fixed it no questions asked.I intend to play another 2000+ hours of this game and that is not a typo. Psyonix is the best. Rocket League is the best.

review: Rocket League is a very enjoyable and fun game. And it s one of the best multiplayer games that there is. It is basically soccer but instead of people playing on the field it is little vehicles/cars. There is also a hockey mode and a basketball mode too (which is also played with little vehicles/cars). Rocket League is one of those games that anybody can pick up play and learn. It can get intense. And it can also get funny when playing the Rumble gamemode. Rocket League is a great game that I highly recommend to any gamer. It s fantastic!

review: This is probably one of my favorite games. I started out really bad and now im a little bit less bad lol. The game gets harder the higher up you get in the ranks. Giving the game a solid foundation to competetive experience. When you first start your car will pretty much just be on the ground but as you get better the game becomes more vertical and you learn to "fly". I do recomend the product however i feel like the loot crates could have been done better. Free keys to open the crates every once in a while would be nice the current halloween event is the first time free keys were offered. I'd give the game a 8/10 would get a 9/10 if loot box loot was free.
title: Rocket League®

review: Sets the standard for video games so far the only game that i can answer yes to the question "does it have rocket powered cars playing soccer"
title: Rocket League®

review: I have been playing this game the week it came out on Playstation first and had to get it on PC when I didn't have my Playstation with me. I find the PC version much better as well since it is much smoother and cleaner in a way. I can't get enough of it and play it every single day now with and without my friends for sure my favorite game out there and beats out the big franchises like Call of Duty Battlefield FIFA etc... It s a very simple concept of a game but yet has all these crazy things that you can do in game that can "wow" your teammates and even the opponetents.Also the leveling up system is perfect as you don t reach max level after 5 hours of playing but instead takes hundreds and even thousands of hours to complete. Through those hours you'll become what that rank is called like Pro or Master and even Rocketeer once you get there. There is also ranked mode where you go play people in your rank so you always have a fair fight. It's a fun addition to the game and brings the comptitve scene to it as people have to use team work to win and climb the ladders of the ranks.I would recommend this game to people who like fast paced competitive action games and well soccer in general I guess since it is socer with cars. All in all I highly recommend this game to anybody who is thinking of getting it it's a simple(ish) game and never gets old! And considering the low price for it it's a must have!
title: Rocket League®

review: Hands down one of the best games I've ever played. Rocket League expands an untouched genre into an entire universe of its own. DLC is solid Rumble mode is genius. Beginners and experts will both enjoy this game for years to come. I've put countless hours into the Xbox version and still decided to purchase the game again for PC. You can't go wrong for the price try it!

review: The game directors that look at Top Gear and went "Hey that looks fun."And it was. It was great fun. In fact I think that Rocket League is one f the most fun games on my Steam list.The mechanics are done well the car is sharp and responsive (unless you hold down the handbrake button) and you really feel that when you hitt a ball with a car you have hit a ball with a car. You can change the settings of the match things like gravity (Yes I know. shappe of the ball and you can even put the game into slo motion. (I don't quite now why though...) It is multiplayer and you can even play a match with someone that isn't your Steam friend! It can be a singleplayer thing because you can play exhibit matches and season matches. It is the best game.10/10UPDATE_They updated the game and it now has microtransactions...) 7/10For microtransactions

review: This game is quite fun. I find the competitiveness to be high. You also have a good community in the game that will say "Good Shot" and "Nice Game" through out the game. I know 4 5 hours isn't A LOT of game time but the games are only 5 minutes per round totaling about 7 minutes with minimal down time due to score recaps.Pros for me Fun to play a few games in a short periodEasy to get into Well made tutorialsCar customizationKeyboard or Controller supportedFun to play with your friendsConsNot owning the gameMay be a bit pricey for some peopleWhat I would like to see soon A way to save the goal recap videos as some of the goals made (Not just by me) are stupidly amazingly awesomely cool and fun to watch. What to take away If you like casual or competitive styled sports games with a twist this game is for you. If you enjoy faster paced games that take some getting used to this game is for you.I would recommend buying for sure if under 15 dollars as 20 seems a bit high for this game.Lots of fun for you or the familyNice Community
title: Rocket League®

review: This is the most refresing game I have played in a long time In a period where all of the games coming our are boring stale and uninteresting. I have never played a game like this in a long time and it is one of the funnest games I have played in a LONG time. It is so unique and simple yet you will get hooked after just a couple of games. I am so happy that I discovered this game. Only issue is the bad server lag but that can be fixed.Pros Simple yet fun Can be played causally or competitively Great game to play with a group of friends Car customization is a fun addition but adds no benefit in game which is very smart Hours of fun as every game is differentCons Very bad server lag makes some matches unplayableVisuals 8/10Audio 7.5/10Gameplay 9/10Story N/AReplayability 5/5Solo 4/5Co op/Multiplayer 5/5Balance 5/5Overall Score 83/100
title: Rocket League®

review: The games is both simple and complex. The rules and guidelines are easy to grasp but take some time and skill to master. You are essentially playing a 3 V 3 cars soccer game. You try to score while preventing your enimes. The twist the ball is completly physics base and you're in a jumping boosting car. Contolling this car and scoring are the real challenge of the game. It's fun and crazy at the same time. The game also visually looks amazing. the lighting makes everything really stick out. The only real issue I have is there isn't much variety. All the maps are the same set up wise (all visually distinct though) so there isn't much to do if you get board with the main set up which in turn makes the $20 price tag seem a bit too high for me. It's definatly a great game to play with friends in bursts. In my oppinion though wait for a sale before buying. It's limited gamepaly makes the $20 asking point a bit too high.
title: Rocket League®

review: Great local co op/online game!
title: Rocket League®

review: Excellent arcadey sports type. The whole concept behind the game is you're in a futuristic world where people play soccer with rocket cars it honestly doesn't matter.It's car ball.I spent a majority of my playtime during my first month owning it. Somewhere around 24 hours. My point in that is my first 10 or so hours were my favorite hours. The learning curve is probably some of the most fun you'll have in this game. Once you get beyond that and you feel confident in your skills the competitive nature will probably sink in you'll probably anger at minute yet frustrating things. Say for instance your idiot teammate hitting the ball out of the way just before you had the chance to make a game changing goal. Or maybe your enemy is simplying running around the field picking up turbo just so he can demo you repeatedly. Things can get really salty.After you get passed the honeymoon period this game is a great snack if you will.It's a perfect game to hop in just before bed or whilst waiting for something just play a quick match and hop out.However if you have a group of friends to play with that are competent and able you can queue together either locally or online. This feature makes the game much more palatable after having played for a considerable amount of time. The game runs great with splitscreen as well so definitely give that a go during a party.

review: If you're like me when you check out Steam reviews of games you make sure to check out the negative ones just to make sure you get the whole story. I was curious what negative things people were saying about this game and it seems that they mostly are complaining about the new microtransaction system often making it out to be forced or worse than it is.All DLC that affects gameplay (maps game modes) is included in FREE updates. There are cheap DLCs for different car models.The microtransactions work like this Random drops after games give you cosmetic enhancements or crates. The crates contain more cosmetic enhancements. To open a crate you need a key. Keys can be purchased (I think 1 for $1.50 or 5 10 or 20 for $1 each) or traded for with cosmetics or crates. Keep in mind nothing about this affects gameplay whatsoever. With the trading system if you really want some cosmetic and don't want to spend any money you can trade things for that cosmetic. If you really want to open a crate you can trade things for keys. You are not required to buy anything.I understand that microtransactions have a negative reputation but this game is only $20 with regular and free map/game mode updates. I can't believe anyone is complaining about the fact that the devs implemented a completely optional system that can get them some more money is more than fair.The devs are active on the Rocket League subreddit and multiple times I have seen complaint posts met with responses from devs saying they'll fix the problem and the problems get fixed.This game is extremely fun for casual and serious play. The community all in all is very good and fortunately isn't becoming more toxic with the growing user base. I highly recommend giving it a try and if you don't want to spend $20 on it wait for a free weekend or a sale.Cheers
title: Rocket League®

review: I used to be social. I used to play soccer. I got my license and everything.. I drove myself to practice everyday for the whole season. I was bored one day after practice. I googled "Soccer Cars". A simple search. Didn't expect much. I found Rocket Leagues younger brother SARBC. I no longer play soccer. I no longer go to school. My friends think I am dead. I haven't seen my parents in months. I can't stop playing this game. This game has become me. My left leg just finished complete transfiguration into the bottom section of the Octane. My face has a black market mystery decal tattooed on it. I haven't slept or eaten in around 45 hours. My heart is slowly giving out. All I see is my ariel shots when I close my eyes. Over and over in my head. The airhorns. The pixel fire boost sound effect. I have become the game. I am now the Octane.
title: Rocket League®

review: Edit 23rd Oct 2015 I can't stop playing... Please... help? Ah nevermind I'll keep playing!!Edit 18th Oct 2015 Asian servers have been added ping is a good 40 60ms so I've changed my review to positive. My general observation is that you won't feel a major disadvantage if your ping to remote servers is &lt 160ms but if it's close to 200 and above you'd best filter out servers that are not close to you. Original review I'm based in Singapore speedtest.net gives me 4ms ping 60 80Mbps download 30 40Mbps upload and yet I am consistently above 200ms to all rocket league servers. I tried cable different locations for wifi nothing helps. Brilliant game but this is absolutely infuriating every single game I am the player with the highest ping always one bar red.Customers in Asia beware.
title: Rocket League®

review: A very good game. You want a competitive game with friends? This works just fine for that as well.Only negative thing (at the moment) is the Ranked games seem to randomly select your opponents which sometimes puts you in a situation you're just getting ran over.Overall just a brilliant game.

review: Rocket LeagueTo begin it is a great game.ProsGood GameplayCool ConceptEasy to pick up and playFun Split ScreenEnjoyable Offline experienceNice GraphicsConsOnline is full of kids that think they are good at the game or people that try way to hardMatchmaking is junkToxic communityEhs...Keyboard controls are decent prefer a controller.Summary I found this game to be great for an offline experience or with friends online. This is a game I always pull up if I have a friend over or have a couple of buddies online. However the community is not the best I wouldn't say they ruin the game but if you play online you will run into them. It is easy enough to ignore them but do keep that in mine. Online Matchmaking As stated several times above the community is toxic. Online matchmaking results in a group of eight years olds yelling at you for not making the goal from a quarter mile away. However sometimes you luck out and it is not an eight year old and is instead a 16 year old teen threating to VAC ban your steam account if you don't give your A game. Like I said easy enough to ignore but it does make me sad to see a great game have such a dissapointment of a community. Controller vs. Keyboard This is a area I actually have a question about hopefully one of you guys can answer this for me. Is it better to use a controller or a keyboard? I find the game to be way better with a controller and would highly recommend having a controller in order to play this game. However I have heard people say using a keyboard is better.Overall I would recommend it. Buy it on sale if your concerned about not liking it. I found it to be enjoyable and not an experience I would avoid. However if your playing to do a bunch of online be aware that the community is toxic and not friendly to newbies. Rating 8/10Note Good game toxic community hours of fun.
title: Rocket League®

review: If you're looking for a game that's quick and casual but equally competitive and adrenaline boosting in its style of gameplay then Rocket League is definitely a game for you to add to your collection.When first seeing Rocket League in the Top Seller charts I at first thought that it was just a simple game involving race cars playing soccer. It figuratively didn't exactly sound entertaining in my mind. Then after deciding to just buy it and try it out I realized I was completely wrong and did not waste a single penny on the game.Rocket League is jam packed with competition and action. When you play a single match you'll be so involved in the game that you might not even realize the amount of time that's passed when you play over 5 matches and 30 minutes of your free time just disappeared. The controls in Rocket League are extremely compatible with the human brain so picking the game up and mastering it is possible for anybody heroically lifting the heavy burden of people needing to be experienced racing gamers in order to have fun in Rocket League.What's the greatest about Rocket League is the feeling it gives you when you play a match. When you try it out for the first time you actually don't feel like an insignificant player who's just filling up another slot in a team composition game. You feel focused and you have motivation to try your best as well as practice to get even better. It's true that at first you feel that the ball is untouchable to you and that you can't really do anything besides punt it in the air when all the other players are stuck to each other like glue but the game makes it entirely possible for anyone to skillfully rise from that level and eventually become a flying superstar that backflips 20 feet in the air in order to score a goal. What's the best about this game is how it frustrates the player rather than making the player yell out of pure anger which eventually boils into hatred for the game itself Rocket League makes players feel frustration that rather motivates them to learn from their mistakes and think about how they can do better. The feeling of failure as well as the fear of it is not a drawback of this game at all which is what makes this game such a successful product for casual and competitive players alike. No matter what you won't exit Rocket League feeling worse than you did before you opened it.The only drawback in the game however is its matchup system. While the game itself has a quick matchmaking system that hardly ever tries the player's patience it can be a little rough for those who are playing for the first time. Sometimes a new player will be matched against other gamers who have accumulated skill that flies into a league completely out of the newbie's reach which as a result turns the game into a full fledged 2v2 with the two remaining players struggling to just keep up with the ball. The new players can learn from the pros in this sense and raise their skill cap substantially as well as witness the endless potential Rocket League has in store when they see sick plays and jumps made by the more experienced players but it doesn't nullify the fact that not everyone has equal grounding on the playing field. Eventually though the playing field does gradually beome leveled and when the newbie who jumps for no reason turns into a champion who can barrel roll into a flying ball at a different trajectory and score a goal the feeling of achievement in accomplishing such a feat is just amazing.Rocket League is suited as one of the best casual multiplayer sport arcade games you can have on your Steam account and I expect that it will stay that way for a long time. But that's just my opinion. What would be yours?
title: Rocket League®

review: It's a pretty fun game to play with friends as a casual party game and/or as a competitive game that demands a high level of specialized skill. It also doesn't require a super modern computer to play either. You hit a ball with rocket powered battle cars what more can you want?The only con to the game is that while the servers function extremely well the nature of the game does not lend itself to making even minor ping spikes or lag bearable. If your connection isn't very high quality you WILL be swearing at your screen every time you play online as your modem struggles to keep up with the action. If I had a better internet connection I'd probably play this game about 10 times as often as I do now.

review: Rocket League is one of the coolest ideas for a game I have to come to see cars playing soccer (or football if you're not from America). It's a very fun and fast paced game that on its multiplayer standpoint is very fun and team based unless you're playing on 1v1 which I don't usually play a lot. Pros very nice looking controls are easy (full controller support) fast paced easy to get used to Cons the only thing that I would say that I don't like is that matches need to be ranked better. You'll have a ton of rookies on one side and most of even the entire opposing team veterans or prosAll in all Rocket League is one of my favorite sports games of all time and I'd definitely recommend it.

review: Very rarely do I ever get hooked on a game but Rocket League did it. This game is the definition of easy to learn hard to master. In the beginning it's just fun to play. Soccer with cars right? That's pretty fun to play around with. Later on as you actually learn how to control the car you get a whole new level of satisfaction because you're actually making some pretty cool goals and saves. After 190 hours I'm still trying and pulling off new tricks that look and feel amazing. There's so much room for improvement it's unreal.It's a great idea that was extremely well designed and implemented. I have zero complaints.

review: First of all if you don't own this game what are you doing with your life??Based on the day I am writing this I have just bought the game this weekend. I have enjoyed it a lot so far.If you enjoy deep car customization you will definitely love this game. You are almost never likely to see a car the exact same as yours. The graphics on this game are pretty decent and can probably run on a potato (havent tested). I do recommend a controller for this game. I played 1 match with the mouse and keyboard and it was AWFUL. I recomend and Xbox controller or a Steam controller. Another thing I like about this game is that there is an amazing progression system. You start out pretty much never to hit the ball but after a while you get goals in every game. One thing that did steer me away from this game for quite some time is the DLC. I bought the game as well as Masamune (A DLC battle car). Most cars are only $1.99. There are actually more in game unlockable cars than DLC ones. One thing that is almost impossible to not buy is the keys. After each match there is a random chance you will get a crate. These crates include performance and visual battle car enhancements. The problem is a key to open one costs $1.50. This can be annoying. I plan to buy a key sometime though in order to open my rare crate. I hope this review motivated you to buy the game and I am sorry the the length. Bye!
title: Rocket League®

review: tl dr its like fifa but goodIn the top 3 games of 2015 hands down. Rocket League takes a big risk creating a fresh competitive game where else could you find so much creativity and competitiveness? The graphics are really cool especially when looking back during plays. You could even customize your car and its accessories. The music is neat but I don't think its anything special. Online being a key part of a game like this's success is pretty on point. Though I tend to be concerned that bots replace players that leave it's better than nothing. I think this game is quite unappreciated for its Singleplayer modes such as the training mode which can actually up your game.Main Graphics 9.5/10Sound 9/10Gameplay 10/10Side Online 9/10Customization 8.5/10Longevity 10/10Creativity 10/10

review: It has been a long time since I have had this much fun playing a video game.Get This Game!Rocket League is a must own game. Rocket League gives you the control of a rocket powered car with the ability to flip through the air while playing soccer within an enclosed dome. It is a fast paced fluid and extremely fun. Games are only 5 minutes long and are constantly packed with action there is never a dull moment. While it appears to be a simple game on the surface there are difficult plays and tricks to master keeping the game fresh. If you are looking for a game that can fill small gaps of time or for several hours of fun look no further.Pros 5 minute fast paced gamesEasy to learn controls challenging to completely masterServers are now reliable in the beginning they weren tAesthetics of the game are nice and it runs wellCons Different cars are simply cosmetic it would be nice to see more varietyLevel progression is dull again only cosmetic changesConclusion Rocket League is a must own title. It s a simple idea that is goofy enough to work well and be extremely fun.
title: Rocket League®

review: No problem.This is currently my favorite game and I foresee it being 'the one' for me quite a while into the future.It's super easy to just pick up and play but you'll quickly realize that mastering the game is going to take a while. I still don't feel like I'm "good at Rocket League." That's because I'm not experience does not inevitably yield skill. Thankfully they let you choose between ranked and unranked matchmaking so you're not always pressured to perform well. Ranked matches have tiered leagues so that you're playing with people of comparable skill (in theory at least).I highly recommend playing with people you know and/or can communicate with via voice chat especially when you're learning the mechanics and strategies. The most popular matchmaking is a 3v3 so if you have 2 friends with mics you're good to go. That said you'll be just fine if you don't have many friends or don't have a microphone.My one grievance has to do with the community. As with any popular game there are some toxic attitudes floating around. You'll inevitably meet a teammate in matchmaking who will get frustrated by your team's performance (but you can't win them all right?). This teammate could do one or many of the following start playing for the other team e.g. shooting on your own goal or ramming you away from defensive positionsspam requests to your team to forfeit the match even if you're only down by 1 goal (this can only happen in ranked play)do "nothing " by slowly driving aimlessly around the field and away from the action so that they don't get kicked for being idle (effectively reducing the players on your team by 1)trash talking everyone (just mute the in game mic for this)If this happens just take it easy and don't let it get to you. It's not your fault because it's a TEAM game after all.Rocket League is simply a great game. I recommend it. If you're unsure about spending the money watch some people play on Twitch first.
title: Rocket League®

review: Easy to learn. Impossible to master.You will spend your first dozen games following the ball like a five year old learning to play soccer but without touching it. That's okay! You'll eventually get used to the controls and you'll be hitting it regularly. There's always a new trick to learn and it is exceedingly difficult to fully master this game.Be prepared for frustration as this game can certainly be rage inducing! 1v1 ranked will make you rage like a bull in a china shop so don't leave anything breakable on your desk.The developers are definitely on top of things and they consistently push out patches and updates that bring additional content into the game. New maps and gamemodes (e.g. Snow Day Hoops Mutators Rumble) are constantly pushed out and they don't take the EA path of introducing paid DLC that's anything other than cosmetic.The only issues I have with the game are a couple of physics glitches. Goalposts have wonky physics and balls that hit the inside of the posts tend to bounce out. Aside from that the physics work very well for the most part.Overall this is a phenomenal game that's entirely worth your time and the $20.

review: Amazing game I cannot recommend it enough! The only issue with it is there are some toxic people that spew nothing but hate fortunately there is a mute button and you can disable all in game chat! Literally spend a lot of my day looking forward to getting back to playing this game! I was bored and looking through reviews on this game thinking that there can't be anyone who dislikes this game and was suprised to see how many people are butt hurt over the crates/keys aspect. Yes this game did implement CS GO style crates that you buy keys to open but you are not required to buy keys and if you don't want to participate in them you can disable them so you don't see when you get one. If you want to open crates but dont want to buy keys then don't trade crates to people who do buy keys and are willing to trade keys for crates. Personally I don't mind spending money on Keys because of how incredible this game is as well as how much enjoyment and game time I get in this game. If you think about it I have almost 313 hours in game (Which is very small compared to some) I paid $20 for this game (Rediculously Cheap I would have gladly paid $60) and I've spent $20 on keys. So you figure $40/ 313 Hours is about .12 cents per hour of Pure fun. More than worth it in my opinion! People need to get over themselves it's a company their goal is to make money. If they really wanted to they could charge a lot more and sell the DLC rather than GIVING IT AWAY FREE. Psyonix if you somehow read this you just keep on doing what you are doing you are doing an amazing job! &lt 3

review: I have played 109 hours and counting of Rocket League. That is not too many hours and I didn't always like Rocket League but It is so addictive. There are so many aspects to Rocket League that make it great but whenever I try to explain the game to them all I can come up with is soccer with cars. But there is so much more to it than that. There is more to the regular soccer gamemode Rocket League offers Duels 2v2s 3v3s and 4v4s. But there are other gamemodes. Just to list a few Snow day is a 3v3 gamemode with a hockey puck and slippery ground. Hoops is a gamemode with court instead of a feild and instead of a goal there is a basketball hoop. Rocket Labs is also a 3v3 gamemode where you play on experimental Arenas. Psyonix resently added a new gamemode called Rumble Consisting of 11 power ups The Boot (Kicks an opponent s car)Disruptor (Forces your opponent to drive uncontrollably)Freezer (Freezes the ball in place)Grappling Hook (Pulls you towards the ball)Haymaker (Punches the ball)Magnetizer (Attracts the ball to your car)Plunger (Grabs the ball via plunger and cord)Power Hitter (Allows you to hit everything harder)Spike (Attach the ball to your car when you bump into it)Swapper (Change positions on the field with your opponent)Tornado (Sweep up the ball and opposing cars into a giant funnel cloud) Page I got my data from www.rocketleaguegame.com A competitive aspect is also in the game but only the regular soccer version is able to be played on ranked.Overall This game has taken many hours of time and I do not regret any of the time I spent on it. This is one my favorite games I have played. I strongly recommend that you give this game a chance you just might love it.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is definitely a quality game but be prepared to embarrass yourself completely for a while before you become even slightly decent at it. As it is even though I am a seasoned gamer in general (been playing since the release of the Coleco Gemini) I am absolutely awful at it. I could hold my own at FIFA and demolish my competition at NHL but I will play a match of Rocket League and come out of it feeling like I've been trampled by a pack of elephants. Each match makes you a little better and the feeling that you might one day become useful to your team ensures that you'll keep playing. I haven't yet reached that point but I'm sure that I'll enjoy it once I do.

review: My story I played SARPBC when I was younger almost everyday with my friends it was fun. I stopped playing it for a while and then Rocket League came we were very hyped about it with my friends and decided to buy it. I didn't like it first and stopped it for a long time then I saw the price pot being 250 000$ and I wanted to play it again and so I did. And why? Well because I'm a very competitive person c And now I learned to love it..Now all I want is to become good (please for the love of god help me) Review It is a very good game on its own genre so it is hard to review but I'll try my best.It is a very original game and thats good.I like how it's very competitive and pretty fast paced but you still need tactics.Althought it's a very good game it has some fowls I'd really like it to have more balanced car system as some cars are available only if you buy them (or trade) even if they don't give you so big of an advantage it would be nice that they would be more balanced but overall this is my favorite game and I love it.I want the competitive scene to be even bigger.I recommend this to everyone they either like it or not.Also its very sad that it is really hard for beginners also try the trainings (the rookie wans are so easy that a 2 year old could do them 100%)Hope that I helped some people to get into this game see ya on the field!

review: Don't be fooled by my hours on Steam I recently got a PC strong enough to handle Rocket League so I've made the switch to PC. On console I can confirm that I have over 800 hours in this game. This game is amazing and has become one of my favorite games of all time. It's so simple anyone can play it however to get really good at it takes time. Though going into practice mode will only get you so far... the real way to get good is to play and experience! Eventually your mind will adapt to the situations of the game. I am not joking when I say that I know where a ball is going to land based on what position and speed it hits the wall and I've memorized this due to the simple stadiums/maps. A more experienced player shows and it's mostly skill that leads to a victory. This game is perfect for pretty much anyone who is interested in it and I promise none of you will be disappointed.

review: This game is just downright amazing in the way it has taken a new approach on a sports genre game and plays like an absolute blast. If you have never actually heard of rocket league (how haven't you) to be short its really cars that are able to jump and use rocket boost (which can later be used to use quite a lot of aerial moves) that play soccer the game consists of a few different game modes but generally it is either 1v1 2v2 3v3 soccer matches with 5 minutes to score as many goals as possible but there are quite a few other distinct game modes to take up some of your time.i also want to mention this is my second account owning Rocket League the other has roughly 150 hours on itThe game is quite hard to pick up and learn i have to say but seems quite relatively easy. Once you start learning the timings and when to hit the ball everything starts becoming a blast a play its just about practice practice practice. and with the new custom training mode that has been added it is easy to browse the workshop and find a training routine to practice whatever it is you want (such an amazing addition to the game) I just cant recommend this game enough to try out and is a blast to play with friends

review: The idea of rocket powered cars flipping through the air in Thunderdome esque matches of cage soccer sounds like the incoherent ramblings of a madman but it turns out to be just crazy enough to work. Psyonix s Rocket League the follow up to Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars finds dumb fun in pulling turbocharge assisted front flips in an ice cream truck and the white knuckle strategy in working with your team to control the giant ball on offense and defense. The fast and fluid absurdity of Rocket League fuses into one hell of a good time despite servers that rarely work perfectly.The main mode puts two teams of three in visually diverse but performance identical vehicles (though 1v1 2v2 and 4v4 variants exist) as they race up and down the pitch chasing the league s oversized equivalent of a soccer ball. The great thing is you don t need to know anything about driving games or soccer to play. The rules are simple drive really fast around bright glossy neon colored arenas and do fancy tricks while trying to smash an endlessly ricocheting ball into a deceptively tight space.The heart of Rocket League lives in that feeling of unrestricted movement. It s thanks in large part to the use of what I would call physics plus where the laws of gravity and momentum get a colorful overhaul to allow for driving on the walls and ceiling and ridiculous mid air direction changes that would liquefy the driver in the real world. But its fantastic movement is so arcadey and satisfying that I often have to remind myself to pump the brakes or lay off the tricks when a simple nudge or bump will do.And those tricks are the first surface scratching glimpse at Rocket League s layer of strategy under the ostensibly chaotic mashing of metal. Tapping your jump button puts you in the air where tapping it again with a direction held performs a somersault barrel roll or bicycle kick. It might sound simple and really it is but timing a strike to connect with a speeding ball and controlling the direction you send it sailing down to precise angles takes some skill. There are real potent levels of satisfaction to be tapped when you see a teammate lining up a shot from the corner and read the situation slamming on the brakes to nudge the pass into the goal with a perfectly timed barrel roll. It s electric.Outside of the frenzied and intoxicating gameplay Rocket League has scant few features to flesh out the experience. The player progression system where winning matches performing in game feats or doing anything really earns you experience unlocks a small stable of goofy cars or cosmetic decals and accessories.It s fun to drive a truck wearing a sombrero sure but because there s little or no mechanical difference between the dozen or so sportsters trucks exotics a few concept models and at least one ice cream truck (exclusive to PS4 players) there s no actual sense of progression that changes how you play a match. And while that s all perfectly justifiable in the name of a level multiplayer playing field I would have loved to see each car carry the strengths and weaknesses implied by their real world counterparts sport cars as speedy but hard to handle strikers trucks and vans as slower but stronger defenders and the balanced but all purpose roamers somewhere in between. It seems like a missed opportunity to add a more meaningful connection to your cars in the garage especially when making a squad to play through an entire season.But there is a separate progression arc found in learning to use the surprising mechanical depth of Rocket League s many controls and flighty physics. Whether that arc takes you through online competitive or ranked matches easy going exhibitions up to four player local cooperative play on split screen or all 36 weeks of a fully expanded season mode the Rocket League experience is always about getting into the next throttle pumping match.And while there are leaderboards to track your statistics and global prowess Rocket League servers struggle to support the influx of PlayStation 4 and PC players hunting for same and cross platform matchmaking bouts rendering most of Rocket League s online features including the online party system spotty at best. Fortunately the AI is formidable on either difficulty setting above Rookie both as teammates and opponents so Rocket League doesn t lose much in a completely offline existence which is good because its online suite is largely unreliable.THE VERDICTRocket League is a rare example where the execution of a simple absurd idea is so strong and so engaging that it doesn t need a ton of extra features around it. The rush of ripping across the pitch at full turbo to deny a shot on goal with a clutch bicycle kick is enough to bring me back time and time again for just one more match even without meaningful progression systems. Rocket League is a great goofy easy to learn and difficult to master action sports game which demands that you grab a few friends and play a few rounds.8/10 IGN
title: Rocket League®

review: It all started so innocently. I wanted to buy the steam controller and at the time this game came free with the controller so I got it. One of my friends played it and I really didn't think it'd be that good because I'm not a fan of games such as fifa or really any sports type video games. I prefer to play them myself if you know what I mean. But I went ahead and installed it and gave it a go on the reccomendation of my friend... it was all over after that. This is not like any other sports video game that I have seen before. It's cars. cars that are rocket powered. (did I mention that you can fly?) The purpose is to drive your car into a ball and get that ball into a goal on the opposing end of the field. Simple right? very. However this game while easy to play and with a easy learning curve is difficult to master. If you are not careful you will become addicted to trying to climb that ranking system. Not to mention due to the rounds being about five minutes (without overtime and minimal replay watching) it's easy to pick up play a few games and then get on with your daily responsibilities. so I guess you could say yeah I think this game is pretty okay.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is extremely good. It started off with some minor annoyances (like 60fps cap) but were quickly fixed. Nonetheless this game is a game you should play with your friends since then is when you will most enjoy it. However you can still play solo as they have a season mode which lets you create your own team and play a whole season to see if you can win.PROS + Easy to play you can get the hang of it pretty quickly (Controller a must though).+ EXTREMELY fun to play (if you're not one of the rage types for the ranked matches)+ Has a decent amount of content for entertainment (various training modes season friendly online ranked online basketball ice hockey...)+ It IS a $20 game they don't do that Hello Games sh*t where they release a broken game for $60.CONS You CAN rage quit in ranked sometimes it gets frustrating. *Not really a con more like nitpicking*I'd like it if they could add some sort of spotify add on or a music detection so that we could play our playlists in the background (I mean on PC you can just download spotify and play it on the background but its not as clean / )EDIT I will NOT recommend this game again until they invest more in their servers instead of adding things like crates skins and crap. It's like Valve all over again. First of all I play US East and South America because I live in Costa Rica. Yet it is near IMPOSSIBLE to get a match in South America where I can get decent server performance. Why don't I mention ping? Because I sometimes get 192 stable ping with NO packet loss at all so the game is actually playable. However there are times where I can have 60 ping and be teleporting all over the ing place. Like what? How does that work? Is it cause they have potato servers? Is it because of my poor internet connection? (Which I find highly unlikely since I have 50mbps download and 1mbps upload with a high end Netgear router and a Motorola modem).
title: Rocket League®

review: Pros Takes absolutely no grinding just pick up and play. Games are short so even blowouts don't get aggravating. Matches are action packed and it feels like you can contribute right away. Easy to play but has a high skill ceiling. Tricks highly skilled players can pull off are more impressive than feeling cheap. Community isn't salty in game folks tend to stay silent. Cross platform play means I can go against friends on XBone or PS4. Uniquely suitable for players of all ages.Cons Hoops and Hockey modes aren't as developed. Not a big fan of the DLC and "key" mechanics prefer everything to be available through normal gameplay.I think the best praise I can give Rocket League is that it's a game I come back to again and again because literally every match I've ever played has been fun. Jump in and jump out for a quick game or play several in a row for a good night with friends. Excellent game for streaming especially with friends in voice chat. Highly recommended.
title: Rocket League®

review: Before I say anything let's get this straight.. I don't buy very many games let alone write a review for them.Rocket league is an outstanding game. It truly is a lot of fun and its a game that me and my friends can pop into (no matter the skill level) and there is a mode for us to play where we all have fun. They keep adding new things weather its new cars new modes maps and car modifications. It's always nice to see new things and twists added into the game. The newest mode they added (Rumble) is a total blast and its almost like a completely 2nd game inside of Rocket league and I truly hope that they add more power ups..Now that im done sucking up the the creators for the game lets get serious.. While there have been some great things added to the game their map additions have been lacking. I was no a fan of the Tokyo map that they added but that slowly grew on me.. My biggest issues is the newest map AQUADOME. This map is the laggiest map in the world. The graphcis are rather trash and for a lot of people its pretty much unplayable.. Most people may be saying that thats not a big deal but when you get that map 4 ING TIMES BACK TO BACK TO BACK TO BACK IN THE DAMN RANKED QUEUE.. IT STARTS TO TICK YOU OFF BECAUSE YOU CAN NOT DO ANYTHING EXCEPT SIT THERE AND TRY TO PLAY BUT IN THE END JUST ACCEPT YOUR FATE THAT YOU ARE GOING TO LOSE AND POSSIBLY DERANK. Some more people may be saying that thats not that bad either.. but it is when you have teammates who are trying to throw the game or not even playing because they hate the map just as much as you and cant play on it either. like gg guys.. great map. .
title: Rocket League®

review: Pros Varied vehicle design and customization while not offering unfair advantage. Does not punish you for your preferred aestheticSeason mode Beautifully crafted arenas across a variety of aesthetic stylesA good variety of sporty musicCons Wonky physicsIrritatingly bad AiPoor sports style ai programming/difficulty rampSolo play mode only your experience will probably be different in multiplayer and can ignore the ai section.Cons details below I won't say that its a bad game but the frustration that goes along with artificial difficulty and other points is more than I am willing to recommend. Might still be your cup of tea but I digress.Physics the cars have very little weight and if you get knocked into the air it can be quite awhile in game time before you make it back to the field. Likewise getting bumped will send you flying. In a game where you get bumped so often this gets irritating rather quickly. There is also the matter that jumps are not consistant your highest jump is different than the ai's and is not consistant between your own jumps. You can expect to jump over the ball because the jump height is suddenly higher by doing the same thing you usually do normally that puts you under where you want to be. You will lose jump offs 90% of the time because the ai can jump higher than you can. Somewhat manageable in positions where you can rocket jump and get a position advantage but that is often not the case. There is also the point that you can hit the ball at full speed and have the game react as if you had hit it going the opposite direction. The AI is bad across all difficulties. If it were consistently so it wouldn't be so bad but the sports programming to make the game harder the closer to the end of a match/season makes it feel like you are alone on your team. Your team will miss the ball or the net while sitting next to it will watch the ball roll past them into your goal pass the ball to the other team and stop contesting it and will occasionally put the ball in your own net. This happens with irritating frequency you will have a 3 0 lead and still lose a match 4 3 in the last minute because your team decided to change sides. That really isn't much worse than human players I suppose but really kills the game when you repeatedly lose because the ai decided it was so and not due to your own error.
title: Rocket League®

review: I'd have to say this is honestly the best sports game of the year. While I have limited time in it at this rate.... I can also say that it is the most enjoyable sporting experience on the PC if not on the entire gaming market at the moment. It runs unbelievably smooth the net code is pretty much as good as you can expect in a driving game with this much contact involved and you can use your brain quite a bit to get you an advantage as well.... as I have found strategies from various real life sports help a lot if you incorporate them into your quick reaction thinking. Think I'll be playing this one quite a bit ) Definitely recommend it especially for its reasonable price.

review: I really hope the lag I got doesn't affect the opinion of this review. I'm gonna try and keep it simple enough for anyone to understand in a peaceful manner.While I do think this game needs some improvements I still think this is a good game. It's not necessarily addicting or completely life wasting in terms of enjoyment but I still enjoyed most of my hours playing this game. I emphasize "most" because the game still has issues.For one there's lag. A lot of it. I don't know if it was just my internet or its ability to connect to the servers but no matter what server I joined or what region I joined in my ping would spike tremendously. I'd rather have a constant minor lag than major lag spikes. There have been so many instances in which I'd think I'm about to hit the ball but in reality I'm actually on the other side of the field. It was hard to type that without cussing especially since the lag in this game is especially frustrating due to the immense pressure and excitement the game induces. I still want to emphasize that this isn't a bad game. It's just that my experience was faultered because of my terrible lag spikes.Another thing I liked about this game was its immense customization. There are a lot of different things you can apply to your vehicle like paintjobs tires trails antennas and even hats for your car. Yes hats. However this system is also faultered. When I say a lot of customization I of course mean spending hours upon hours UPON HOURS unlocking these items.The loot system in this game is so bad. You can play for hours on end and sometimes only end up unlocking maybe one crappy antenna. It works the same way as Destiny's loot system (AWFUL). It doesn't matter if you scored 17 goals on the other team and saved 23 shots in the course of a 5 minute game it's still completely random. There's a chance that the AFK guy in the corner could get a loot crate instead of you. I spent a whole day 14 hours of my life playing this game for my whole saturday. You know how many items I unlocked? THREE. THREE ITEMS. IN THE COURSE OF 14 HOURS. ONLY ONE WAS DECENT. I DO NOT LIKE THIS LOOT SYSTEM.On another note I like the modes in this game and I think they should expand it some more. At the time of me writing this review there's Rumble Classic Doubles Duel Snow Day Chaos and Hoops. Most of these modes (except Snow Day and Chaos) are fun to play and I think more modes like this would be fun. Imagine a Volleyball mode were you hit the ball over the net and you could even "set it" to your teammate so they could "spike" it down. I think that'd be fun.There's not much else to say about the game besides more about my personal experience with the intense lag which I'm sure you don't want to hear. In short this is a very fun game with issues. A flawed masterpiece I suppose. The idea of the game in itself is also likeable and the game has so much potential for growth.FINAL SCORE 8.5/10

review: Here's the thing about Rocket League.You need to like getting good at playing games or doing activities to enjoy this game. The community is generally amazing although the occasional isn't too uncommon either but that's just the way online gaming is i guess.Returing to my anterior point the fact is that Rocket League is very fun especially with the addition of Rumble game mode (powerups!) but will get undoubtedly boring unless you start to take it somewhat seriously and start craving getting that little bit better be it getting that aerial just a bit faster learning to dribble better whatever.The fact is competitive play is what runs this game now albeit there is still a large part of community playing on casual. So i recommend this game fully and it is worth every cent of the 19 99 i payed for it and each minute of the 300 hours i've played has been great. The only catch i present is that it will almost definitely get somewhat repetitive if you don't start playing competitive with the objective of getting better personally.

review: They hit all the notes that are missed in other games. Waiting in queue? Do other stuff while you wait like go through the garage training or exhibition games and you'll get pulled in automatically once the game is ready. Region specific server queues fast matchmaking free DLC for the important stuff that everyone need for it to work(i.e. The arenas) and paid DLC for cosmetic stuff that doesn't give one player an advantage over others cross platform play up to four player split screen a third the price of "AAA" titles DLC priced just right so you're giving the devs a tip and the Deloran DLC was perfect.

review: I remember hearing the hype about this game when it first came out and I didn't think I'd like it. About 2 years later down the line I thought it's on sale why not? I 100% recommend this game to anyone. I don't enjoy playing any sports games but there's something about being in a car with rockets and trying to score goals on another team that makes this fast pace intense game so fun! I actually went ahead and bought a bumper sticker for my car IRL to show my support to the world haha. It takes a long time to get the small tricks down and even longer to get the pro moves down. I only consider myself decent and I can beat my friends 1 v 2 hahaha. They hate me on this game when we play against eachother super competitive. Playing against others is extremely fun whether you prefer to play with friends or solo but friends amplify the fun magnitude up to 10x! Talk smack and eat your own words in this awesome game!
