review: This game is worth it if you're looking for some simple and compact co op match for 5 minutes. The price is quite affordable even though the content isn't that much. Although the game is pretty simple and straight forward there aren't a lot of things you can do in the game tbh. However given the ability to customize your own car is pretty fun thing to do plus you often get free stuff every match! The community is pretty good so far I have only encounter 1 player who trash talk a lot compare to Dota 2 lol. And one more thing if you have a console laying around use it for this game! It will not make you be better than other player but it is much easier with console than keyboard imo.
title: Rocket League®

review: This is an amazing game. It's the perfect mix between football and racing. Graphics are phenomenal. The BGM fosters a calm yet intense gaming atmosphere. Just an amazing game overall. review: This is one of those rare games that you can pick up and play for literally 5 minutes and then (if you're lucky and have good self control) can put it down and be totally satisfied. If you're more like me you can also hop on to play a single game and then end up playing for 3 hours before you realize it because it's so much fun.The developers of this game deserve a lot of credit. Not only did they knock it out of the park with the original game they've been continuously updating and adding content since the game's release. And every update brings fun thing things to do lots of new achievements and lots of new items to play with. This game gets a perfect 5/7 100%

review: Dumping endless hours into this game on console I can honestly say this is one of my favorite games of all time. The game is simple soccer with cars. Easy to play hard to master. I truely believe this game is a work of art to Psyonix you took something so simple and created something so complex and truely stunning. I have reccomended this game to multiple friends and I have heard nothing but good things from it. If I had one quirk it would be the ranking system it is so hard to move up in rank yet so easy to lose rank. It would also be nice to have a Doubles Solo due to the simple fact that you are usually matched up against a party.

review: Rocket leauge is one of my favourite games of all time. It is the first of its kind and has one of the best devolopers Psyonix. They are one of the best devolopers because they listen to their community more than anything else. If there is a noticable problem by the community Psyonix is on it. the game itself runs up to 250 fps which is more than enough. 60 fps is good enough to play this game. The connection is very good and the servers are very good. Some people complain about the ranking system but i think it is good and it SHOULD be hard to rank up. It is WAYYYYY harder to rank up in csgo than in rocket leauge. But rocket leauge is that type of game. It is 100% worth 20 dollars. So if youre looking for a great game to play buy this one.
title: Rocket League®

review: Best game I have ever played...period. I do not play sports games...never been a fan. Always played FPS Action Strategy type of games. This game got me hooked from day one. I gave up on every other game. FO4 GTA Skyrim...haven't touched them since I bought this game. It's taken over my evenings. I don't regret it. I love every minute of it. Only complaint is that some players are very immature and either troll or prefer to forfeit than play through a game. I guess that's expected in any game though. It's balanced by the majority of players being class act and I've had some great runs with good teamates.Get it!

review: I've logged 300 hours approx. In terms of overall enjoyment I've had in this game. I'd say quite a bit even though with the new maps and their actualy awfulness. I love this game the community is wonderful I think I've only ever added someone through a game in rocket league. I always have people sending me invites to play any gamemode whether they are a challenger elite or even a champion. I really could care less what rank you are I just like playing the game. Rocket labs was a great way to introduce alternative maps. However neo tokyo is simply too annoying the bounces are luck based until you hit champion level. Most people won't get that far anytime soon let alone give the effort to get there. That's why I'm very happy they introduced map preferences. Overall I'd give it a 9/10 simply for occasional server drops and or lag from over textured maps.

review: AMAZING! Only 9 hours thus far on it so will be editing this no doubt in time once I get to 100 hours or so. That said thus far it looks outstanding. Tons of chaos type fun trying to get the ball in the net. I suspect this will eventually make it into my list of all time top games ever (noted below with reasons why) Burnout Revenge PS2 (just play the game and tell me it is not the best racing game ever)Mario SuperStrikers GameCube (change options to explosions only and unlimited bombs and tell me this is not crazy)NHL 97 PC (any game where you can pummel the ref where you see him flying through the sky is awesome plus the game play and the commentary were revolutionary at the time and still have not been surpassed (at least the commentary hasnt)FIFA 94 SNES (you can put the settings so you can bodycheck everyone full contact soccer rules)Twisted Metal PS1 (blowing up cars driven by your friends when playing multiplayer is soo much fun)Rocket League is not in my top 5 yet but is VERY closeMy ranking for Rocket League is 8.5/10 (would be 9 if they gave us more weapons like rocket launchers though the option to go warp speed and demolish an opponent is definitely a great start!)

It's pretty in depth.

review: Rocket league is tons of fun and is great for both casual and competitive players. The game is almost entirely glitch free and hacks are non existent (from my knowledge). Matches are only five minutes long but are extremely intense and really can keep you on the edge of your seat in a close game. The only real complaint I can think of is the match making system being slighty unfair at times matching myself with opponents who are either much better or worse than me. Other than that the game is flawless and definitely worth adding to any PC gamer's steam library.

review: I've always loved competitive games and this satisfied my search after I was getting a bit tired of Sm4sh Bros.Game is well made well updated and very fun. Rocket RC Soccer didn't appeal to me initially but once I started playing I hated my brother for introducing it to me. Bye bye freetime XD.The game is primarily multiplayer online based (which is free) but there are some local solo matches you can do. The fun exists with other players though.Constantly being updated Psyonix is adding new features which keep the game interesting. Multiple ways to play multiple ways to win tons of fun.The only down side (is it one?) is that there is a skill tier and if you want to play with your friend who just started playing after you've been playing for a while you'll likely crush them and they'll likely get annoyed.Online competitive is balanced however so new players will play with other new players of the same skill.

review: Do you remember those days when playing a video game was fun? This game reminded me of those days.No RNG No p2wNo Nickle n DimeJust straigh up fun!I honestly never though soccer with freaking cars would be so much fun I personally hate sports! Yet this game is so much fun!The graphics are amazing the customazation is amazing too. What really make this game stand out is that there is no type of advantage rather you play on console or pc or pc with a console controller anybody can do amazing stunts in this game. One thing I disliked was the salty 1v1 community out there. Some players will go out of their way to turn a game into an ocean of salt rather they are winning or loosing. (I'd suggest staying away from 1v1 unless you're playing with friends or if you can deal with the salt)Other than the 1v1 issue I've had I can't say anything else bad about the game.. well maybe being able to play with people of same level would be nice.

review: 30 minutes into RL and this is already my favourite game after TBOI R(A.K.A. isaac rebirth). the control machanic is somewhat not that difficult it's what u do in a soccer game except in car form(i nvr play sports irl and maybe im talking out of my here). this is quite a new change of pace for a car game i've played car version of soccer game but it's just a minigame of that game. quite awkwardly boring. just a bunch of cars hitting a ball. in RL u can f*cking see a player balancing a ball in mid air into the enemy goal. ggwp. i dont usually play... wait that's unreal what i mean is i nvr play sports game b4 just cause....... 2 haha see what i did there.... im sorry but yeah i dont like sports game but i like racing game tho this developer just took a step further by thinking hmmm we should put cars..... in sports! but mainly soccer because that is the most well known sports in the world. i thought the control would be hard at start but it's actually pretty easy to master well until u got 360 no scope by an expert player that makes u think u're horrible at this game. almost 4got to put up score memeerr.... 19/15 would get decimated by players againp.s. by master the control easily i mean u need a controller
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is the greatest game ever. For the first little while you'll find yourself randomly flopping around but once you get the hang of it you will have so much fun.GameplayThe gameplay consists of cars that can jump and do flips at your command playing soccer. Online play requires a lot of teamwork to be able to score or defend your goal. If you don't work well with your team you're bound to get dominated. Community The community for the most part are very kind people not a lot of toxic people. Controls/Camera Controlling your vehicle is fairly easy to do but they don't turn very sharply. Some people say playing with a controller is much easier but I still get lots of goals with keyboard and mouse. If you're in ball cam and the ball is high over top of you the camera angle is a little weird.Learning curve So this game has a very big learning curve it's very hard to get used to but the tutorials help you a lot.Audio The menu music is really bad but other than that everything else is good.Customization You can customize your car from its body to the colour of your boost but you can't alter or upgrade its performance so it's a very fair game and no overpowered cars.I think that's about it... 10/10 game
title: Rocket League®

review: Over the course of your Rocket League career you'll start out by puttering around the field and missing open nets while eventually advancing to flying through the air and dribbling the ball through two defenders. I highly recommend using a xbox360 controller as the controls are basic enough but allow for the high precision necessary for high skill play. There are currently four gamemodes soccer hockey basketball and rumble mode. Soccer is where you learn how to drive your vehicle. Hockey is where you learn how to drive your vehicle on the walls. Basketball is where you learn how to fly your vehicle through the air. Rumble mode is where you forget everything you know and just have a good time with all the wacky powerups.Bring some friends and remember that everyone sucks when they start out but once you score your first aerial goal you'll begin to understand how amazing this game is.Rumble Mode is a good equalizer mode to play with friends.
title: Rocket League®

review: It begins with the outlandish and seemingly unrelated concept of cars and soccer and unites them with rockets aerial acrobatics and controller clenching knuckle whitening action! But once you've suspended your disbeliefs you'll be sucked in and with it's addictive nature you will soon be asking "Wait... is it really that late already?".It's deceptively simple appearance makes it approachable and great for casual fun. But don't be fooled it's easy to learn yet extremely hard to master and comes equiped with a very high skill ceiling for the competitive ones out there. Best enjoyed with some friends I'm sure this game will continue to hold up to the test of time as a fun little gem for all to enjoy. I'd highly recommend this to anyone!

"Wasteland" is the newest map added to the game and really adds some variation which is great but it seems too heavy in the rotation of all the maps lately and it's not a crowd favorite by any means.Other than that this is my favorite sports game of all time.Well this and "Super Dodgeball" for Nintendo.p.s. awesome soundtrack.

review: Superb. Creative new mechanic easy to get in hard to master. This game pulls you in with its enjoyable mechanic combining cool customizable cars with football (soccer). The graphics are pretty there is casual and competitive modes to keep you coming back to either trying to outclass other players or just casual fun. This game also keeps the ever decreasing number of games supporting split screen. That's right! You could bring this game to parties or family gathering and have tons of fun with your family and/or friends! The developers also provide adequate amount of support bringing in new contents every now and then growing the competitive scene and ensuring the hard earned ranked of competitive players get rewarded by season end! There's very little one can find that's not to love about this game!
title: Rocket League®

review: Jazykem celého českého národa varuji že tato část textu vám může zníčit mozkové tkáně může obsahovat nadávky do paní na D1 a urážlivé a rasistické názory na tuto hru. Začnu z lehounka. Skiny jsou drahé jak rafův mozek takže se docela dajít lehce prodat a za málo peněz. Dále bych mohl napsat aerodynamika létaní jsou pro slabé lidi velmi těžké(třeba jako já). Prosím přidejte do hry vrtulníky a letadla na zlehčení této hry v létání.Míč není kulatý ale šišatý jako hlava Gunmana.Kurva germánské kmeny prosím vyhubit pro zlepšení hratelnosti a také pro necítění jako chudý žebrák protože pro ně bych dal skiny 75x dražší jak pro ostatní. Dále bych také řekl názor na nějaké slovenské hráče. Měli by jste si všimnout FluryTheBeast tento hráč drží rekord v nejdelším neožralém pití kde se správně opil přesne 3x pitíčky s vodkou. Ale to je jenom vedle tento hráč má kvalitu na úrovni Messiho a kopací techniku na úrovni Patrika opilého jako kráva. Batmobil prosím nerf není v něm batman ale spiderman a ještě něco ke hře je to píčovina jak mraky děkuji za dodání pro celé potešení.jděte prosím na Steam FluryhoTheBeasta a přečtěte si i jeho zprávu Samozřejmě Kappa pls nehatujte mě skiny posílat můžete nudes taky díky btw 8.5/10

review: After over 600+ hours of gameplay I can say I am ready for a review. Let me just start of with saying that If you have never played rocket league then what are you waiting for? This game is so popular for a very good reason because it's a damn brilliant game. Everything about it just feels right. The controls are tight and you can adjust the car however you want in any moment of the game it's hard to do at first but once you put some hours into the game the experience is so rewarding and you see yourself improving.Graphics are just perfect too it's not trying to be the next crysis with ultra realistic graphics it just overall looks good with a cool art style and it's perfect for what it's trying to achieve to just be a fun game.The performance for the most part is excellent. I mean this game can run on almost any pc there are some maps wich users with a lower end pc have stated that they get lower fps in. One map in particular is Aquadome. I don't think this will be too much of an issue though as there might be performance patches to fix this and pc computers are getting cheaper anyway so people every day can afford more powerful hardware.One of the things that make this game great is playing with your friends I mean you will have so many good moments from the funny fails to the epic moments it's all worth it. People tend to complain about the Rocket League community for being rather "cancerous" but like any game not all people are and the ones who are just ignore plus you can disable voicechat and text chat if you so wish so no problem there.Conclusion This game is the example of "Easy to learn but hard to master" it's addicting and faced paced and so satisfying winning a close match.Summary Tight controls and very responsive Generally good performance Addicting and fast paced Brilliant co op play Funny fails and epic moments Frequently updated Near endless customisation Many maps DLC is only cosmetic for the most part and even cars aren't p2w Steam workshop content Trainer with any type of practice you can think of Big playerbaseWHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR BUY IT!
title: Rocket League®

review: Ok so Im'm going to start off with saying I really love rocket league and its perfect for me!but lets get into the Pros and Cons PROS1.Perfect for competitive players2.Great if you like skill based games3.Has a nice community4.It's possible to trade in game items5.Great for playing splitscreen with friends or playing online with friends CONS1.There is microtransactions for certain Cars DLC and Keys for opening crates2.It takes a while to get good at3.If you want to get good vanity items such as decals or wheels you are foreced to either buy keys or trade items. Well there you have it theres the pros and cons but Rocket League is a really fun game to play as long as you are okay with having to have time to practice and dont mind having to pay to get dlc.I would highly recommend this game to anyone who does enjoy competitive online games.If you do happen to buy this game though I recommend using keyboard and mouse because later on when you get better a controller will limit you to keyboard and mouse users.

review: It's probably already been said but Rocket League is pretty much a great example of "easy to get into hard to master." If the concept of playing soccer with rocket cars sounds like something you can sink your teeth into Rocket League may be for you.Because ultimately what you see is what you get. There aren't many frills or twists here other than car cosmetics (which don't affect gameplay ) although there are a couple of "extra" modes such as a basketball variant I haven't really dove into yet. But the core of the game works so well I haven't really felt compelled to try it. The gameplay gets a little more nuanced once you start learning how to get the most out of jumps and boosts but generally speaking you don't have fancy control schemes to memorize like other sports games do. The physics of the game feel and behave like you would expect them to so its often just a matter of how well you can drive and put yourself in the position to make plays.And in a game where everyone is zooming and boosting around making plays in a frenetic match felt very gratifying to me. A quick reverse to nudge a ball into the goal or pummeling into an opponent's car to throw off their shot... great fun. Its also interesting how the dynamics of a match can change simply by switching between different modes as mentioned I didn't play the basketball mode but even going from 3v3 to 2v2 matches can fundamentally change your strategy. The core may remain the same but the game often shows its depth in interesting ways.Perhaps my only complaint at this point is that I don't understand the ranking system. I have a tier that I belong to but no apparent indication of how close I am to the next one or how I even level up. Not a huge deal as I'm not wildly invested in competitive at this point but still a bit odd at a glance.The game may focus on only one thing but it does that one thing pretty fantastically. Definitely recommended.

review: Rocket League...The game that took the gaming scene by surprise. Personally I don't enjoy car games racing games or sports games. Especially not soccer. Then why does this game interest me so much?pros * Fast cars!* Flying cars!* Blowing people up!* Ranked &amp Casual games!* Completly destorying oppontants 15 0... also getting destroyed albiet not as pleasurable!* Local Co op (upto 4 players) multiple local player can also play against or with online players.* Great replay features* Spectator mode* Very capable AI* Not too bad community most are friendly and respectful. Some are quite bitter!* 5 min games keep you busy for HOURS! Literally! Time seems to fly playing this game.* Offline season mode is... acceptable.* Cant comment on DLC dont own it.The very worst thing to say to yourself when playing this game.... "ONE MORE ! " Buy it you fools.

review: I have 10 hours in this game and I have been having so much fun and laughter! Rocket League is really simple but can get intense in matches. Base on the type of matches you go in it could be a clusterf*ck with all the cars all over the ball or everyone using their abilities as soon as they get it. You always want to hit the ball just so you could make a nice trick shot into the goal or to make a amazing save. Either way you feel triumph and want to play more. There are these cosmetics that could look pretty good on your Nissan. You could change the way your rockets look have designs or just have a crown on top of your pink truck. There are many types of varieties you could choose for your rocket car. You could get them by playing matches or buying crates with keys which kinda sucks. Some problems I have are the players they could help your team to victory or completely ruin your chances of at least getting one goal. What happens in many player's minds is that they have to hit the ball no matter what! They go straight for the ball. And this is the problem this could ruin people chances of getting a goal because a person decided they could get it but fail anyway. In other cases they might hit the ball into their own goal causing the opposing team to win and making you hate the guy who scored. I guess you shouldn't be mad because everyone makes mistakes. thats what we do. Unless he is trolling then curse the hell out of him.Controls can also get confusing esspecially when you are playing with mouse and keyboard. But once you get use to the controls you could become a pro at it. This game is ment for a controller. Besides those two issues this game has so much that can offer. I recommend this game and give it a 9/10.
title: Rocket League®

review: I don't really care for cars or soccer but Rocket League is incredibly fun! It can be dangerously addictive...addictive to the point where after a 5 minute match you start to instictively click to play another even though you intended to quit. It's also a very easy game to quickly jump in and jump out of (if you can break the cycle) because of these quick 5 minute matches. Some people are turned off immediately by the high skill ceiling and there is a seriously high ceiling but everyone gets better the more they play and it can be very rewarding to improve. There is some quick training and bots you can play against so you're not going into an online game blind. I played through some single player seasons against bots before I joined any online matches.Even if you just want to screw around there's always the hockey basketball and rumble modes outside of the more typical 1v1 2v2 3v3 and (the more ridiculous) 4v4 modes. On top of these (in local games only) you can mess around with mutators to change the gravity size of the ball give unlimited boost and a handful of other neat options. There's no reason to take the game too seriously (especially if you're never playing ranked matches anyhow). Even if you typically do play to win and if you're getting frustrated because you're not doing as great as you hoped in ranked matches these other game modes are an easy way to remind yourself why the game can still be super fun even if you're not winning!
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is simple in concept but extremely well executed.Pros No skill? No problem Need a challenge? Ranked competitive matchmaking Short on time? Quick matches Bored easily? Endless cast of characters in teammates as well as varying gametypes across changing map layouts. Very active user base find a match at any time. A variety of rocket car chassis with plenty of options for personal expression.Cons Because of the game's accessibility and popularity it's played by a wide range of personalities. Not all of the people you encounter in matchmaking will be decent folk. If you like a challenge try the competitive matchmaking servers. The tiered multiplayer matchmaking system offers a great opportunity to push your abilities to their limits and perhaps learn some new ones in the process. If you're looking to goof around a while or test out your sweet aerials there are also more casual servers and even training modes with a freeplay option for all your antics.This game is great if you're just looking to kill a few minutes. With its short match times you're not making a huge committment but the game can still manage to pack plenty of intense gameplay in 5 10 minutes. Jump in for a study break and then get right back into learning about the powerhouse of the cell.If you're binging you'll run into plenty of diversity in your teammates with various skillsets at different degrees of polish making each successive match a mental struggle to exploit the weaknesses of the opposing team while trying to compensate for your own. In other words you won't get bored.This game is worth more than what you'll pay for it here.
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is an incredibly fun and addictive game. It is an easy to get into game with a simple concept and massive skill curve. It is great fun to play alone but even greater fun to play with friends.And I mean it's soccer with cars that can fly. What's not to love!

review: Rocket League can be best described as a competitive wacky simulator game everyone knows how to control the cars but it s mostly boils down to vaguely hitting the ball towards the goal and praying it goes inI m probably the worst player ever in rocket league. I can probably count how many goals vie scored on one hand. Didn t stop the game from being fun though. It s got that "grab a friend and hit giant balls with turbo powered sports cars with hats" kind of fun to it.I do wish competitive mode online had a tad bit of gameplay variety to it. With all the different stages there are only very minor differences. I wanted arenas where the gravity was a little heavier or arenas where your boost meter was self replenishing or something with a low goal and a high goal arenas with ramps and gimmicky stuff in the way. Sure elitist competitive people would moan but for god sake you re playing rocket powered car soccer! Let it be weird! If the game has got you curious best to grab a friend or two and give it a whirl

review: Fast paced and fun ruins friendships faster than the enemy team can score.*Edit*After playing it for a little longer here's my two cents As always very fast paced. Team mates vary from complete beginners to very good players. Community may or may not be cancerous but because communication is limited it's not really an issue. Pretty collors DLCs are not a must but they're cheap and some of them are neat looking*and another edit*Yes I do recommend this game because I friggin love the colors and stuff in it. I've nominated it even but for my own category of what it is It's unoriginal.It is a great game to play with good physics and great to toy around. The idea is so simple it's brilliant. But there were many other games like it that didn't make it. This one did.Do I recommend it though? Hell yes it's fun to play. The Devs do a great job at what they do and the eye candy is nice. There is only one aquatic map that gives my processor some trouble but other than that it's very well optimised.The customability in it is decent I'd love to see no limitations as to what decals you can add on cars (there are vehicles that can not be customized with visual items from other vehicles).Other than that it's fun as hell.Would recommend.Overall would recommend.
title: Rocket League®

review: In overall a fun game. The gameplay is superb and no pay to win mechanics as in most other online games nowadays.The community is quite mixed while one part of the community comes clearly from CS GO the other half are quite pleasant team mates / opponents.What bugs me a bit is that the casual mode if I'm not playing with my premade group ranked is a bit annoying. The range of skill within the 6 players on the field is far too great lately and in most cases not even. This leads far too often to matches that have seen 10 15 players before it ends.The ranked mode is actually quite nice even so some peple try to abuse mechanics to claim pizes they don't earn in 90% you will find yourself in nice and intense matches that are fun to play.

review: For anyone who doesn't know what rocket league is it's basically football with cars. This sounds incredibly boring however when you add rocket boosters explosions and wall climbing to it it becomes so much better.I got this game when it was in the summer offers and tbh haven't played it much because i found it quite hard to play (yes im a noob) however after plugging in a controler it becomes so much easier and you can actually win so basically just plug in a controller to your PC and your life issues are gone.I thought i would only really play this game on a casual level because when i've played competitive games before the communities are just so toxic. Rocket league is the complete opposite. I play with my friends on 2v2 and 3v3 and just having a laugh and still winning games and even without friends no one really cares if you're good or not.I really like this game because it's just so relaxed and it gives you a breather from the really competitive games out there but still gives you the enjoyment you'd expect from one. Best buy on steam by far.*Edit so now i have over 250 hours and i've finished a competitive season the higher you get the more people care which does lead to toxicity and saltiness but i still have to say that it's basically nothing compared to other big name games out there such as overwatch CS GO etc.Definite need to buy!!!
title: Rocket League®

review: NO Problem! One for the ages.I'm 47. I've played video games since I was 12 or so (so 35 years) since the Atari 2600 days. This game easily ranks in my top 5 all time. Super approachable. Super Silly. Its cars playing soccer with a giant ball and you can fly with rockets plus you have really great devs and community. OH and cross platform play. And great job by the developers keeping the silly players happy with (free) new modes in wacky arenas (hockey mode basketball coming etc) as well as a growing ranked player base with twitch sponsoring a 75K championship season. The pros' videos on youtube are stunning to watch but the matchmaking has been tweaked to usually give you a pretty even game no matter the skill level.Just do yourself a huge favor and buy this game.seriously.What a Save!
title: Rocket League®

review: The white knuckle experience and hand cramps after gripping the controller for a 6 hour rocket league session say it all. This is the game that I play most every night for the adrenaline rush and victory thrills. Even losing isn't so bad when the game is close and you still made the amazing plays that show in a replay. Fast paced quick games and with friends the fun factor is multiplied tenfold. Dive in and score your amazing goals today.Pros Intense Action The adrenaline flows as you score a goal then block the opponents attempt and win the game Music Oh my god the music in this game is 11/10 would listen to on repeat all day! Customization Your little RC car becomes a devil with horns a king with a crown or a mariachi with sombrero Graphics The game just looks pretty and flows beautifully as you fly across the field scoring and defending Multiplayer Play with up to 2 and 3 friends as you face off in various modes with fun mutatorsCons Matchmaking Can throw you into some crappy games from time to time Learning Curve Can be easy at the start but spikes in difficulty as you see people flying and your groundedNot enough cons to ruin the experience by any margin just some things to keep note of. Practice practice and more practice and you will eliminate con #2. See you on the pitch!
title: Rocket League®

review: I love me some skill based PvP games take out lots of the RNG and lets see whose better.RL delivers and i must preface this by saying im not a soccer fan at all in any way. But this game is very addictive.I would like to be able to change wether or not i join in progress games but other then that its solid games dont take long to get into and for the most part the teams are pretty even in competative. Outside of competative it can be skewed...but thats what non skill based MM will get you its just for fun at that state.I really enjoy the game and if you have no interest in competative the non competative and season modes are perfect and just as enjoyable.There is also a high skill cap basic skills are learned fairly quickly but ball guidance judgement and air hits are something that does take time to learn.

review: Great game for all the reasons below however if your buying this game for your kids just be aware there are numerous people on the online side of the game who will use very bad words and threats giving your kids a very different experience to the one you'd expect from such a game. so if you want to keep your kids away from anger aimed at them onscreen and some very bad swear words and threats then don't buy or just don't allow them to access the online side. this is the only downside to the game but one I think parents should be aware of before purchasing for their kids. edited my review from thumbs up to thumbs down simply because of the pings and stupid matchmaking. Also there are too many people who blast others for attempting to save shots and not being successful while the person blasting is nowhere near attempting a save as they are upfront failing to score. people moan if you bang into them by mistake and cry like babies and there is a lot of blaming other people because they suck and want to deflect the blame. so be prepared for a cry baby community.
title: Rocket League®

review: My most played game on Steam. 5 minute matches make it so it's different every time you play one. Most of the community are nice enough. Remember it's just a game and you'll play better than if you get heated up real quick. Its a mix of driving games sports action and you even get to mod your car. While there are loot boxes you have to pay for keys for this game also lets you trade with other players or trade in items you don't use for better ones. All things you pay for are only for looks and there is no play to win. Great game solo or with a friend or more!

review: Best fun I've had in a multiplayer game in a very long time. This is a game that you can instantly pick up and play and yet its skill ceiling is huge and extremely satisfying to reach for. This is a fantastic game for a drunken night with mates on the big screen or to climb the ladder solo. After that match I've honestly had enough of the game and at that point exits game. Man I love this title.

One of the things i really like about it is that you dont have to be a car nut! Its all very basic in that respect. review: Pros 1. The game is fun especially if you have friends to play with.2. Multiple modes to choose from. 3. It takes time and practice to become good.4. You can customize your car a lot and make it look either cool or ridiculous. 5. You get rewards every now and then and you can now customize your car even more! 6. There are various events from time to time such as christmas event and halloween event. Cons 1. I have never seen so salty community before and I'm not even lying now. So for those who doesn't like getting blamed in every single game you've been warned. So was it worth of my money?Yes I love the game.

review: Well where to start. Rocket League is one of those games that deserves more players but i also think could expand more. The game is amazing runs great fun gameplay but personally i've found myself burnt out. That may be because i've had time to play other games and get hooked on those however i feel as if the gameplay just isn't unique anymore if you solo queue you will get two types of people. Either the sweaty tryhards who will carry you call you a noob then leave after one game or the people that are mediocre at the game but whenever they get a goal expect to see "What a save!" in the chat. Overall i'd give this game like an 8/10 worth the money lots of fun just might wanna find a friend to queue with.

review: I'm playing Rocket League for a while now! ( Level Legend Rank overall Superstar )Firstly I really hesitated to buy this game because it looked a bit 'weird' also rc car football what the hell ? ) But after some friends bought it and told me that they have a blast with it I came to the conclusion to give it a try... and man I don't regret a single cent ( it's also quite cheap ) !Rocket League is an AMAZING SKILL GAME. Yes the learning curve is quite hard in the beginning but it pays out when you see your first aerial goal. Play it with your friends and you will laugh a lot!
title: Rocket League®

review: Rocket League is the most amazing competitve game that I have ever played. You start out just trying to make contact with the ball and trying to score any goal you can. Later on you will see someone fly in the air and hit the ball. You will then dedicate 100 hours perfecting hitting the ball in the air. Just when you have perfected this you find out you can turn your car in the air. 200 hours later you can hit the nastiest freestyles in the game but your positioning is terrible and you find yourself not being able to rank up. You will then dedicate your life to competitve and become a GOAT. The constant progression makes the game never feel stale and gives you new self made goals each step of the way. Ban Neo Tokyo from your map pool trust me you wont regret it. 10/10 IGN
title: Rocket League®

review: BEST. GAME. EVER.Okay okay ONE OF the best games ever. It is just such awesome fun. EDIT (2018) I did like this game and to be honest it is still a great game but OMG the community that plays are the WORST!CONSTANT people dropping out of ranked matches. There is apparently no penalty for doing so because it seems to happen in every match I get into.The worst matchmaking system in existence. Every game you get paired with people who either can't hit the ball or who seem to be able to fly around the arena without touching the floor once.It is INFURIATING! All I want to do is play the game with people of similar skill to myself so I can learn how to improve.They've got their loot box system in order though! That is faultless. Doesn't matter if the game is a good experience as long as they can hook those whales.
title: Rocket League®

review: The premise for Rocket League is as simple as soccer you control a car on a pitch and are trying to get the ball into the opponent's goal while attempting to prevent them from getting the ball into your goal. What make the game incredible and a great deal of fun is the craziness that ensues when trying to accomplish this feat. Cars can drive up walls rocket through the air power slide and blow each other up in pursuit of the ball which often seems to have a mind of its own as it bounces around the arena.A large amount of cosmetic unlockables are awarded as you continue playing but you won't need any motivation to keep queuing up for another game even if you happen to be coming off a tough loss. The game is even better with friends as the built in voice chat can allow for strategy and showering praise on each other for great shots epic saves and more. It's some of the most fun I've had in a long time and it is absolutely worth a purchase.
title: Rocket League®

review: 10/10!! From the moment I started I was instantly hooked. Constant action amazing customization and infinite replay value! One of the things I love most about this game is that the only determining factor in your skill level is the amount of time you spend playing. Everyone is on equal footing (in terms of gameplay) whether you've played for one hour or a thousand. It's also the only game that has ever made me want to be a part of the community between looking for the perfect teammates and item trading. I really can't say enough about this game. It's a must have. Simply amazing!

review: This review is a comparison from the previous game. i've played super rocket powered acrobatic battle cars (long name) and loved it. This game however improved a lot in diferent aspects one of the most funniest games in steam AL bots are better they now can enter in online games no more handicap games (they can score amazing goals against noobs). Customize i like the ideia to create your own car You dont need controller to play this keyboard is fine i do hat tricks all the time believe me (but if u want to do some serious gaming i recommend it) Dont waste time u can do stuff while waiting for a match.Unfortunately theres cons they removed some great stuff from SRPABC but can be patched No Auto goals (theres lots of people who deserve humilation award ) Reward medals at the end of each game. The only award avaible is the MVP award they removed best wingman goal keeper and more... (its always good to have a shelf full of awards)medals can improve moral and performance. its scietific fact All the maps have the same format the previous game had funny maps. i would like to see this in a patch some day but i dont know if its possible. the old maps are great. i think its all i dont remember any more details have fun.

review: Absolutely love the concept of the game and the gameplay and physics are great but I can't recommend this game in good conscience because from my experience the random latency and lag spikes make the game completely unplayable online.I've spent hours trying every fix under the sun including buying a new PC a new router new cables and switching ISPs. I've even moved countries and still get the same repeated lag spikes that lead to me missing the ball in key moments.If you are going to buy it immediately try going online and test your connection to the game servers out if you get any kind of lag spike despite low latency then immediately refund the game.

Whatever the case driving rocket powered cars can't help but be fun!I've been playing the game for about a year and have enjoyed it immensely. At this point I'm not playing it heavily now but I see it as a game that I will continue to play for years to come. This game has a place for people of every skill level with excellent support (on Steam at least) for split screen and party multiplayer matches. Overall I would definitely recommend this game to anyone.

review: Rocket League is a fantastically simple physics based game that is easily digested and retains interest for much longer than expected.Likes Easy to pick up simple game mechanics high skill ceiling micro transactions done right (only cosmetics) cross platform play done right several fresh game modes to retain interest satisfying competitive system team play is important immensely fun to play with friends and cheap!Dislikes the hitboxes on the cars are kind of misleading... yeah that's really it.Would I recommend it to others? Yes absolutely. Even if you aren't into sports games or physics based games Rocket League is a breathe of fresh air for anyone looking for a basic yet highly enjoyable gaming experience for a low price. I give it a solid 8/10.

review: Rocket League is one of the most fun games I've been able to pick up and play. You can play with either a controller or keyboard. Being mostly a keyboarder I was surprised how much easier the game is on a controller. There is a definitely a skill wall that you'll need to overcome when it comes from learning how to get your car to fly. That skill alone will allow you to stop way more shots. There are a slew of different game types where the mechanics of the game as well as the sheer gameplay changes allowing for all skill levels and ages. The rankings (Beginner Expert Pro) don't make any sense. They should be based off your individual statistics (Shots on goals assists etc) but they are merely based on time/wins.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game has captivated me moreso than League of Legends did in Season 3. With 454 hours in it right now I can say without question that this game is very unique and backed by a great dev team that provides frequent updates and listens to the fanbase. Additionally it has a fast growning eSports scene as well. Above all though my favorite thing about this game is its high skill ceiling. With practice and real dedication you can pull off absolutely jaw dropping moves and dazzle your opponents. Highly recommended I would have still bought the game had it have been $60 new. Good job Psyonix.

review: Urm... Wat do i put here? Im going to put a cake recipe i guess?Name Butterscotch Cinnamon PieInspired by UndertaleSecret Ingredient A touch of fire magic"For no reason in particular...which do you prefer? Cinnamon or butterscotch?" TorielYou will need 1 1/3 cup flour1/4 teaspoon salt1/3 cup sugar1/2 cup butter (cups of butter not buttercups)1 egg yolk1 tablespoon water1/4 teaspoon vanilla extractInstructions Combine flour salt and sugar.Cut in butter and mix until the consistency is like coarse sand.Mix in egg yolk.Add water and vanilla and mix until the dough comes together.Form into a thick flat cylinder. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate (about 30 minutes).Butter a pie tin and roll out dough to fit in the pan. Crimp edges and prick the bottom all around with a fork.Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (204 degrees C).Gently tuck parchment paper or aluminum foil on top of the dough and pour about a cup of dried beans or pie weights on top.Bake until golden brown (about 20 minutes).Remove pie weights and let cool then brush the bottom with milk.Completing the Butterscotch Cinnamon PieYou will need 1/4 cup butter2 cups whole milk1 cup heavy cream1/2 + 1/4 cup brown sugar2 tablespoons water9 egg yolks3 tablespoons corn starch2 teaspoons cinnamon1 baked pie shellWhip creamInstructions Brown the butter in a small sauce pan (heat until bubbles stop and there is a nutty aroma).Heat milk and heavy cream on medium until the edges form bubbles.Heat 1/2 cup brown sugar with water on medium until the bubbles become slow and big. Reduce heat to low.Slowly whisk in brown butter and then the milk/cream mixture. If there are any caramel lumps raise heat until they are dissolved.In a bowl combine remaining brown sugar with yolks corn starch and cinnamon.While whisking stir in half the stove mixture into the bowl (this will prevent the corn starch from lumping).Pour everything back into the pot and raise heat to medium stirring constantly so the eggs do not scramble.Stir until mixture considerably thickens and adheres well on the back of your spoon.Whisk to ensure homogeneity then pour into pie shell. (You may have a little extra left over.)Bake until mixture has set (about 25 minutes then turn off the oven and leave inside for 20 minutes more).Let cool in the refrigerater (about 1 hour).Serve with whip cream (and enjoy the feeling of your HP being fully restored!).

review: You might think Rocket League is just RC car soccer.. well I mean it is.. and that's what you tell people who ask what the game is about... but it's also one of the most fun 'quick' match type games I've played. 5 minute matches make the match long enough to be considered a match without taking too much time. You can customize your car to fit your personal style your car does technically effect how you play but the aesthetics don't change a thing.. unless you're using the lame ones P But for serious this game is for you if you're looking for a fun match game that you can play with friends or by yourself! #rcSoccerIsMoreFunThanRealSoccer
title: Rocket League®

review: Very Fun addicting game. The game mechanics are fairly difficult to master however I can happily say that I am having a blast learning. There are various different combat mode that makes the game very appealing (1v1 2v2 3v3 and 4v4). I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for something new fun and yea fun to play.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is pure fun when played with friends and even chaotic at 4vs4. Your objective is to get the ball to the enemy's goal under 5 min using car just like a soccer game but with car. Sound simple but hard to master. As the play require skill and in depth understanding of how game mechanic work. You have to use advanced technique such as aeriel manuever boost management juggling and many amazing play that you can muster. You can choose from 1vs 1 2vs 2 3vs3 or 4vs4. Ranked match private lobby pub and local play is possible. And the best thing local play support splitscreen! Want to have fun in one monitor? No problem! Up to 4 player possible and 8 player can join through LAN.Customization lie solely on cosmetic and each car have no different in ability so they are balanced by the fact each player have to play with similar limit. The difference s only the hitbox of different car. So player skill play a major role here. With a lot of achievement trophy EXP based level up stat and leaderboard this game bring high replayability value and 'bragging right' among player and friends. You can exchange stat and be proud of your "MAD SKILLZ".just 3 days after release the competitive scene have an eye on the game. Esport play.eslgaming.com now plan to establish rocket league cups on August. IMO this is deserved because there is high competitive value with depth gameplay lie on the game. Example for pro play can be seen here Link www.twitch.tv This game also released on PS4 and available for free for PS+ user this month. So get em! Currently cross platform support is being developed on the way. So expect more player to come when it is finished. The only problem this game has is server issue due to server overload. More than 10 000 player concurrently with limited server capacity due to dev budget make the server down a commonplace. Expect it to fixed later this year.All in all. This game is fun in purest form that you can't expect with any game nowsaday. Buy this game with friends now!
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is great fun and even better with friends it's a bit overated in my opinion because the gameplay is a bit repetitive even more so than EA sports games and thats saying something.Even with this problem it's still amazing and highly recommended to everybody even dislikers of real football/soccer.
title: Rocket League®

review: Some games have amazing narratives that provide great experiences. Then there are games that are purely fun through gameplay mechanics alone. Rocket League is one such game. I don t think I ve ever smiled so much when playing a video game maybe in those awe inspiring moments in truly great games but not constantly like with Rocket League. It s a simple concept with knowledge of the game mechanics the only thing separating skilled players from the pack. I never thought I would have so much fun chasing a ball around a park with an RC car. Rocket League is a great game and evidence that fun gameplay still trumps all.

review: The best multiplayer game to play hands down. Whether it's with your friends your family or just some random people from across the world you'll always have an insane amount of just pure fun. And it doesn't matter if you're a pro or a rookie you're gonna have a blast no matter how you play. You'll have crazy stories to tell and great memories to remember of all the good times and all the times you couldn't stop laughing and smiling.Plus there's always a steady stream of FREE content updates! Whether it be new maps new modes or crazy new concepts and new ways to play it's all free for every player to enjoy. And the car packs you can buy are actually pretty awesome and are not very expensive and are COMPLETELY optional. And the in game bonuses you unlock after every match make it so you're even rewarded for just having fun. That sounds like a pretty good system if you ask me.In the end you'll never regret spending a single moment playing this game. Two thumbs up for me.

review: Rocket League is the sequel to a PSN game that no one bought and centers around rocket powered cars playing soccer. It is easily one of the best multiplayer games released in 2015 that is simple to get into and hard to master.Pros +The game mechanics are solid and the controls are wonderful+18 different cars to choose from with a ton of customization options (paint job decals wheels rocket trails toppers antennas) and over ten thousand combinations+Ranked and Casual online playlists with match ups of 1v1 2v2 3v3 and 4v4.+Unique modes such as Snow Day (where you play with a Hockey Puck) Hoops (where you have to have to dunk the ball to score it) and Rocket Labs (where each map is a unique design that forces you to play differently)+You can save replays of your matches and name them so they're easily identified+Stats Leaderboards &amp League Rankings+There are bots to play against offline to practice against+A training mode to practice different maneuvers in the game and get better at the game+Splitscreen multiplayer with up to 4 players+An exhibition mode where you can customize the physics match length max score ball size and other options+The soundtrack is amazing and you'll instantly want to go out and buy it.+The game looks qonderful and has a vibrant color scheme+You can get all of the modes and maps in the game without buying the DLC all the DLC is based around cars and car customization options so you're not required to buy it to unlock portions of the game+The developers are still adding content(maps and modes) to the gamePro/Con Contains Loot Boxes but it's just aesthetic related items Cons The matchmaking system goes down every now and then requiring a fix Matchmaking will ocassionally pair you with teammates or adversaries who don't match your skill level at all often putting you in situations where you're entirely outmatched The community can be toxic spamming the chat yelling at you fo rno reason or leaving a match mid game (ruining a ranked game) Really a multiplayer only game so if you want any sort of single player experience this game doesn't have itOverall this is a fantastic multiplayer experience and I have sunk hundreds of hours into it.The core game is fun to play and it's filled with features and customization.
title: Rocket League®

review: I absolutely love Rocket League this fast paced sports game is the first "FIFA NBA2k15 and NFL" like game I can actually get behind. The DLC's are amazing but dont make the game pay to win. It is everything I was looking for in a game. I spend $60 on a new game and keep finding myself longing to score another ariel or to dribble the ball over an enemy into the goal. I REALLY suggest playing with a controller because I personally couldnt play with a keyboard. I have bought this game for two of my friends with the catch that if they like it they have to pay me back for it. I have yet to not get my money back! Its the best game for the price for sure! I would risk to say that it beats out everything except fallout haha no matter the price.

review: From what I've played this game is fantastic. There's a variety of different modes and it's a fun casual game to play when bored. However one aspect is infuriating if not game breaking. When a player leaves in the middle of a game there is an AI that plays in their stead. This would be fine if the AI acted like a normal player. The problem is players are very inaccurate and programmed inaccuracy can never be equal to the inaccuracies of human error. As a result the AI is either overpowered or terrible. I was playing a game and we scored in the first thirty seconds or so. A player on the enemy team left. The AI who replaced it proceeded to score five goals by the end of the game with it's teamates scoring zero goals and it blocking essentially every shot we took. I would most certainly recommend this game and I would most certainly recommend that if an AI is on the other team you should leave immediately.
title: Rocket League®

review: Coming from a somewhat simulation y background I didnt think this game would be very good. I thought it would one of those 0.1 hour games where you play it for 10 minutes and then forget about it in your steam library. I WAS WRONG. THIS GAME IS AMAZING. After doing some flight simulation which can be quite stressful or just coming back from work I can have a little fun and relax by playing some quick 5 minute carball games.Psyonix have nailed this game. They have succeeded where others have failed. They have managed to make a new style car game that is cross platform. There was nothing better than 1v1ing my friend who was on ps4 and winning to prove that PC MASTER RACE will always beat the console peasants. Pros fun cars quick (5 minute rounds perfect for small breaks at work xD) online (The servers on this game are amazing. I have had no lag issues and it rarley takes me more than 30 seconds to connect onto a serverCons 5 minute rounds at work turn more into (OH SH!T I have just missed my meeting) too addictingSummaryBUY IT!!!JUST BUY IT!!!
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is amazing. It's easy to jump into and learn to play but there is so much room for skill improvement. It creates a wide variety of play styles and creates an awesome online atmosphere.

review: This game is literally worth every penny. I've never enjoyed a game so much with my friends since Smash Bros. The game is very simple and easy yet it takes a bit of skill to do a couple fancy tricks. The graphics are great not realistic but it fits the theme of the game perfectly. This game will make you laugh smile and especially freak out at all the goals you will make yet you had no idea how you did it. It'll be even more fun playing with your friends. You can set up a nice shot for your buddy to make or you can just touch the ball last to get the goal even though your friend did entirely the work. OR even better block his shot. However the only problem I do have is with the bots of the game. In online multiplayer if a player is missing in a team then a bot takes its place. And i have to say these bots are op as hell. They practically never miss and don't even need the rest of the team. Anyways it is an amazing game definitely worth every cent. Don't even wait for the sales. BUY IT NOW DRating 9/10 (bots are too op)

review: Rocket League is CS GO with its competitiveness/team driven game play without the stupid randomness and raging and with a more relaxed and laughable/enjoyable environment.I think when most people first seen this game they thought "how can this basic game possibly be worth while and fun?". But after just putting a couple hours into this game it is nothing but boring or lame it is refreshing! The game is fast paced and a blast. It takes a bit of time to get used to maneuvering and how to do everything and whatnot but that just makes it all the better. Like I said the game is refreshingly enjoyable A.K.A. not the same old crap. Props to Psyonix (Developer of Rocket League and Nosgoth and other games). They appear to be doing some great things. Rocket League and Nosgoth both are simple concepts but yet very fun games (Nosgoth just doesnt have enough playerbase unfortunately). Plus they've got some of the best experience with the Unreal Engine! ) I'd love to see some more great games come from them to Steam for PC gaming in the future!Well worth the $20!
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is incredibly addictive oftentimes this game makes me regret having a job a house a wife and a corporeal body.There are approximately three actions in this game drive boost and jump. After mastering the basic maneuvers you can start to create more advanced tactics. In any given match you might come across a player doing something you didn't think was possible. In the next match that player will come across a player doing something (s)he didn't think was possible.This game deserves your money.

review: I don't like football games. I am not that fussed about car games either but football with cars that have rocket engines!? SOLD!Pros Solid and fun skill based gameplay. A very steady learning curve that will see you getting better the more you play. I have a fair few hours in this game and I am still learning. A large playerbase. Cross platform to both XBone and PS4 players (Although cross platform partying up isn't possible yet). Free content updates every few months with new features gamemodes arenas etc. Up to 4 player split screen for those who like local gaming with friends. Has a ranked matchmaking system and leaderboards for those who care about that sort of thing. Along with ranked rewards at the end of each season. Highly customisable cars. Free cars and "Common"cosmetic items drop for you after every match until you unlock all of the base stuff. "Uncommon" and "Rare" items also have a chance of dropping too. Player trading for cosmetics too. (Only between players on the same platform). Private matches with editable mutators which are quite customisable and allow for some ridiculous matches. There is a single player tournament style mode against AI too.Cons Addicting.General notes Microtransactions in the form of the typical "Crate and Key" system containing cosmetics. DLC Cars are available to purchase too as another cosmetic option. Play this game with a controller for the best experience.
title: Rocket League®

review: This game is like crack cocaine with some caveats. One only play online. Playing the single player campaign while good for practice ends up being really boring and will over inflate how good you think you are. You aren't. Two server issues. I live in Asia and its a right nightmare having to deal with the ping when playing the US EU and Oceania servers. Especially in a game like this where it's extremely important to aim and line up your flight path with the ball (yes flight path. rarely do i find myself driving). Now that we're done with the bad what does this game do good? Its a simple game with simple easy to understand controls and straightforward gameplay mechanics. Normally this will make for a terrible boring game but in this case the game excels for one reason. Its incredibly difficult to master. You might watch Kronovi do some insane cross field aerial volley while going backwards and think ah that doesnt look to hard I can do that. And then you can't. And end up hitting an own goal instead. Goddamit Carl. Now I've wasted enough time explaining this game. TL DR if you're looking for a fun game with short rounds that you can just pick up and play and that has a burgeoning multiplayer scene this is for you.

review: Bought this because it was on sale and I have friends that played it already. That said it is so much fun! There's a learning curve but it is by no means too steep. It is also great how innovative they were by allowing cross platform play (PCs playing with PS4s) although one slight improvement on that would be the ability to form parties with my friends that play on PS4. As is we have to make a private match to play together. That is my only complaint but I understand those kinds of things can be difficult to implement. UPDATE 1 I now have 54 hours logged. Haven't eaten or seen daylight for two whole day. Please send help. Also it's effing soccer/hockey with rocket powered cars PLUS the new power ups in rumble mode. Effing get it already!

review: Edit 6/11/2016Game keeps crashing after 30 mins of gameplay... only game in my library that does this and it started after season two. Online killed this game. Especially rankedThis games community is absolutely awful. You own teammates will most likely be the main issue as they have been for me. If you hate preteens and kids who think they are God and threatening to kill you and let's not forget wannabe professionals who think yelling at other players in all caps even if that team is winning then you should stay away.This is no doubt a fun game. The community though has made me reconsider it though. Single player is almost nonexistent. I'm serious. The day you get this game is the day you're done with playing offline. You'll get online and then realize how thick the demise is in the community. If you find anyone decent you'll need to friend them and hope that they will always play with you... until you want to see how good you compare against others.... onto ranked mode... see what happened there?Since this game is 10% offline and 90% online I can't truly recommend this game because how bad it is playing with people (ranked or not).0 Game changed on ranked and even online. All the major A holes left or decided to grow up. Much more enjoyable. YAY! And this season hasn't crashed like before (Season 3)
title: Rocket League®

review: Easy to learn difficult to master. Do the tutorials to learn the basics of driving jumping and maneuvering the ball then refine your moves in free play. Apparently you can fly if you time for jumps and boosts correctly. Practice your jumping I can't stress this enough. Practice your boost management. Practice driving on the walls. Practice using the ball camera wisely. Then jump into a match. I found the matchmaking to be pretty decent. As a rookie or semi pro I wasnt ever matched with anyone higher than that. I tend to play late at night when all the vulgar kiddies have been tucked in and read their stories so not alot of toxicity. It's an online game as with all things online there will be trolls. Played this on the free weekend and had a blast. The price tag isn't too steep ($20)Lots of fun if you don't take it (or yourself) too seriously.
title: Rocket League®

review: Just played for the free weekend. I like football (soccer) not terribly good at it IRL. Maybe because I don't run into people and blow them up in order to take control of the ball. But in Rocket League I can with a little rocket boost! Plus do crazy aerial stunts that I could only wish I had the skill to do IRL. This game makes me feel like I can rock at football! Haven't felt this good since I used to dominate the foosball table during our lunch break in high school! Since I don't have room for a foosball table in my apartment this will suffice. Take my money Rocket League.

review: The game feels unfinsihed and it should considering that the game was never meant to be (solely) about cars playing soccer. The "mini game" of soccer was just so popular among the development team that they abandoned the main game due to low interest. The "physics" work and are satisfying for what they are but there are no numbers accounting for the weight of an object. This is why things feel floaty and what allows for flight at the same rate as ground travel. Again not really an issue since the game works and the physics in place are satisfying. An engine accounting for real physics would likely not be much fun in this context. I recommend this game because it eventually gets fun when you learn to control your car and the ball with much more precision. The skill floor is incredibly unrewarding and if you're unfamiliar with the game you'll likely spend a lot of time just crashing into the ball hoping for the best. It's definitely more fun to play with friends whether that be competetive or not. So my recommendation is based on the fun you can have with friends and not so much anything else. Ranks are an unrewarding grind but that can be said of any game. Winning and seeing that green division up after four consecutive wins feels good but your next unlucky game causing a division down is disheartening. It's not that it's unfair losing is losing winning is winning and if you want to judge your skills accordingly you partner with someone you trust to be at an equal skill level and let come what may. The issue is the crapshoot of solo queue. Whether it be someone afk someone far above or below your skill bracket or someone assisting your/the enemy team. This isn't the fault of the developers or any systems in place it just exists and makes the game a less enjoyable experience. TL DR Cars flySoccerFun with friendsDon't talk to strangers.
title: Rocket League®

review: So this game can be a LOT of fun when played with decent human beings. Unfortunately half the time you end up in games with people who continuously insult everyone including their own teammates (sometimes before the game even begins) spam simply stop playing without leaving outright sabotage their own team every possible opportunity or intentionally making everyone wait the full minute after the game before leaving (which is still better than them joining the next game right before the minute is up to just stand there and do nothing which also happens but not as often).I found that this negative behavior is especially prevalent on European servers. Sure there is an option to report them but from the looks of it this does not have any effect and if it does I don't even dare to think how the situation would be without it.Once you get matched with and against good people just stick with them otherwise you're guaranteed to leave the game annoyed. I suppose indirectly that's also the reason why the matchmaking has a hard time finding people of similar skill level a lot of the time.At the time of writing there also seem to be issues with the (SE) Asian servers since I have a friend over there that would rather play with a 300ms ping on a European or Middle Eastern server than joining one in their region where second long desyncs randomly start happening every few seconds.And then there's also the issue with family sharing smurf accounts trying to ruin it for newcomers. Seriously creating a new steam account just to score some easy wins for a change? Grow up.Overall a very nice product (virtually perfect actually) with some minor server issues but unfortunately an outstandingly bad community that totally ruins the game. Edit There's an option to completely disable chat now which makes the game a lot more enjoyable and the new rumble mode is pretty light hearted which is nice.
title: Rocket League®

review: Almost 450 hours into the game and I still keep coming back for more. The devs are responsive careful in crafting and have a care for the competitive balance of the game. The community has been very helpful as well with tutorial videos and custom training modules popping up to spread knowledge on high level techniques.This is my go to game for that "just one more round" feeling. It has what feels like limitless depth but is digestable enough for quick sessions as well as competitive broadcasting. The trading and item system is its own separate meta game and has me happily giving the devs additional support by way of key purchases. I need those purple items!!If any gameplay you've seen has been even remotely interesting or entertaining to you pick this game up.
title: Rocket League®

review: this. game. is. soccer and driving combined. For those who enjoy high octane reckless driving and the world's most popular sport Rocket League is for you. This cross genre arena battler is the latest craze on Steam PS4 and Xbox One. Fun for all players and abilities the game offers both a casual and competitive atmosphere as well as a ton of laughs.The sequel to Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars Rocket League was released on July 7 2015 on the PC and PS4 and Xbox One on February 17 2016.It should be noted that this game can be played across PC and PS4 and PC and Xbox One allowing for more users to connect through different hardware.(source http //rocketleague.wikia.com/wiki/Rocket_League_Wiki)

review: This game is great in more ways then I can discribe. The core of the game is simple. It's soccer. It'd defies any borders or barriers. If two people know what soccer is and know how to play they can play together no matter what the circumstances. This simple premise makes the game easy to pick up and fun to play with anyone. It's so well polished that the game has a high enough skill cieling to keep people playing. There is always something more to learn more to perfect. It's easy to play hard to master and quick. Most games don't last more than 7 minutes so you can jump in and knock out a game and if you don't want to keep playing you can switch right inot something else. But you will want to keep playing. This game is simple addictive and incredibly fun.

review: Honest Review Review is based on current state of game.Game Pros Highly Addicting Split Screen Multiplayer 60 FPS (Its capped but unlockable if you really want more frames. But 60 is just swell) Supports In game voice/text chat Low ping (Make sure to select your region in the server filters) Clean Interface Smooth Gameplay Customizable cars (You can even give them hats!) In game replay recorder (Just hit "save replay" after any match) Incredible visuals Controller support (The game suggests to use a controller but honestly the keyboard works perfectly. All preference)Game Cons Slight lag after letting go of the VoIP button (F) No punishment for players abandoning a match Reports of crashing/freezing while watching replays Has the chance of crashing/losing connection after a round if you're in a group and not the party leaderRelateable Games Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Power Battle CarsConclusionRocket League is an amazing game. You know those games that you play while you should be going to bed? That's this game. Only 90 minutes into the game and i've already had so much fun with it. I would honestly reccomend this game to anyone. Unless you REALLY hate soccer and you simultaneously REALLY hate cars.(If you found this review helpful consider giving it a thumbs up!)Looking for steam friends? Add me!

review: I have never enjoyed sports games... But I LOVE Rocket League. It is truly my favorite game of all time I have racked up hundreds of hours on Xbox One and can now enjoy it on my new PC build and it still feels like it will never get old.It strikes the perfect medium between competitiveness and simple pleasure. You have the freedom to play stress free in social unranked matches or test your skills in competitive ranked.Everything from the visuals to the sound effects and music in this game are absolutely perfect and stunning.Psyonix has been an amazing dev team and truly cares about the community and what we want. They're constantly rolling out updates and new features (nothing that could possibly upset anyone or "ruin" the game in any way just more to enjoy). I will be a life long customer and supporter and always reccomend Rocket League to anyone I know who enjoys video games.

review: I cannot recommend this game enough. Yes I didn't play it much recently as I was busy with some Assassin's Creed and MGSV. But that's what's beautiful about it after you've played the game for some time you can just come back to it for a match or two. Won't talk too much of the constant work the devs put in adding new maps cars and even gamemodes every now and then to praise the overall entertaining gameplay which is as addicting as you've surely heard.Before you buy this game just note one thing singleplayer isn't all that fun. Yeah sure it's a bit of a challenge in the beginning but just like in Fifa the real deal and real fun is in multiplayer so you'll need an okay wifi connection.EDIT 3 months after this review was written. I play RL pretty regularly now. It gets really good when... well when you git gud and start scoring some awesome goal. Recommending it even more expressively than before.

review: Great game but there is only one problem you will find with this community. You've got the quiet players They dont say anything You've got the Nice players These treat you good and act like a real person They help you with problems and more. The Cursers These players are one of the worst They useally shout " you" "Get cancer" And stuff like that. Then there is the cringy player This one will spam messages like "Almost" or they will make a goal and act like they are the best They also spam "ez" at the end of a game (And use alot of smileys like ) xD) Then last but not least there is the "I know im better" Well these are quite rare but they will usually say stuff like when they make a goal "1" And if they make another "2" Or they will say omg you are really bad (When you are winning). But besides that its a great game. Especially with friends

You see I was afraid it was just another sport game with a bit of twist (and just a quick note I hate most sport games). But after being pushed by a few friends to try it out with them during the free weekend I was hooked. This isn't really the kind of game that one can critique too much. It's simply a fun action packed multiplayer game that I definitely recommend trying out.
